story:
Yusuf's Classic Studio

Joe Chapman aka Yusuf Afox'e is a talented artist who has been creating expressive, thought-provoking, and beautiful works using the classic studio and tools shown above.  (I know.  I know.  Crunch Berries?  Who would've thought it.)

In 2012, he discovered Facebook and began sharing a sampling of his work "electronically". 

Then, during a recent family get-together, he was shown a couple of YouTube videos about digital drawing pads. 


Yusuf lit up with excitement like a little kid and kept saying, "THAT'S how they do it! I've got to get one of those! I could do all kinds of things with it!"

A few of us decided to do a crowdfund campaign to raise the funds because Yusuf is a creative spirit among us and will bless the world with even more of his works.  This will be a surprise for Yusuf because he does not know we are launching this crowdfund campaign. 

We need your help.

From Classic to Digital Studio

The goal is to help Yusuf expand his creative tools and enable him to also do digital artwork.  Once we raise the funds, we will help Yusuf locate and select the right digital drawing pad for him.  We will then help him install and connect to his computer.  (I know. I know.  But he is an artistic genius.  He found Facebook in 2012.  Need I say more?)   This will give him more creative tools and options.  

Personalized Perks 

Many of the perks will consist of digital portraits :

  • Digital images YOU SUBMIT to use with digital holiday greeting cards.
  • Original digital caricatures based upon photos emailed FROM YOU.
  • Original digital portraits based upon photos provided by YOU, the contributors.

A portrait Yusuf made of his sister.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Will you help us to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign for Yusuf?

story:
Whats it about?

My name is Alex CF and I am the curator of the Merrylin Cryptid collection. This is an extraordinary collection of mythical creatures, preserved specimens of species thought to be no more than myth and legend. 

I want to establish a museum in London, presenting these fascinating creatures to the public.

What is the Merrylin Cryptid Museum?

Thomas Merrylin left a legacy of untold mysteries in the sealed cellar space of a London Townhouse. Discovered in 2006 when this building was due for demolition, the Merrylin Cryptid Collection is a fascinating and bizarre cavalcade of biological specimens - of species unknown by mainstream science. Not only are the specimens well preserved, but each has its own story to tell - its own biology, anatomy and natural history, many of which were painstakingly analysed and researched by Thomas Merrylin himself, a man born in 1782, and last seen alive in 1942. The enigma of this man and his specimens is somewhat unfathomable..


Above is a piece of concept art for the Museum which will be created in a suitable space in East London, with easy access to public transport. We will seek a victorian building or space of complimentary aesthetic. Most of the specimens are presented in their original victorian cases and therefor part of the magic is in its form, so that those who visit are transported to such a time when the world was still filled with wonder and intrigue, and monsters lurked on unknown continents. 


The museum will house many specimens, from Dragons and Vampires, to objects of lost civilisations, antiquities of unknown origin and the research and paraphernalia of many a shunned and eccentric scientist and explorer. The collection flirts with known characters from fictional tales which begs the question of whether our greatest fictions were fictions at all. The darkest corners of Lovecraft and the adventures of Edgar Rice Burroughs would find themselves at home at the Merrylin Cryptid Museum. 

We will have many special events in the museum, and out of the museum. We will have special tours, visiting the haunts of Thomas Merrylin in London, we will have evening lectures on the collection itself, and of course, the main event, where we will dissect one of the larger specimens before an audience. 


We also wish to establish a link to conservation. All of the species presented in the collection are now believed to be extinct, and therefor we wish to draw attention to the species we share the planet with, those who will become myth and legend within our life times. It is important that we distinguish our desire to know that which no longer exists, or indeed never existed at all, and that which is very much alive. 


Where will my money go?

You will be contributing to something quite unique - a Museum filled with Monsters! 

Have you ever wondered what a werewolf really looks like?

Ever wanted to see the skull of a vampire?

or peer at the anatomy of a dragon? 

You will help us open a space filled with gruesome glimpses of unknown species, your contribution will help us construct its interior, and most important of all, bring the specimens out of hiding and give them a new home, filled with a  dark and sumptuous Dickensian atmosphere. Your donation will allow us to present these aged monsters of a bygone age, and paint a visceral and immersive experience.

We have a property manager seeking a space whilst we run this campaign, we have a team of set designers and carpenters ready and waiting, as soon as we reach our target and obtain suitable premises work will begin! 


What else can I do?

Please spread the word! The museum can only exist with your support so please, it would be very much appreciated if you could share this page on twitter, facebook or any other social networking you can think of or indeed, use! thank you!

Whats next?

If we manage to get the funding we shall find a building suitable for such a project, and we will bring the Merrylin Cryptid museum to life! If we make it half way we shall organise a fabulous extended exhibition so that the specimens can be seen by the public.

Please, if you can spare a little, help bring this terrifying, fascinating collection to the public. You can find out a great deal of information at my curator website - www.alexcf.com. 

You can also watch the introductory video, made by BBC natural history film maker Simon Lewis here. It will give you a taste of what is yet to come..


Thank you for your time,

Alex CF

Curator

story:
Antonio Maggi - Imagine - Art Exhibition 

Antonio’s newest collection of abstract/figurative paintings is an explosion of colours and forms.

This  is a visualisation of the artist's deepest thoughts and emotions, a surreal journey in the oneiric. 

The artwork is produced in acrylic and oil  on canvas.

"I am an independent artist and yearn for the freedom to express my art without the influence of commercial world of private galleries. That is why this project and its success is very important to me."

www.antoniomaggi.com

Antonio Maggi Facebook art page

email address





  • Antonio Maggi was Born in Bergamo (Italy) in 1968 and studied Fine Art at the School of Fine Arts of Brera in Milan (Italy), graduating in 1992. 

    He has studied and worked with different media: painting, photography, printmaking, cartoons, graphic design, and has been involved in many art projects in England, Croatia, Holland and Italy.

    At present he is working as a Painter, Graphic Designer and Photographer in London.

  • Exhibitions

  • 2013 Alchemy,  Art Pavilion, London

    2013 Now & then, Art Pavilion, London

    2012 Antonio Maggi,  WAC Gallery, London

    2011 Devil Inside,  WAC Gallery, London

    2009 Visions of blue, Battersea Gallery, London 

    2008 Welcome! Saint Peter’s Church, London

    2007 Duel! Private space, London

    2005 Little tales from the mountains, Italian Institute, London/Amsterdam 

    2005 England! The Priory Pub, London

    2005 Portraits , Arcotel, Zagreb

    2005 Urban Landscapes, Arcotel, Zagreb

    2002 Dreams, nightmares and other stories, London College of           Communications, London

    1999 Photos & paintings, Oval Theatre, London

    1998 Villages, Angel Pub, London

    1995 Southwark open 95, Southwark Gallery, London

    1989 Termine, Galleria Neri, Turin



What I Need & What You Get

This money will help in paying for:

- Gallery hire

- Advertising (Invitations, posters and banners)

- Financial support for time spent at the gallery for the duration of the exhibition (time off work).

- refreshments for the private view (wine, beer, soft drinks and nibbles)

- arts materials such as canvases, paint and brushes.

You will be able to experience my art in one of the most exciting art gallery in centre London.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    - You can help me at the private view

    - Use your social media profiles and get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

story:
I'm Riccardo Fabiani, italian illustrator and traveller. When I was a child, I've learned that drawing is the best way to communicate with the world. Since then, I never stopped.
I kept sketchbooks and diaries during my travels around the world, and I've tried to capture unique moments: places, people. After ten years of adventures and marvels, I'm ready to put the pieces togheter and see the whole picture, that in my case, it will be a book.

A carnet de voyage, studded of short stories and poems but mostly made of drawings and images.
In these pages packed of events you can perceive the strain of travel. A visual stratification that leads to an emotional one.

A very personal work that gives you the taste of a peek thru the secrets of a stranger, or maybe, of a friend not meet yet. Maybe you will find that the real travel has not started yet.


Travel sketchbooks has gained quite an exposure during the last five years but here in Italy there is not a specific publishing branch yet.

  • ”Road Trippin” will be the name of my first selfproduced drawing book, that may eventually lead to a series, from other authors also.
  • Tech info: pocket-edition 14,8 x 21 cm, color prints, matte paper gr.120, perfect binding, cover gr.170, first run 500 copies. Language: italian.
    Inside the book there will be some postcards not glued, gr.200, 10 x 13 cm, color print.
  • If the goal of the crowdfunding will be reached, it will take about 40 days to print the first run.
I choose to crowdfund this project to keep it real and free, to avoid any restriction about style or content from an editor.
You can contribute to my project with a donation here; you will receive great unique handmade perks, starting from € 1 euros.

1 euro for your name in the credits
5 euro buy a digital copy of "Road Trippin"
10 euro will get you an handmade printed bookmark
15 euro for a selection of digital hi-res illustrations and photos, postcard size.
20 euro for an original pencil hand-drawing
30 euro for a signed copy of the printed book
50 euro for all of the above.
100 for a commission portrait of you or someone you choose.
300 euro or more will make for an original oil-painting.
500 euro for a visit to your place, to sketch your surroundings and yourself and be a part of the book! (Europe only).
1000 euros, hey thank you! This will make for all of the above plus something special: check it out in the perks section.

Even if you can't donate, please share this campaign and help me by spreading the word around.

I always thought that a traveller who sketches, is travelling twice. Let me show you why. Donate now.

story:
Camp Create at the Museum of Art - DeLand

Established in 1951, the Museum of Art - DeLand is a vital, interactive non-profit community museum dedicated to the educational use of the fine arts. 

In addition to presenting several exhibits and related programming throughout the year, the Museum's in-house and outreach programming ranges from Arts on the Grow for five Pre-K Head Start Centers across Volusia County, monthly Family Fun Saturdays, Field Studies & Library Programs (K-12), Docent-led Tours, and, our signature summer program for ages 6 to 12, Camp Create. 

  • Each year the Museum of Art - DeLand tries to provide 50 to 60 Camp Create scholarships to children with financial needs, and last year we fell short of our goal, funding only 39 children.
  • Camp Create is a great platform for kids to explore ideas, study art history, learn art vocabulary and make connections between art and literacy through a variety of art media taught by professional art educators.
  • Camp Create has been a successful summer program (June to August) for nine years under the direction of an exceptional Curator of Education who receives valuable assistance from high school volunteers and college interns. (Read about the teachers and the education behind the works of art from 2014 Camp Create: http://goo.gl/wKxkm2 )
  • Camp Create initiates a life-long love of the arts, building a stronger culturally rich foundation for the whole family, and ensures humanities-based programming continues in our community.

Help Us Meet Our Goal

  • So, while we're one of the most affordable day camps in the area ($160 per child for one full week Monday to Friday, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.), there are many families who cannot afford this fee - a fee used soley to offset instructor tuition fees and art materials.
  • Imagine you provide a scholarship to a child who wouldn't otherwise be able to attend. The feeling is incredible. The total cost of 50 scholarships x $160 each = $8000. We have already raised $2460 locally, and for the difference ($5540) we are reaching outside of our small town asking you to be a part of this very special program to assist us in meeting our goal. Every single donation, no matter what the amount, is greatly appreciated.  
  • In return, we would link to the Funder's Page to share with others your generous support. And, if you're interested, we'd love to know why you chose to support the arts and Camp Create. It could end up in a future Museum eNewsletter or social media post. The Museum of Art - DeLand also publishes a year-end Camp Create Booklet http://goo.gl/wKxkm2 that dedicates a page to our donors, which would include you. Donors will have a chance at getting a rare poster or catalogue from a past Museum exhibition through a special drawing.
  • The Museum of Art - DeLand, Florida Inc. is recognized as Exempt under Section 501(c) 3 of the Internal Revenue Code. Donations are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.

The Impact

Your creative investment would be life-lasting. As the Camp Create video shows, children will make new friends while discovering new interests through learning many art techniques using various art mediums. As one collaborative work of art displayed last year at the year-end Camp Create Exhibition read "The 'EARTH' without 'ART' is just 'EH'!" 

The best thing of all is that Camp Create students experience the full power of art by engaging in a variety of activities that focus on art-integrated storytelling, history and the elements of art. Like music and dance, creating visual art doesn't just satisfy the creative spirit, it nurtures the developing mind and complements fundamental educational skills. To enable a child to attend Camp Create at the Museum of Art - DeLand - a child who could not otherwise afford such an experience essential to the learning process - is an investment worth making and to be very proud of making. 

Thank you for sharing our story with others.

story:
#EversonActually

This Valentine's Day, spread the love by donating to the #EversonActually campaign. Contributions help provide the following services to our CNY community:

  • Art classes for children and adults
  • New and exciting exhibitions
  • Tours for families, individuals, and school groups
  • Care of our amazing permanent collection

Update 2/12/15:

We absolutely love our supporters! You've helped us reach our first funding goal for #EversonActually! So, what's next? Exciting news:

 You can play a vital role in bringing fresh new artwork to the Everson.

We've decided that every dollar raised above our goal will be specifically earmarked for commissioning artists to create new works for us! Now is a great time to donate and become a part of something very special for our community. Remember, every little bit helps. Love is in the air!

The start of a beautiful relationship!

  • As little as $5 from each of our followers could make a HUGE impact.
  • Perks will connect you to the Everson in new ways.
  • Funds will ensure the continuation of current programming and create new opportunities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't make a contribution right now? It's OK, you can still help!

  • Share our videos and make some noise about our campaign! Post on your social media or send it in emails to your friends and family. Use this link to direct people to our fundraising page: http://igg.me/at/eversonactually 
  • Tag friends and challenge people to make a $5 donation or share themselves. See how much your circle of friends can raise!

As little as $5 from each of our followers could make a HUGE impact.
Perks will connect you to the Everson in new ways.
Funds will ensure the continuation of current programming and create new opportunities.

  
Other Ways You Can Help

 Can't make a contribution right now? It's OK, you can still help!  Share our videos and make some noise about our campaign! Post on your social media or send it in emails to your friends and family. Use this link to direct people to our fundraising page: http://igg.me/at/eversonactually  Tag friends and challenge people to make a $5 donation or share themselves. See how much your circle of friends can raise!

story:
MUCHAS GRACIAS, GRACIAS A VOSOTROS " THE LAST BATTLE - ALLIANCE OF BLOOD" SE HA CONSEGUIDO.

THANKS YOU , THANKS YOU " THE LAST BATTLE - ALLIANCE OF BLOOD" HAS BEEN ACHIEVED


In a world, where the dark forces are eager to claim the absolute power, the evil summons its forces to destroy the race of men, elves, hobbits, dwarfs, separated years ago due to their own greed.

Today they unite for the final fight.

Today is the day, today is going to be the last battle. Today the destiny of every nation, every life, your life…is at stake.

“Ready to enter the battle?”

The Last Battle-Alliance of blood is the new and latest Ares Mythologic- Draconia project to raise funds for the development and production of our most spectacular The Last Battle-Alliance of blood series of miniatures in 75mm, cast in resin of the highest quality.



Inspired by what would only be a fragment of the final battle between races against the armies of darkness, the designs come from the masterful hand of Beni Lobel, designer / illustrator for publishers like IDW, Dynamite, Random House, Titan Comics or DC comics and characters as GI Joe, Constantine, Batman, JLA and TV series for Warner and BBC as Smallville, Arrow, Fringe, Vampire Diaries, True Blood, Torchwood, and in films such as After Earth,

The sculptures are modeled in high detail 3D by Laslo Forgach, digital sculptor of great experience working for large international companies, and will be printed using the most advanced technology to ensure the perfect quality of the original. This project can become a reality if you want it to, and the whole team of The Last Battle wants you to be a part of it. We need you to make this project a reality!!

These are the Last Battle characters:

ARHNARMO,

ARHNARMO, son of Lothur Hin, commander of purple elf armies, and Nhamir, The Queen of the Woods. Born from the union of a lothuriel and a human, he is the only non-elf who commands one of the Purple Legions, thanks to his bravery and determination.


Now, in these times of war and death, his mission is very clear: to destroy the armies of darkness… but he needs you in his legion!!


---------

ISHANDRA , Captain of the Purple Elven Legion. Her legion campaigned tirelessly against the forces of darkness. Ishandra is the first to jump in the fight on the battlefield,  making her a great value of all the soldiers.



---------


OURH-HUG,


Orc army commander wildest, the Acrothe-yrt.

OURH-HUG, just wants blood. He does not care who you are. He wants to see his axe stained with the blood of his enemies, or even some of his soldiers,  who dare to violate their orders, or simply have not fought well. His followers fear him so much, they'd rather die in  battle, if necessary, just to avoid punishment.

The bravest soldiers enjoy privileges, more powerful, more loot, more jugs of wine, more human and elven slaves.

 OURH-HUG always needs more soldiers... are you ready?


---------

KURU-U, slave-born of the armies. KURU-U has hardened in the fierce battles and his greatest wish is to sleep in the mud tied to his master, Ourh-hu


THE LAST BATTLE - ALLIANCE OF BLOOD


As you fund the campaign, more warriors will join the battle! Select and unlock your avatar, and sponsor these new characters for the final battle to get more gifts!

(SHIARY)     SWEET LOOK- ARROW WILD



We are leaders in high quality figures, in white metal and resin. Our designs are always made by the best professionals, you like our girls? or maybe our Romans? on our website you can find all kinds of figures on scales 35mm, 54mm, 75mm
All of our figures are available kits to assemble and paint.

we have more than 7 years in the market.
www.aresmythologic.com

We are sure that you will enjoy painting the figures of this project, make it possible

Design The Last Battle

---------
Voice of elves and men

---------
The Light of the ancients

---------
Sweet look - arrow wild
45€

-------------
The Primal beast

---------
Big Nose

---------
Dance of the hope

---------
Dance of the steel

---------
Dance of the dead

---------
Pretty faces

---------
The Last Battle

---------
The artist treasure



Goals are gifts for the backers that decide to support this project. For example, if you decide that Ishandra, Light of the ancients must join your army, you will receive for free the goal A. And if you decide to pick "the last battle" perk, you will receive goal A, goal B and goal Kuru-u the goblin! 


Goal "A"

---------

Goal "B"

---------

Goal Kuru-u goblin

---------

Goal "C"

---------

Goal "D"

"Groahal dead" 32mm

---------

Goal "E"

Bust anatomy 1/12



------
You can contribute as many times as you want, we will group all your contributions to joining the gift goals achieved. ¿Are you ready for the Last Battle?


The team last battle
Jose Jarque
Beni Lobel
Laslo Forgach
Toni Nieto
Marc Masclans
Big Child ( resin cast)

story:
A year ago, we got introduced to some Japanese poems written by a zen monk Enku. We were quite surprised by the special quality of Enku's poetry. The poems were simple and yet powerful, short and yet intense, spiritual and yet very realistic. We decided to explore their great musical potential by putting them into music. 

Judith and myself had already been working together on several occasions but never as composers. So we saw this project as a wonderful opportunity to deepen our artistic collaboration. 

We both already had a great interest for the Japanese culture . Judith  has been studying Zen meditation for a couple of years now and as far as I am concerned, Japanese composers such as Joe Hisaishi and Nobuo Uematsu has always been a major source of inspiration.This field what therefore an ideal set to meet.

During this process we have been guided by a Japanese coach Noriko Yamasaki and a zen monk Julian Daizan Skinner who was the first one to introduce Enku's poetry in Europe. It took us six months of intense work before achieving the cycle.

So we selected a dozen of poems and with those, we composed a cycle of six songs called In Heaven's River. 

Here are the names of the songs :

1 Teru Tsuki To - Shining Moon 

2 Mikage - Honorific Statue 

3 Kokoro no hito ni  - For someone in my heart 

4 Aki kaze - Autumn wind 

5 Hatsu Yuki - First Snow

6 Haru Kureba - When springtime comes 

IF YOU WANT TO LISTEN TO AN EXTRACT OF THOSE , JUST CHECK THE LINK BELOW 

https://soundcloud.com/user-558197034

The premiere of this cycle took place in September 2015 in the Steiner Theatre in London  and the profits went for "Aid for Japan" caring for children orphaned in the Fukushima earthquake.

Working on this project and living for few months in Enku's world has been an extraordinary experience. We feel very blessed to have had the opportunity to walk on this musical journey .

https://www.facebook.com/Benjamin-Kahn-193856237466392/

https://www.facebook.com/judithcharronsoprano/?fref=ts

https://soundcloud.com/benjaminkahnmusic

http://www.judith-charron.com/

story:
My Story

In 1982, I had a dream in which I was told that I would be receiving an inheritance of great value from an unknown ancestor. Within a few days after that dream, through a series of synchronisic events, including a friend gifting me a Tarot, I realized that my inheritance was the Tarot. I had known about the Tarot before this but the magical events that were initiated by my dream focused my attention on the Tarot as never before and I came to see the deck as part of my personal spiritual journey. From that day on the Tarot has become the primary focus of my work as an artist, a scholar, and a philosopher.

In 1987, while studying an alchemical illustration representing the Philosopher's Stone, I had a revelation that this image was symbolically interchangeable with the Tarot's World card. This realization was like a key that opened a lock to a forgotten door. I sat mesmerized as images poured out of this new portal in my mind, forming a parade of alchemical illustrations that were spontaneously paired with Tarot trumps. It became obvious that the trumps can be alchemical, and that the series of trumps describes the alchemical Opus. This insight led me into more research, writing, and drawing and after eight years the result was The Alchemical Tarot. The Alchemical Tarot was originally published by Harper/Collins in London, in 1995.  That edition is now out of print but it became world famous and copies have sold for over $2,000. I recovered the rights to the deck and self-published three new editions.

Meanwhile, I continued to work on new decks and books.  I designed The Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery, The Tarot of the Saints, The Angels Tarot, The Buddha Tarot, and The Vampire Tarot. I authored The Tarot: History, Symbolism, and Divination, which the American Library Association said may be the best book ever written on the subject. I have taught about the Tarot in Australia, Italy, and throughout the USA; curated a Tarot exhibition for the LA Craft and Folk Art Museum; lectured regularly on the Tarot at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, appeared in documentaries produced by the BBC and independent film makers, and cut the ribbon at the opening of the Tarot Museum in Italy.  I have become recognized as an expert and a scholar of the Tarot.  But there is one mystery about the Tarot that I have continually tried to explore. I wanted to know what the artists who originally created the Tarot were thinking.


The Marziano Tarot

The oldest known Tarot, or the oldest ancestor of the Tarot, depending on your definition, was described in a 1449 letter by Jacopo Antonio Marcello to Queen Isabelle of Lorraine, in hopes of gaining her favor. Paul Durrieu first discovered this letter in 1895. Franco Pratesi brought an accurate account of this letter to the attention of playing card historians in 1989, and in 2003 Ross Caldwell made a new translation, which brought it further attention.

In the letter, Marcello described two decks that he was acquiring for the queen. Of the two decks, the older one was created between 1412 and 1425 for Filippo Maria Visconti (1392-1447), Duke of Milan from 1412 to 1447. This deck had trumps that consisted of sixteen classical gods, and did not follow the allegory that we now consider standard for a Tarot. The deck was designed by artist Michelino da Besozzo, working with a plan created by Marziano da Tortona, the Duke’s secretary, tutor, and astrologer. This is the oldest known deck to have trumps and, therefore, by my definition, is the oldest known Tarot.

According to Caldwell, the deck consisted of four suits, each with ten pips and a king and queen in the suit. The suit symbols were four different birds: eagles, phoenixes, turtledoves, and doves. Marziano, who wrote in great detail about the symbolism of the deck, specified that each suit was intended to represent a life goal or desire, grouped in two contrasting pairs. The deck also contained sixteen trumps composed of classical gods, which was not an unusual subject in Renaissance art. Besides forming a separate trump suit, four gods were assigned to each suit, with the gods representing appropriate qualities for each goal:

   Eagles, representing the life goal virtue, were assigned Jove, Apollo, Mercury, 

and Hercules.

   Phoenixes, representing the desire for riches, were assigned Juno, Neptune, Mars, and Aeolus.

   Turtledoves, representing the goal of chastity, were assigned Pallas, Diana, Vesta, and Daphne.

   Doves, representing the desire for sensuality, were assigned Venus, Bacchus,   Ceres, and Cupid.

The question of profundity in a game was also addressed in Marcello’s letter. The letter recounted the rhetorical question put to the Duke by the deck's intellectual designer, Marziano, who asked if it is fitting for a serious and virtuous man such as the Duke to spend time playing a card game. Marziano answered that it is fitting if the game is equally serious and virtuous in the philosophy that it presents. He felt that his game met that standard.

As stated above, Marziano wrote a great deal about the symbolism of the deck, but less on how the game was played. There is evidence to suggest that even at this early date, playing cards were used for divination, and Marziano’s concern with symbolism and his use of birds, which are connected with ancient augury, suggests that besides a trick-taking game he may have intended a divinatory use for the deck.

No cards exist from this deck and the originals were most likely hand painted and gilded like other Milanese 15th century decks created for royalty. I have redesigned the deck as if it became a standard deck that was later reproduced in woodcuts and hand colored. My images for the cards are based on Marziano’s descriptions as translated by Caldwell and on the woodcuts found in the 15th century Hypnerotomachia Poliphili, early printed cards, as well as other Renaissance sources. In the future, Caldwell will author a book to accompany the deck, which will be sold separately.  The cards measure four and three quarters inches by two and three quarters inches.  They will come in a tuck box with an eighteen-page little-white-book, with a color cover. 


The Gods


The Royals


Some Pips


The Box



What I Need and What You Get

This edition is already being printed and I need $5,000 for printing costs. If I do not receive all of this money, I will still print the edition and I will make up any balance in the payment myself. If you contribute you will receive your premiums.  If I receive more funds I will be able to do a larger printing and any donations over the amount needed for printing will function as preorders. After the deck is in print, I will be selling it through my website

Donate $30 plus shipping and you'll receive one deck

Donate $60 plus shipping and you will receive two decks

Donate $90 plus shipping and you will receive three decks

Donate $120 plus shipping and you will receive four decks

Donate $85 plus shipping and you will receive The Marziano Tarot with a copy of The Alchemical Tarot and my book, Alchemy and the Tarot.

Donate $60 plus shipping and you will receive The Marziano Tarot and The Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery


The shipping is the same on all of the perks above.

Donate $200 plus shipping and get ten Marziano Tarot decks, a special discount for a bulk order.

Donate $200 plus shipping and you will receive an archival art edition printed on rag paper with a custom-made portfolio cover of the sixteen Marziano gods  


Donate $600 plus shipping and you will receive an archival art edition of the entire Marziano deck printed on rag paper with a custom-made box.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to see the Marziano Tarot in print, please spread the word. Tweet, post to Facebook, your Wordpress blog, Aeclectic Tarot Forum, or any other media you have access to. Thank you for your encouragement and support.

story:
A little about us and what we do...

We are Le Rouge Designs, an Ithaca NY based custom stone mosaic art studio.

We opened up our studio on January 1, 2013. Our work is centered around the artistic talents of Nick Gilbert. An 11 year veteran, Nick creates mosaics unlike any other on our planet. Each stone is hand cut before it finds it's place in a work of art. These works can last hundreds if not thousands of years. 

There is a very important celebration of 40 years of Hip Hop culture happening in our town. We have been asked to create a piece inspired by Hip Hop. This mosaic will be included in an exhibit alongside some incredible artists from the world over. 

Your contribution will help us to create a piece of Hip Hop history that will last for hundreds of years.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Because we use natural stones and environmentally safe materials, and because of the size of the mosaic, the cost of such a piece is substantial. We need to acquire more materials to bring this piece to life.

These stickers and T-shirts are unique to this artwork and are being made especially for contributors to this campaign.

The custom mosaics will be a one of a kind art, constructed for you, that will last beyond your lifetime!

Even if we do not reach our goal we will use whatever funds we do receive towards completion of this project.

The Impact

When completed, this project will go on display in an exhibit that will express the importance of art, history, and Hip Hop to our community and beyond.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute funds at this time... No worries! you can still help us by sharing this campaign with your friends and family. Spread the good word!
story_txt:
A little about us and what we do...
We are Le Rouge Designs, an Ithaca NY based custom stone mosaic art studio.
We opened up our studio on January 1, 2013. Our work is centered around the artistic talents of Nick Gilbert. An 11 year veteran, Nick creates mosaics unlike any other on our planet. Each stone is hand cut before it finds it's place in a work of art. These works can last hundreds if not thousands of years. 
There is a very important celebration of 40 years of Hip Hop culture happening in our town. We have been asked to create a piece inspired by Hip Hop. This mosaic will be included in an exhibit alongside some incredible artists from the world over. 
Your contribution will help us to create a piece of Hip Hop history that will last for hundreds of years.
 


What We Need & What You Get
Because we use natural stones and environmentally safe materials, and because of the size of the mosaic, the cost of such a piece is substantial. We need to acquire more materials to bring this piece to life.
These stickers and T-shirts are unique to this artwork and are being made especially for contributors to this campaign.
The custom mosaics will be a one of a kind art, constructed for you, that will last beyond your lifetime!
Even if we do not reach our goal we will use whatever funds we do receive towards completion of this project.


The Impact
When completed, this project will go on display in an exhibit that will express the importance of art, history, and Hip Hop to our community and beyond.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute funds at this time... No worries! you can still help us by sharing this campaign with your friends and family. Spread the good word!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I'm Sammie. I've been performing comedy for 3 years now. 'Back2Basics' is my third one hour comedy show. Here's the blurb;

A bittersweet tale of political awakening. With nothing left to lose but everything to fight for, Samantha followed Russell Brand to the frontline of the revolution – a council estate in Barnet. An adventure through the Neverland of anarchy where squatters, families and activists unite in a battle to cover basic needs. There's no place like home. ‘The most endearing political activist I have ever met’ (Kate Copstick, Scotsman). ‘Hits a rich vein of dark humour, nicely crafted jokes with sharp timing (Times). ‘A compelling performer with a funny, well written set’ (One4Review.co.uk).

My last show 'Sextremist' received some nice reviews and press coverage, but during my time in Scotland I also learned that The Edinburgh Fringe is not an even playing field. Like in politics, it seems that the party with the most money wins! Its highly competitive and doesn't at all feel like a meritocracy; as middle class comedians with their bountiful wallets suppling them with armies of PR teams, Flyerers & promoters, or those with family connections seem to have an easier ride.

Not only did I struggle to compete for audience with my limited funds. I came up against hostility, not only from my venue due to loud club music but from other comedians too. I am bipolar, the Edinburgh Fringe is probably one of the most stressful experiences you can put yourself through. However, I love comedy and really want to share my truth and connect with people through this medium. Talking about mental health and the benefits system, my show this year has a message that needs to be heard.  Having my finances in place will greatly reduce the stress and help me build a supportive team.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking for donations to help cover all (or even just some) of the following costs:
Accommodation: £720
Travel: £150
Marketing: £400
Flyerer/Production Assistant: £500

Booking venues for preview plus marketing: £200

 

I've already paid for:
Outdoor Posters: £216
Director Fees: I've worked with my director Amanda Baker weekly since November.
Participants Fee: £300
Laughing Horse Registration: £95
Preview's Posters & Flyers: £30
Previews in: Leciester, Brighton and Manchester Fringe Festivals (as well as renting a theatre in London!) Around £400

Petrol to gigs and previews: (Hundreds!)

Total spent already: THOUSANDS! (Also 100s hours love labour,)

Perks!

I've got some awesome ''Perks'' available for you super-duper supporters this year!
Badges - Some unique badges so you can proudly display your kind-hearted, super, supportiveness wherever you go!
T-Shirts - Who wouldn't want to strut around with a fabulous love muffin on their belly? ;)
Guest for WIP - Essex, London and Manchester shows coming up.
Ed Show Seat Reservation - Get a front row, up close & personal seat for all the action! 
Signed Show Poster - What an investment! Feel free to sell on eBay for a stupidly large sum of money once I'm an A-List, comedy-genius superstar! ;)
Associate Producer Credits - Get a massive shout out every show for all y̶o̶u̶r̶ ̶h̶o̶u̶r̶s̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶h̶o̶u̶r̶s̶ ̶o̶f̶ ̶h̶a̶r̶d̶ ̶w̶o̶r̶k̶ money.
Private Preview - I'll come perform for you and your mates or at your club.
Dance Party - Hen party, birthday party? I can teach a variety of different classes including pole, burlesque and cheerleading.
Indian Head Massage - I am certified in this practice, you'll love it!
Tarot Card Reading - Mystic Meg's got nothin' on me! Let me give you a glimpse into your future with a personal reading. I've been on Psychic TV and have over 200 5 stars reviews. 

Risks & Challenges

 There's a risk I'll arrive in Edinburgh very tired as I'm working hard being my own producer, publicist and comedy agent. But if I do a few tarot card readings and indian head massages I should be able to relax knowing I've earned enough money to cover my costs in Edinburgh. The challenge I face is getting this campaign out there and  being heard.

This show is so important to me, as the story it tells is so close to my heart. After my psychotic breakdown, I had to fight for everything. I had to fight and 'prove my worth' to the government for my right to the disability benifit 'Personal Independence Payment'. Fight for my housing, fight to keep my support worker here with me, and fight for my sanity!
Knowing I have enough money, affording all the tools I need to support me and get my show seen and voice heard, will prepare me not only financially but mentally for the unfair, middle class battlefield that lies ahead.
Some believe the arts are becoming elitist, grants are harder to come by and people from background's similar to myself are struggling more and more to break into the industry. Its hard enough to find money to live, let alone fund internships and creative projects. Is it coincidental that most successful comedians are middle class white men?

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that stuff we call money, I am accepting hugs. You even get one back! Also please share this on your social media, or with people who may be interested. I'll be very grateful! Lot's of love! xx

story:
Exciting update!!  The first piece, the Zoltar booth, has been built!  We have a little more decoration to do and some curtains to sew, but mostly it's done!  Now on to finish building the rest of it!


Thanks for checking out our campaign!  Please remember that donations at ANY level help us get this thing built and out to the playa!  We set our goal low, so that we would actually make it and be eligible for Indigogo's InDemand promotions that you can only get when you meet your goal.  We are still in need of more funds!  We are trying to raise $7000 overall to pay for the costs of the whole project.  Please give at any level to help us out!


Here's the rest of the project getting painted.  It's coming along nicely, but we could sure use your help to finish it!


------DESCRIPTION------


Headed to Burning Man 2015, and lovingly known as the DisCOmbobulator, our project is a large machine that appears to function as a combination of an automated fortune teller and a fair style penny press machine. The front facing portion of the machine will be a booth that has a live gypsy "Zelda" or "Zoltar" style fortune teller. Unfortunately participants will discover that Zoltar is not really prepared to give out fortunes as he is busy living his life. When the curtains open participants will find him eating lunch, on the toilet, getting dressed, etc. You are likely to have him tell you that he is on vacation and have him ask you to tell him his fortune instead. This part of the booth is all about shtick and will be a fun, funny, and unexpected interaction. As a consolation for not getting what you thought you would out of Zoltan he will bid you well on your journey and gift you a blank "coin" to insert into the coin press machine.  As you follow your "coin's" progress along the machine you stop at several different points of interactivity. Each stop is designed to challenge your perception of what a real carnival game should be.  Witty banter is the game here & a positive attitude & willingness to play along is actually how you win.  


 


The design of the machine will draw from influences like Rube Goldberg and Willy Wonka while incorporating many different aspects that Colorado is known for.

The DisCOmbobulator is part of Burning Man's Midway project. The Midway will house a panoply of strange and enchanting wonders. Mind-readers, fortune-tellers, and vendors of patent medicines will vie with every form of all-too-human oddity for public attention; barkers will of course be everywhere. Artists and builders will create unorthodox carnival attractions and interactive experiences, and we will fashion stages to host performance art. See the Midway page for a list of booths to get your imagination flowing.

http://burningman.org/event/brc/the-midway/

After our first major build weekend the walls are up and standing!

On our 2nd build weekend we took the whole thing apart to prime it.  Next week  we start painting stripes!

------DESTINATIONS------

Burning Man 2015 - Black Rock City, NV

Elsewhence - Colorado

Denver Decompression - Denver, CO

Apogaea 2016 - Colorado


------Help us bring The DisCOmbobulator to life------

There are high costs using the materials that are needed and building a structure of such scale. Having said that the budget will be transparent.  Funding will be going directly towards building materials, fabrication costs, equipment rentals, and transport fees. There are no artist fees included in the budget. 

HOW MUCH MONEY DO WE NEED? HOW DO WE PLAN ON SPENDING IT? 

Structure & Associated Items $2000 

Illumination and Mechanics $400

Support Camp Costs $2000

Transport Costs $2000

On Playa Schwag Costs $300

Campaign Fees $180

Campaign Rewards $200

Estimated Costs: $7,080


------Other Ways You Can Help. The Support & Share Contest! ------

Pass this campaign along to your network. Help us bring this to life!
Announcing the Support & Share Contest! The prize: 5 Colorado Burners patches and 5 stickers!. Here’s how to enter: scroll up and find your unique “share this campaign” link under the video (you must sign into your indiegogo account to get your unique link). You can use your link to share on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, Pinterest, G+, and anywhere else you can think of. Send an email to friends & family, share on your blog. The top referrer wins the prize. Good luck and thanks for sharing!


We are also looking for other means of support. Sponsors, collaborators, people that want to get their hands dirty…

Want to get involved? Drop us a line at..

thedisCOmbobulatron(at)gmail(dot)com


Help us get the word out about our fundraiser on July 24th.  (And, of course, we hope you will also attend!):

https://www.facebook.com/events/906438402748987/921043514621809/



------The Perks------


Sticker Madness

  Colorado Burners stickers.  


      


Postcards from the Playa


Patch you up!  

Pendant Pride!
UV responsive dog tag.


Pendant Power Up!
We are SO excited about these!  Cut on the C&C right here in Denver  at The Fusion Factory these have been donated to us by Andrew Benson of Praxis Guitars and we LOVE them!!  Please take the time to check out his other work or hit him up for C&C work at http://praxisguitars.com

The top referrer wins the prize. Good luck and thanks for sharing!

We are also looking for other means of support. Sponsors, collaborators, people that want to get their hands dirty…
Want to get involved? Drop us a line at..

Sticker Madness
  Colorado Burners stickers.  
      


Postcards from the Playa



Patch you up!  



Pendant Pride!UV responsive dog tag.




Pendant Power Up!We are SO excited about these!  Cut on the C&C right here in Denver  at The Fusion Factory these have been donated to us by Andrew Benson of Praxis Guitars and we LOVE them!!  Please take the time to check out his other work or hit him up for C&C work at http://praxisguitars.com

story:
The Divine Dance of Balance

There are two natural energies inside each of us, one feminine and one masculine. The masculine energy is characterised by qualities such as logic, focus, commitment, excitement, manifestation and presence. The feminine qualities are expressed as nurturing, acceptance, meandering, receptivity, creativity and restfulness.  If there is an imbalance between them or we don't allow one of them flow naturally, it becomes very difficult to run our lives in a harmonious and successful way, as we need both to take on the challenge of this life in a loving and purposeful manner.  This is the key to solving all other imbalances in the world (violence, poverty, conflict, injustice, ecological devastation, etc).

Balancing the feminine and masculine energies within ourselves and around the world has the potential to bring us into a saner and more sustainable way of living. This is what Frances and Adelina embraced when they initiated the project of dancing on all of the node points where the Mary and Michael line meet in Britain.

The Mary and Michael lines are ley lines (earth energy lines), which weave in and out of each other across southern Britain, from Carn Les Boel in Cornwall to St. Margaret's Hopton in Norfolk.  These lay lines link up Sacred sites such as; St Michaels Mount, Glastonbury, Avebury, Royston Cave's among many others.

The book, 'The Sun and the Serpant' by Hamish Miller and Paul Broadhurst was the main inspiration for Frances and Adelina to engage in a dancing and photography pilgrimage from Spring Equinox 2006 to Auntumn Equinox 2007.

In 2012 the book, 'The Divine Dance In the Sacred Landscape of Britain' was published by Christine Horner of 'In the garden publishing'. The book was celebrated and launched on 18th May 2013 as part of the Swindon Festival of Literature. The book is mainly photographs and enough words to tell the story in a poetic way.

Soon there will be a delightful photography exhibition in Stroud from the 4th to 10th July 2016 and Frances and Adelina are really looking forward to welcoming and sharing their story of the journey with you ....
Frances Lewis has been teaching Yoga since 2000 and is dedicated to sharing the gifts of Yoga. She is a courageous dancer of truth and wisdom.
Adelina teaches Tantra internationally, offering both private and group workshops. Her passion is to offer people an opportunity to realise their true nature by bringing awareness to the practice of Tantra and ultimately to all aspects of life.
"Adelina's gift with photography is not only to surprise and delight, but also to include the viewer. She manages to make us feel as if we are there with them participating in the dancing of the Mary and Michael node points and accompanying them on their journey. By capturing the mood of the moment with her careful watchfulness she draws us into their world of balancing the feminine and masculine energies in a deeply personal way.  Adelina and Frances have created a unique exploration of the meeting of the Mary and Michael ley lines. The two have worked as one and it shines through in the joyous celebratory book"......(Boo Beaumont)
and soon the exhibition ~ what a joy .....


The Exhibition

Adelina and Frances are creating a beautiful, vibrant photography exhibition in Stroud. It is an exhibition of some of the stunning photography from our book 'The Divine Dance in the Sacred Landscape of Britain'.

It is an exhibition, but it is more than an exhibition.....it is our aim to create a Sacred Space in central Stroud dedicated to Peace......


.................................................................................................


'The Divine Dance in The Sacred Landscape of Britain'

(A photographic feast ~ vivid and sparkling visually and energetically)

From 4th to 10th July 2016

Venue: Lansdown Gallery, Stroud, Glouestershire. GL5 1BB – http://www.lansdownhall.org

Gallery opening times: 3pm to 5pm on Monday 4th July // 10.30am to 4.30pm from Tuesday to Saturday // 11am to 1pm on Sunday 10th July.

Opening celebration / ceremony on Tuseday 5th July, from 7.00pm to 9.30pm (no alcohol thank you).

Singing Sacred songs and chants from around the world at 12 noon from Tuesday to Sunday.

You are warmly welcome to join us, visit the exhibition, join us for the songs and chants at noon and the celebration ceremony,

With love and thanks,
Adelina and Frances ~ Namaste


...........................................................................................


What We Need & What You Get

 We are creating an Indigogo Crowdfunding campaign to raise funds for the exhibition.
On a practical level we need:
£200 venue hire
£1,800 art work and exhibition set up costs.
£500 visioning / planning / administration / publicity / travel / commitment and coordination costs to Frances and Adelina.

We also plan to offer the photography in the exhibition up for sale and to raise money for Refugee Aid.
You get a great opportunity to be part of something soulful and uplifting.

We are very grateful for all the help along the way, from the special exhibition music by George to the amazing printing from Gordon of Skylight publishing, from the chanters and the singers to the photo hangers and tidy upper's ~ thank you for participating everyone who can. And thank you for warm thoughts and spreading the word even if you can't make it to the exhibition.
 

The Impact

* We aim to celebrate and honour the balancing of the feminine and masculine energies within ourselves and around the world.

* We aim to inspire change (in small and big ways) towards a socially just, spiritually fulfilling and sustainable life on earth.

* To nurture hope for future generations by engaging with humanitarian and ecological issues and dedicating this exhibition to Peace.

* To encourage connection and creativity and appreciation with nature and earth energies around the world.

* We aim to tempt and invite you out of your arm chair into the spectacular healing landscape of ancient Britain.

* We will raise money for Refugee Aid during the exhibition.

How Can You Help...

This crowdfunding campaign will allow us to focus our energies, raise money towards  financing the exhibition, and spread the word about our project....

Please donate money - any amount is welcome, no matter how small or large! Money is welcome as a gift of support - simply a gift - and all the small amounts add up to lots - so please feel free to contribute the right amount for you. And please have a look at the amazing list of Perks.....from meet the authors, to a stunning photograph to hang up at home.

Spread the word far and wide, invite your friends and family, we would really like lot's of people to donate and lots of people to come and experience the exhibition and participate in the songs and the ceremony. Please join with us to send positivity and hope into the web of human connection around the world.

And we welcome your sincere meditations, songs, prayers and poems dedicated to Peace and Balance. Creativity brings meaning and value to life ~ please share your creativity in small and big ways towards what you know is good and true ~ with lots of love and thanks Namaste

......................................................................

There are a range of perks from £1 to £252 ....all your donations will be used to produce the exhibition. We hope that we will reach the entire goal, with your gracious support! 

  • Contribute £5 – Signed thank you postcard: You will receive a surprised thank you postcard featuring a picture and a printed poem from our book. 

  • Time with the authors £50 – Private meeting with Adelina and Frances: You will have a private meeting with the authors. 

  • Book signed by authors! – You will receive  a copy of the "The Divine Dance In the Sacred Landscape of Britain" book signed by Adelina and Frances with a personalised message.



  • Photo Prints from the book! –We have 4 photographic prints from the book, these are available in two formats:
  • A Photographic Print for you to frame.
  • A Photographic Print bonded onto an aluminium panel ready to hang.
  • You can select a photo of your choice from the following images:

Sizes: 30 x 40cm (12" x 16")....

50 x 76cm (20" x 30") ....

76cm x 127cm (30" x 50") ...

And much more! see 'Select a Perk' on the right.

Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to let people know who might be interested in Mary and Michael lines, earth energies, beautiful inspiring photography and simple songs and chants for peace.
And send good vibes xxxx
Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

With love and thanks,
Frances and Adelina ~ Namaste
story_txt:
The Divine Dance of Balance
There are two natural energies inside each of us, one feminine and one masculine. The masculine energy is characterised by qualities such as logic, focus, commitment, excitement, manifestation and presence. The feminine qualities are expressed as nurturing, acceptance, meandering, receptivity, creativity and restfulness.  If there is an imbalance between them or we don't allow one of them flow naturally, it becomes very difficult to run our lives in a harmonious and successful way, as we need both to take on the challenge of this life in a loving and purposeful manner.  This is the key to solving all other imbalances in the world (violence, poverty, conflict, injustice, ecological devastation, etc).

Balancing the feminine and masculine energies within ourselves and around the world has the potential to bring us into a saner and more sustainable way of living. This is what Frances and Adelina embraced when they initiated the project of dancing on all of the node points where the Mary and Michael line meet in Britain.

The Mary and Michael lines are ley lines (earth energy lines), which weave in and out of each other across southern Britain, from Carn Les Boel in Cornwall to St. Margaret's Hopton in Norfolk.  These lay lines link up Sacred sites such as; St Michaels Mount, Glastonbury, Avebury, Royston Cave's among many others. 

The book, 'The Sun and the Serpant' by Hamish Miller and Paul Broadhurst was the main inspiration for Frances and Adelina to engage in a dancing and photography pilgrimage from Spring Equinox 2006 to Auntumn Equinox 2007.

In 2012 the book, 'The Divine Dance In the Sacred Landscape of Britain' was published by Christine Horner of 'In the garden publishing'. The book was celebrated and launched on 18th May 2013 as part of the Swindon Festival of Literature. The book is mainly photographs and enough words to tell the story in a poetic way.

Soon there will be a delightful photography exhibition in Stroud from the 4th to 10th July 2016 and Frances and Adelina are really looking forward to welcoming and sharing their story of the journey with you ....

Frances Lewis has been teaching Yoga since 2000 and is dedicated to sharing the gifts of Yoga. She is a courageous dancer of truth and wisdom.

Adelina teaches Tantra internationally, offering both private and group workshops. Her passion is to offer people an opportunity to realise their true nature by bringing awareness to the practice of Tantra and ultimately to all aspects of life.
"Adelina's gift with photography is not only to surprise and delight, but also to include the viewer. She manages to make us feel as if we are there with them participating in the dancing of the Mary and Michael node points and accompanying them on their journey. By capturing the mood of the moment with her careful watchfulness she draws us into their world of balancing the feminine and masculine energies in a deeply personal way.  Adelina and Frances have created a unique exploration of the meeting of the Mary and Michael ley lines. The two have worked as one and it shines through in the joyous celebratory book"......(Boo Beaumont)
and soon the exhibition ~ what a joy .....

The Exhibition

Adelina and Frances are creating a beautiful, vibrant photography exhibition in Stroud. It is an exhibition of some of the stunning photography from our book 'The Divine Dance in the Sacred Landscape of Britain'.
It is an exhibition, but it is more than an exhibition.....it is our aim to create a Sacred Space in central Stroud dedicated to Peace......

.................................................................................................

'The Divine Dance in The Sacred Landscape of Britain'

(A photographic feast ~ vivid and sparkling visually and energetically)

From 4th to 10th July 2016

Venue: Lansdown Gallery, Stroud, Glouestershire. GL5 1BB – http://www.lansdownhall.org

Gallery opening times: 3pm to 5pm on Monday 4th July // 10.30am to 4.30pm from Tuesday to Saturday // 11am to 1pm on Sunday 10th July.

Opening celebration / ceremony on Tuseday 5th July, from 7.00pm to 9.30pm (no alcohol thank you).

Singing Sacred songs and chants from around the world at 12 noon from Tuesday to Sunday.

You are warmly welcome to join us, visit the exhibition, join us for the songs and chants at noon and the celebration ceremony,

With love and thanks, Adelina and Frances ~ Namaste 

...........................................................................................


What We Need & What You Get
 We are creating an Indigogo Crowdfunding campaign to raise funds for the exhibition.
On a practical level we need:
£200 venue hire
£1,800 art work and exhibition set up costs.
£500 visioning / planning / administration / publicity / travel / commitment and coordination costs to Frances and Adelina.

We also plan to offer the photography in the exhibition up for sale and to raise money for Refugee Aid.
You get a great opportunity to be part of something soulful and uplifting.

We are very grateful for all the help along the way, from the special exhibition music by George to the amazing printing from Gordon of Skylight publishing, from the chanters and the singers to the photo hangers and tidy upper's ~ thank you for participating everyone who can. And thank you for warm thoughts and spreading the word even if you can't make it to the exhibition.
 
The Impact
* We aim to celebrate and honour the balancing of the feminine and masculine energies within ourselves and around the world.


* We aim to inspire change (in small and big ways) towards a socially just, spiritually fulfilling and sustainable life on earth.

* To nurture hope for future generations by engaging with humanitarian and ecological issues and dedicating this exhibition to Peace.



* To encourage connection and creativity and appreciation with nature and earth energies around the world.


* We aim to tempt and invite you out of your arm chair into the spectacular healing landscape of ancient Britain.

* We will raise money for Refugee Aid during the exhibition.

How Can You Help...
This crowdfunding campaign will allow us to focus our energies, raise money towards  financing the exhibition, and spread the word about our project....

Please donate money - any amount is welcome, no matter how small or large! Money is welcome as a gift of support - simply a gift - and all the small amounts add up to lots - so please feel free to contribute the right amount for you. And please have a look at the amazing list of Perks.....from meet the authors, to a stunning photograph to hang up at home. 

Spread the word far and wide, invite your friends and family, we would really like lot's of people to donate and lots of people to come and experience the exhibition and participate in the songs and the ceremony. Please join with us to send positivity and hope into the web of human connection around the world.

And we welcome your sincere meditations, songs, prayers and poems dedicated to Peace and Balance. Creativity brings meaning and value to life ~ please share your creativity in small and big ways towards what you know is good and true ~ with lots of love and thanks Namaste

......................................................................


There are a range of perks from £1 to £252 ....all your donations will be used to produce the exhibition. We hope that we will reach the entire goal, with your gracious support! 




Contribute £5 – Signed thank you
postcard: You will receive a surprised thank you postcard featuring a picture and a printed poem from
our book. 





Time with the authors £50 – Private meeting with Adelina and Frances: You will have a private meeting with the authors. 




Book signed by authors! – You will receive  a copy of the "The Divine Dance In the
Sacred Landscape of Britain" book signed by Adelina and Frances with a
personalised message.









Photo Prints from the book! –We have 4 photographic prints from the book, these are available in two formats: 

A Photographic Print for you to frame.

A Photographic Print bonded onto an aluminium panel ready to hang. 

You can select a photo of your choice from the following images:
Sizes: 30 x 40cm (12" x 16").... 50 x 76cm (20" x 30") .... 76cm x 127cm (30" x 50") ...







And much more! see 'Select a Perk' on the right.

Other Ways You Can Help
Feel free to let people know who might be interested in Mary and Michael lines, earth energies, beautiful inspiring photography and simple songs and chants for peace.
And send good vibes xxxx
Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

With love and thanks, Frances and Adelina ~ Namaste

story:
Brief recap since last campaign...

Hey all! As many of you remember, I did an Indiegogo campaign a year and a half ago to launch myself back into an art career, and it succeeded with flying colors thanks to your love and support. 

Not to be that girl, but here I am again, using the crowdfunding platform.

But this time it's different. I come to you now as a (somewhat) successful artist and entrepreneur. 

Because of my last campaign, I've been on the trajectory to a life as a sculptor and designer. Since my last campaign in April 2014, I've been able to do some cool things: I've created two businesses, one as a selling artist under my name, the other, Dear Survivor - a social enterprise that uses the sale of leather goods and jewelry to fight human trafficking in Southern California. Last fall I was commissioned to created a mixed media installation for DenM in Redlands; and this summer I was hired on a creative team in San Francisco to create an album cover for Magik Magik Orchestra (to be released early 2016). This last month I spent touring England, Paris, Munich, and Budapest, visiting the works of art that have inspired me to follow this career path. And now, I'm the resident artist at AlmadiART, a sculpture studio in Hungary, just outside of Budapest. 

Art as a career has taken me so much farther then I ever imagined it could. And I feel so privileged to get to do this with my life.

Don't be deceived, though. I'm still broke. My notebooks are filled with math calculations, figuring out what I need to sell in order to make it the next month. But hey, that's the life of an artist. And I'll happily take that if it means I get to create every day. 

Campaign Summary

This campaign is different from my last. I'm using this more as a platform to sell and manage my work. This is not  a "please fund my life" campaign.  I think that being a successful artist is 25% artistic skill, 75% the way you market yourself. So hello, my name is Christine Longoria and I'm marketing myself. If I don't hit the goal my life will go on as normal and I'll keep trekking in the way I do. But here's my thought process for doing this: 

1) I have a full ceramics studio at my disposal and two months to make whatever I want. How can I use my time here wisely...?

2) I need to buy car when I get back to California. I've never been able to afford one and the struggle is so real....

3) There are many people who've expressed interest in buying my work...

4) Hmmmm, I should make and sell enough things while I'm in Hungary so I can buy myself a car...


Financial Breakdown (no secrets here)

Here's the breakdown:

  • I already have a car lined up to buy, and $2500 of savings to put towards it. I need another $2500 to buy the car. If I don't reach my goal, I'll get a loan, which is fine. But I want to try to sell enough art to avoid that if I can.
  • $500 for registration and tax on the car (because that always sneaks up on ya)
  • And being that I'm in Hungary, shipping costs are gonna be wicked, so allotting $500 for that.
  • Any surplus I receive will be invested into Dear Survivor. 

The Impact

If I'm able to hit this $3500 goal (gosh I feel like I'm asking for the world), I will be able to hit the ground running as soon as I get back. 

As many of you know, I moved out of LA at the end of July. And after much thought about where to take my life next, I've decided to move to San Diego. I'm so excited about it! There's a burgeoning small business scene there that I want to be a part of. Also, I'm partnered (well, Dear Survivor is partnered) with a non-profit there called GenerateHope, and I will be able to start volunteering as an art teacher. Working with human trafficking victims has been a desire of mine for years, and I'm so excited about the opportunity. So yes, hoping to be settled there by the start of the New Year. 

Being able to buy a car will open a lot of doors, and allow me the luxury to keep pursuing my creative pursuits. 

Perks!

Gold Star Magnet $10

Crystal Cluster $15

Trendy Spoon Set $20 (completed pics coming soon!)

Pinched Mug (completed pics coming soon!) $25

Double Triangle Necklace (will be on thicker cord) $35

Geometric Vase (completed pics coming soon!) $50

Hanging Hand $90

#christinelongoria Starter Pack $175

Medium Hand $150 and Large Hand $300



Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't see any pieces you like or can afford, spread the word! Share on facebook, twitter, and instagram.

story:
THE MILLENNIAL TRAINS PROJECT (MTP) is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization that leads crowd-funded transcontinental train journeys for diverse groups of young innovators (and virtual audiences) to explore America's new frontiers.

To get on board, applicants design a project to advance across the communities where our train stops and then race to be among the first 15 applicants on their selected train journey to reach their $5,000 crowdfunding goal. To learn more about the 2016 journeys click here. The applicant's project is described below.


Short Summary

Each person in this world was born with a great power to create. Whether that be in

dance, music, drama/theatre, visual arts or even everyday activities that produce something new. To me, this creation is truly art.

Many do not realize how much art is prevalent and relevant in everyday life as it is one first things to go with school budget cuts, narrowing an investment within art, innovation and imaginative capacity. With this project, I want to take that stand and show the importance of art as well as prove that every person posses this power to create. This is important because there is no discipline that nurtures and sparks the cognitive ability to imagine, and unleashes creativity and innovation, more than arts.

In each city I want to convey the importance art can have as a conduit to social issues. All while documenting, collecting and creating art to showcase that community and culture. I have created task for each city as listed below that create conversation of the issues but also establish the culture.

Los Angeles - Humanize the homeless by activating street art and documenting the dreams/art of the homeless either through conversation or having them paint or draw on a canvas and share with surrounding areas.

San Francisco - To document the movement of displaced placed people through forced migration within a growing city. (A cause of homelessness)

Denver- To create interactive art with the community by combining dance, music and painting in an area that seemingly has been taken away from the community.

Milwaukee - To break down cultural barriers and unite one of the nation's top segregated cities through music, art, dance, and sport.

Detroit- To collect stories of resilience in on of the nation’s struggling cities through an exploration of the cities culture defining street art.  

See website for more info on each city...

What We Need & What You Get

For this transcontinental trip to Los Angeles, San Francisco, Denver, Milwaukee, and Detroit I will be fundraising $5k to travel aboard the train and connect with artist across the US to enhance cultural vitality (the evidence of creating, disseminating, validating, and supporting creativity and arts as a dimension of everyday life) through art.

Through this journey I plan on documenting, creating and collecting art with different communities as they express their community's culture through art. After the journey, I plan to hold an art exhibit for all of the art/pictures made and collected in each city as well as a printed magazine of the adventure, redefining the necessity of art as well as different cultures within 5 major cities of United States. 


The Impact

 Everybody has a dream, passion, and a mission and that put together makes art.  I have found my art and I would love to help others find theirs as well as help fight for the right to have those things. With art being pushed to an elective or unnecessary element of education, there needs to be proof that an investment within art, innovation and imaginative capacity is still necessary within education. Without art, education will be eliminate creativity, only have emphasis on cut and dry subject like math, science, and history (where it's either you're right or you're wrong).

Risks & Challenges

There have been many attempts to save the arts and many failing. With my project, it is showing the results art can have on a community and why the world still needs it's creators. 

The biggest risk and challenge are missed connections within each city. Although I have created a list of contact, I have also prepared alternate connections to continue to make this project possible.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to support financially, you can still join this movement by spreading the word and sharing your art as a creator and change maker within this world. Using the hashtag #PoweredByArt post what you consider your art.

story:
Time to hit the road

Hey people of the world! I go by "The Lost Cause" and am a Portland, Oregon based artist and muralist. I have spent years chiseling away at my craft as a painter and decided that after the past few years of networking, connecting and meeting other artists around the world that it's time to make a tour to visit them in their cities and paint new walls with new people. The tour will be from May 15th-June 18th. It's been my dream to become a muralist and I'm finally living it out, but just like musicians need to spread their sound by touring, I also need to spread my artistic vision with an international tour.

I will be starting my tour off on May 15th in London where I will paint with artists such as SPZERO76, Captain Kris and Obit showcasing our work throughout the city. Next I will head over to Berlin to pay Base23 a visit and paint a wall or two. After I touch back down in London town I will bounce back over to the good ol' US of A to stop in New York City to meet with Mr. Never Satisfied and paint a wall or two in Brooklyn. From New York I will make my way to Chicago to connect and paint with the amazing and very talented Nice One and Lady Lucx. After a week in Chicago it's time to return to the Pacific Northwest and end my trip with a bang by painting and reconnecting with all of my Seattle friends, then I'll head home to Portland on June 18th.

During my tour I will be carefully documenting the entire trip through videos and photos, which I will turn into a zine and also make a short video recapping the whole tour. The zine will feature interviews with some of the artists as well as plenty of full color photos of every wall painted on the tour. Along the way I will also be contacting various galleries to connect and establish a presence to hopefully line up some shows for the future!


How I will use the donated funds.

I need $4500 for this month long journey for various expenses:
-SUPPLIES! I will be buying all of my own spray paint and other paints along the way. Paint is probably going to be my greatest expense since I will be using a lot of it.

-TRAVEL! Plane tickets can get pricey and I need some help affording my transportation from one city to the next.

-FOOD! We all know that art on an empty stomach is no good.


What you will receive for being so kind and generous:

For all of your help and support I am more than happy to bring you all along on my tour through postcards, stickers, art, a zine and other goodies. My rewards will range from postcards with photos of the various murals I will be painting to original works of art by myself, or if you live in any of the cities I will be visiting I'll even paint a mural on your wall!

Custom bandana:


Hand embellished screen print:


$150 rewards package (zine and postcard not pictured):

Winston the Whale wood cutout (example of previous work):

Original painting (example of previous work):

Mural (example of previous work):


Art Matters

You may ask yourself, why should I help this guy out? Because you care about and support art for art's sake. I believe that art is a vital element to building a stronger global community and I have seen it change many lives for the better. Street art and murals are writing history as we speak, this movement can't be stopped and will only continue to grow and thrive. It brings many people from many corners of the globe together through visual expression. I want to share my vision so that you all can enjoy it!
