story:
Short Summary

Hey Everyone, For those of you who do not know me, my name is Remy St. Paul. I'm an all around artist including Filmmaker, Photographer, Graphic Artist, Special Effects Artist and so on. I've been helping other Filmmakers & Artist create their art since the early 90's. First film premiered in a small venue in 2005. Since then I've struggled working a regular "9 to 5" job while trying to pursue my dreams. Now it's time to take a leap of faith, but I need your help.

Since my early teens, I had a dream of living and working out of a multi-artist type studio/venue. I wanted to get a group of friends with a wide variety of artistic talents and create art of all genres and live off of it. 

The contributors big & small will have a place to go to where like minded people will also be. It'll benefit the community by bringing more people into surrounding businesses. 

What We Need & What You Get

Simply, I need funds to get everything started and rolling.

  • -First/Last Month's Rent 
  • -Lease Deposit 
  • -Utilities Deposit 
  • -Insurance 
  • -Building Supplies 
  • -Tools 
  • -Stage 
  • -Stage Equipment 
  • -Sound Equipment 
  • -Film Screening Equipment 
  • -Furniture 
  • -Lighting 
  • -Permit Costs 
  • -Labor Costs
  • -Website
What you get...
  • A Production Studio for Filmmakers. 
  • A Studio for Photographers.
  • A Venue to show your Films.
  • A Venue to play your Music.
  • A Venue for Theatrical Performances.
  • A Venue for Burlesque Shows.
  • A Venue for Comedy Acts.
  • A Venue for Fashion Shows.
  • A place to hold Film Auditions.
  • A place for meeting of all types.
  • A place to hold parties of all types from casting to personal.
  • A place to hold events of all types.
  • And so much more.

If I don't raise money in time and lose the building to another leaser, the money raised will go to find another building and the same plan will be in effect. I will not give up on this dream until it becomes a reality.

I'm also looking for like-minded Partner(s) to collaborate with and be a part of my team.

If you're not part of my struggle, do not plan on being a part of my success.

The Impact

My main goal is to be able to produce other's films, music and other art ventures. After we open and money starts rolling in. I'll be able to achieve that goal.

I also want to give artists the chance I never had. Make it easy for them to express themselves instead of charging ridiculous fees to show, display or express their art.

The location will be in East Elm about 5 minutes from Deep Ellum in Dallas, Texas. The bigger and most successful the Studio/Venue becomes the more it'll help the surrounding business & community by bringing in more and more people.

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Any amount big or small is appreciated.

If you are not able to donate. You can also help by sharing this page with your friends.

Thank you for your time, Remy
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hey Everyone, For those of you who do not know me, my name is Remy St. Paul. I'm an all around artist including Filmmaker, Photographer, Graphic Artist, Special Effects Artist and so on. I've been helping other Filmmakers & Artist create their art since the early 90's. First film premiered in a small venue in 2005. Since then I've struggled working a regular "9 to 5" job while trying to pursue my dreams. Now it's time to take a leap of faith, but I need your help.
Since my early teens, I had a dream of living and working out of a multi-artist type studio/venue. I wanted to get a group of friends with a wide variety of artistic talents and create art of all genres and live off of it. 
The contributors big & small will have a place to go to where like minded people will also be. It'll benefit the community by bringing more people into surrounding businesses. 


What We Need & What You Get

-First/Last Month's Rent

If you are not able to donate. You can also help by sharing this page with your friends.

story:
Short Summary

I'm Rachel (aka Insomnia) and my BFA is in metalsmithing and jewelry. I currently work at TechShop in Austin and will be using many of the tools there to create my project, like the Shopbot. I've helped others with large art projects over the past few years and I've decided it's time to bring my own creation. 

I'm building a teapot large enough for someone to sit inside and enjoy a cup of tea with a friend. My design is prodominately made out of wood and covered in a fabric. The wood provides the skeleton and the fabric grants not only an illusion of privacy, but allows for natural light and air to pass through. I'm hoping to light this up at night with pretty color-changing leds too! This design allows for the structure to be used multiple times since it can be broken down to store and reassembled multiple times. 

My goal is to take this to Burning Flipside this May and then apply to other local events as well as look into events outside of Texas that might also enjoy my project. 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm asking for $850. The majority of that goes into lumber and structural integrity. The remainder goes into consumable supplies (tea, sugar, etc), fabric, transportation, teapots and tea cups, hardware, and wood sealant.

I'm almost as excited about making the Perks as I am the teapot. I'm hand making all of the perks I'm giving away.

Everything is tea themed, but you won't feel like a walking advertisement when you wear my pendant or put my embroidered patch on your bag. I'm also making and giving away a handcrafted wooden tea box with an assortment of teas inside at the  $100 donation level. There will even be a couple scaled down models available for those who want a new art piece to showcase in their home.

The penultimate perk is to have the teapot brought to an event of your choice in the Austin, TX area (and maybe beyond) to experience firsthand! Granted there are a few limitations, so you may want to contact me directly to completely hash out the details. I'd hate for you to want it for something like your kid's 8 year old birthday, only to discover it's already booked for something else. If you've got any questions about this perk, please contact me before purchasing it.

 

The Impact

My favorite aspect of this project is that not only is it meant to be viewed, but it's also interactive. Take a moment away from a busy environment and sit down for a cup of tea. Make your own experience, will your tea party be solumn and reflective, silly and joyous, or wonderous and inspired? 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know budgets are tight, but you can help in more ways than money. You can spread the word. Small amounts add up when enough people come together.

You can also help by suggesting future events I can travel to with the Teapot. I'm excited to bring this to multiple places and people.

story:
Hello!

I hope you are as well as I am hopeful that you are well.

I am James (hey), but this camapaign isn't about me - it's about us. That is, the filmmakers without cameras, the painters without brushes, and the actors without films to act in because the filmmakers don't have cameras.

In fact, there's a whole lot of us, and we go by the name Dot The Connective.

This campaign is the collective effort of all DTC members to raise enough money to acquire a shared pool of resources that will include all of the things any of us will ever need to make art (cameras, costumes, microphones, etc.)

By equipping our 30+ members (and growing!) with a readily accessible art-makin' toolbox, contributors are helping to fund not one single project, but as many projects as we can collectively create, and with 30+ members (and growing!), that's a lot of projects.

(For more on the stuff mentioned above, watch the video, which is above the stuff mentioned above).

Speaking of stuff...

...our goal is $22,000 worth. To be more specific:

  • Camera & Accessories (Lenses, Tripod, Memory Cards, Camera Bag) - $7,120

  • Lights & Accesories (Kit, Bulbs, Gels, Stands) - $3,850

  • Audio Equipment (Boom Mic & Pole, Body Mics, Mixer, Cables) - $3,720

  • Editing Suite (Computer, Hardrive, Software) - $1,600

  • Art Dept. (Costume Maintainence, Building Material for Sets/Props) - $1,500

  • Steady Cam Rig for DSLR Camera - $1,500

  • Miscellaneous (Cords, Batteries, Adaptors) - $600

  • Equipment Insurance - $200 

Any "extra" funds will be split between Indiegogo (for providing us this wonderful fundraising forum) and the deli nearest our next shoot (for providing us the wonderful gift of coffee).

Speaking of coffee...

...it's delicious. But more importantly, it keeps the artist's stomach full and thus, his mind focused.

Now when I say "coffee," I actually mean...well...coffee, but also any other foods or beverages that may provide sustenance for artists who are on set all day or in the studio for hours at a time.

The reason I'm speaking of "coffee" is because while purchasing a camera is a one-time expense, nourishment is an ongoing investment and an absolute necessity.

Therefore, if we are fortunate enough to exceed our current goal, none of the "extra" money will actually be "extra" (which is why I keep putting the word "extra" in quotes). We can use every cent we get.

You: "But will you? Will you use every cent you get?"

Us: "Yes. We will." Allow me to elaborate.

If you are not yet convinced that your contribution will be a seed that will help plant a Hyperion of creativity, consider the following...

...well, before that, note that "Hyperion" is the name of one of the largest trees in the world. I googled it. Okay, now consider the following:

  • There are about 30 of us in that video up there. At least a few of us have to be serious about makin' some art, right?
  • The almost 30 featured in the video are not the only artists in our network, they're just the ones who didn't have work that day.
  • We made said video with borrowed equipment, on borrowed time, and in borrowed space. If making art is worth begging and borrowing, you can be sure we'll keep the juices flowing once the pitcher is full.
  • Said video isn't the only thing we've begged and borrowed to make. Check out the reel that's featured in said video to see some clips from past productions.

...and imagine how cool the reel of future productions is going to be thanks to you!

Speaking of "thanks to you"...

Thanks so much for checking us out. Remember that if you can't contribute monetarily, there is still hope!

If you live in the New York City area, you can come work on set with us, make your old bathrobe our new costume, or simply share the link to our campaign page.

"Art is much less important than life, but what a poor life without it."

All our very best,

DTC :)

story:
Hello, and thank you for visiting my indiegogo campaign!

My name is Max Belanger, and I'm currently a junior studying Fiber and Creative Writing at the Kansas City Art Institute. I'm honored to have been selected by my school to represent KCAI at the New York Studio Residency Program this upcoming spring semester. The NYSRP is a prestigious program in which students from across the country come together in one studio space to make memorable experiences as they learn from each other, the incredible program staff, and various visiting artists and curators in the New York art scene. This is truly an exciting opportunity, and I look forward to going into it with strong determination to take full advantage of everything available in such a fantastic city as New York. 

In addition to working in the studio, I've also been offered to assist in the production of an upcoming La MaMa Experimental Theatre opera, Bum Phillips, directed by the acclaimed Luke Leonard. La MaMa is a truly innovative theater where such artists as Blue Man Group, Philip Glass, and Amy Sedaris got their starts. Monk Parrots, the theatre company also directed by Mr. Leonard and commonly associated with La MaMa, has been referred to as "Young artist revolutionaries" by the New York Theatre Wire. This is definitely a crowd of people I'm eager to learn from in my time in the city.

Understandably, this is all no easy feat financially, especially for an art student, which is why I am asking for your help! I've estimated my budget for the semester at a total of $6000 outlined below:

  • $3000 - average room in New York for four months
  • $2050 - food, art supplies, museum entrance fees, etc.
  • $500 - School of Visual Arts (the host of the program) course and facility access fees
  • $450 - four 30-day unlimited ride subway passes
In exchange for any donation you can make, I'm offering much of the art I've made in the past year. Several of these things are limited and come on a first-come first-serve basis, but I'm also offering prints of my photography for more affordable donations. Check them out! 

And if you can't make a donation, please, please, please pass on my link to everybody you know! In fact, spreading the word is the easiest and the greatest thing you could possibly do! 

All of this is in preparation for a long-standing goal of mine. I dream of creating in my life immersive artistic experiences that bring a community together - experiences that tie together the worlds of storytelling, fine art, production design, and community event into something new, while relying heavily on collaboration across multiple disciplines. I strongly believe that the most incredible achievements are those done by a group of dedicated people who are passionate about what they do.

Thank you again for visiting my campaign, I truly appreciate it!

Some websites to check out:

NYSRP: http://nysrp.aicad.org

La MaMa: http://lamama.org

Monk Parrots: http://www.monkparrots.org

My website: http://www.foxboulange.com

And a HUGE thank you to the designer for the NYSRP graphic, Taylor Smith! Check out his facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/RTSmithIllustration!

story:
Autumn greetings! I am a Brooklyn based mixed media collage artist, photographer, and wordsmith seeking unique, evolutionary, and life changing opportunity for which to foster my passion for creating. As an artist, finding safe ground for which to express oneself is necessary in creating a healthy foundation for growth. Yet opportunity to take time away from life’s daily struggles to tend to the garden of self are few and far in between. Despite the odds, I hope that maybe something sparks the flame needed to illuminate this mysterious path. For me, that fire has communicated itself to me through creative expression, and I have made it my heart’s mission to follow what flows out of my hands. And like all of us sometimes these hands need a little help from her friends.

One year ago I was selected for a month long artist-in-residence program in Finland and it began as a catalyst for my manifesting a sustainable reality in which time, space, and materials can flow abundantly a river without care.  With the help of beautiful people like yourself, I was able to raise enough to cover the cost of the trip, both solidifying what became an earth shifting experience and instilling in me a desire to continue my journey creating magic into the unknown. It has now become a goal of mine to complete at least one residency per year.  

Another monumental dream manifested last year with the help of another fundraiser and my ‘Portals’ collage series was published with Brooklyn’s Papercut Press. It is incredible to think that an idea is only an inches away from tangible possibility, and with a solid dose of hard work and motivation, sky’s the limit.  

It has been a long held dream of mine to expand on this series of portals and infuse them with the natural landscape creating a visceral experience that transports one to a thought provoking world of heartfelt curiosity and wonder. The installation would be a portal linking each distinctly diverse location in cohesive sensory experience that is multi-layered in emotion, spirit, and experience. Highlighting various aspects of human nature, growth, longing, loss, love, and the universal truths that flow through us a river without name, I hope to inspire, uplift, and expand the consciousness of all who come in contact with the piece.  

So, now to the exciting/scary part. Working at a bike shop that specializes in Dutch cycles I have grown fascinated with the culture. As I will be out of work for the winter months, I had a vision that instead of being cold and hungry during the off season I would put my time to good use and work on what everyday becomes more powerful a calling, lest we call it a career. If one month dedicated solely to art making could change my life imagine what three would do. So, it goes. I will be renting a  studio/apartment in De Pijp, Amsterdam this December for a period of three months to manifest this tangible reality!

With bikes on the mind, another project I plan to explore during my stay is a film documentary in conjunction with a photoessay regarding the incredible bicycle culture that exists in the Netherlands. Working at bike shop here in New York has opened my eyes to the potential of two wheels as a means for social, environmental, and personal change. It is my goal to connect with various locals in the cycling community both here and abroad, creating a network of communication and awareness surrounding the potential for cycling to be a functional way of life, not just a sport. I would like to interview, film, and photograph those actively exploring this way of life, creating what i believe to be an important dialogue between utopian ideals and tangible goals.

Now for the number crunch. This fundraiser will cover the cost of airfare, room/board, materials, and equipment all of which amount to around $4000 with some wiggle room if I’m thrifty. Thankfully i have been known to make the most out of bare minimum basics, but I would like to reach for the stars in terms of possibility to maximize my experience creatively.

Here's the breakdown of the costs:

  • Airfare $900

  • Room: $2100 (500 EU/mo)

  • Materials: $1000 (film, paper, processing, etc.)

On to the best part, your rewards! To help raise the funds to cover the costs of the residency I will be selling original, one of a kind hand crafted collages of various astral dimensions. If we know each other personally you best believe it will be personalized. If we are strangers you can bet your top dollar it will be even stranger. Either way, you’re in for a real treat.

I would like to express my eternal gratitude to those that have continued to believe in and support my art over the years, as your help is truly the beacon of light that both warms and guides me. Together may we create something beautiful, revolutionary, and just plain good for our hearts. There may not be many certainties in this life, but with the power of Truth, Honor, Happiness, and Love, and a little dash of magic, anything is possible. Spread the word and share the dream!  

P.S. The deadline goal will coincide with a one year relaunch celebration of ‘Portals’ here in Brooklyn! Time and location TBA.

With bikes on the mind, another project I plan to explore during my stay is a film documentary in conjunction with a photoessay regarding the incredible bicycle culture that exists in the Netherlands. Working at bike shop here in New York has opened my eyes to the potential of two wheels as a means for social, environmental, and personal change. It is my goal to connect with various locals in the cycling community both here and abroad, creating a network of communication and awareness surrounding the potential for cycling to be a functional way of life, not just a sport. I would like to interview, film, and photograph those actively exploring this way of life, creating what i believe to be an important dialogue between utopian ideals and tangible goals.
Now for the number crunch. This fundraiser will cover the cost of airfare, room/board, materials, and equipment all of which amount to around $4000 with some wiggle room if I’m thrifty. Thankfully i have been known to make the most out of bare minimum basics, but I would like to reach for the stars in terms of possibility to maximize my experience creatively.
Here's the breakdown of the costs:


Airfare $900
Room: $2100 (500 EU/mo)
Materials: $1000 (film, paper, processing, etc.)

On to the best part, your rewards! To help raise the funds to cover the costs of the residency I will be selling original, one of a kind hand crafted collages of various astral dimensions. If we know each other personally you best believe it will be personalized. If we are strangers you can bet your top dollar it will be even stranger. Either way, you’re in for a real treat. 
I would like to express my eternal gratitude to those that have continued to believe in and support my art over the years, as your help is truly the beacon of light that both warms and guides me. Together may we create something beautiful, revolutionary, and just plain good for our hearts. There may not be many certainties in this life, but with the power of Truth, Honor, Happiness, and Love, and a little dash of magic, anything is possible. Spread the word and share the dream!  
P.S. The deadline goal will coincide with a one year relaunch celebration of ‘Portals’ here in Brooklyn! Time and location TBA.

story:
Hi!

I'm Eric Goodwin, a caricature artist who specializes in extremely exaggerated, abstract, funny styles of art. I have a VERY STRONG passion for the art form and have won many caricature awards (without bribery!) at international caricature conventions such as 1st place for Best Exaggerated Style, 1st place for Best Abstract/Design Style, 3rd place for Caricature of the Year and 3rd place in the Likeness challenge. I've made a living as an artist drawing funny cartoons of people's faces throughout the US at Six Flags, Sea World, my own mall stand, at fairs, parties, corporate events and even drew for 5 months in South Korea! Annyounghaseyo!

As an artist, I love what I do, but sometimes it's tough to make a living, and the next 2 months are going to be nearly impossible to survive unless I raise some money! So here are...

MY GOALS:

-to make it to this year's ISCA con!

-to start up a new mall caricature stand in San Diego!

-to finally create my first art book to help me make some much-needed money!


The yearly ISCA con (International Society of Caricature Artists convention) has been my favorite week of the year for the past 5 years. It keeps me inspired and motivated to continue pushing my craft for the following year, lets me see friends and fellow caricaturists I only get to see at conventions and just keeps my soul all-around happy.

I've worked at my own mall caricature stand in New Hampshire for the past few holiday seasons, so I'm ready for a change of pace and want to work at a new location here in San Diego, especially since I've got a sweet apartment with my caricature buddy Nate Kap that I don't want to leave anytime soon. I know how to run my own business, I've agreed on a location with a mall leasing agent, and I'm good to go, except for the money needed to get everything started up.

Lastly, I've been wanting to create my own art book for years, and I've been saving a delicious smorgasbord of live caricatures for just that reason. Over the next month I'll be creating an awesomely unique e-book downloadable as a pdf that will have lots of fun stuff packed into it. 

HERE'S WHAT I NEED:

Convention Costs:

-plane ticket, round trip: $400

-convention registration: $250

-membership fees: $85

-hotel for occasional sleep: $100

-food for energy and fun misc: $150

Total: $985

Mall Stand Start-Up Costs:

-October rent: $375

-renter's insurance: $90

-mat frames: $180

-drawing protectors: $200

-French easel: $100

-bench for storage and seating: $80

-caricature display: $190

Total: $1215

Live Caricatures Art Book Costs:

-none! I've decided to make an e-book available for digital download as a pdf file so that all sales of the book will be profit. A printed book would cost more money than I can probably raise. However, if I happened to make over $4000 I would certainly consider this as an option. For now though, e-book it will be...

-a whole month dedicated to the creation of this awesome book

-I just need your support, interest and enthusiasm!

-I already have lots of cool, unique ideas for the book and over 170 photos of my craziest caricatures to choose from, already professionally photoshopped and ready to go :)

TOTAL NEEDED: $2200


WHAT YOU GET FOR PERKS!

Pay with PayPal please if you can so I can receive the money instantly instead of using a credit card for which I only receive it 2 weeks after the campaign finishes :)

Anybody that makes a contribution of any size will get credit in my thank you section of the e-book, by the way :)

SALE! $50 OFF the original prices for every perk that was originally $100 or more!

I'm offering really awesome perks for you guys! Starting with…

$15: Eric's live caricature E-BOOK! 

     

     

A brand new downloadable book called "Eric's Lives" in pdf form of the best, funniest, craziest drawings I've ever done of customers in SUPER HI-RES! It'll be between 80-120 pages in full color filled with 100-170 drawings, including up to 50 never-before-seen drawings and featuring lots of fun stuff like funny stories, how to not get a reject, art theory, commentaries and more!

(use PayPal please)


$50: 5 VOICES + E-BOOK!

A personalized impression video of me giving you a shout out and imitating 5 of your favorite singers or character voices, about 1-2 minutes in length total. Here are some examples of my singer impressions:



PLUS you get my E-BOOK!

(use PayPal please)


$100 now just $50: JACKED FACE + E-BOOK!

     

     

Send me good photo and video reference of your face or the face of a loved one and I'll lovingly draw a really exaggerated drawing of it. If you want a slightly less exaggerated and crazy caricature, that is possible too, but you should still expect a really funny and cartoony drawing! This will be a studio-quality sketch that will take me at least an hour or 2 to create. Up to 2 people can be in this marker and colored pencil art stix drawing.

Includes E-BOOK!

(use PayPal please)


$150 now just $100: DREAM DRAWING + E-BOOK!

     

     
Really REALLY exaggerated and intensely colorful with touches of abstraction and surrealism. The color will be so thick that it will look like a pastel drawing mixed with a painting. All done with marker and colored pencil art stix. Expect a crazy beauty! Photo and video reference needed. Up to 3 faces allowed. Pet faces allowed too!

E-BOOK included!

(use PayPal please)


$150 now just $100: IMPRESSION OF YOU + E-BOOK!

That's right, I will go all-out and do a 1-3 minute video impression of YOU or a loved one. This will be like a living caricature! I will talk like you, look like you, move like you and make you seem just completely ridiculous and funny. This takes me hours of research, practice and costume-making to create an awesome, truly unique impression. I'll need at least 5-15 minutes of video from you of you being you as much as you can :)

 Here are some friends I've done impressions of, from my youtube channel:



Includes the E-BOOK!

(use PayPal please)


$225 now just $175: LUSCIOUS WATER + E-BOOK!

     

     

A crazy and exaggerated watercolor or pen & ink with watercolor LUSCIOUS PAINTING! This is as exaggerated as it gets, folks. It will be on 12x16 inch watercolor paper, bristol paper or illustration board. I will need as much good photo and video reference as you can give me. 1 or 2 people can be destroyed in this piece. 

My E-BOOK is included!

(use PayPal please)


$250 now just $200: ORIGINAL ART + E-BOOK!

Select art pieces for sale include Jerry Seinfeld, Chuck Norris, Hitler, Saturn's Goya, Tommy Lee Jones, Sarah Silverman, Flight of the Conchords, Calvin & Hobbes, Tracy Morgan, Indiana Jones, Stella, Penelope Cruz, Marilyn Manson, Green Day, Bill Murray, Nick Cave, Brigitte Bardot, Emily Blunt, James Cromwell, Steve Carell, Helena Bonham Carter, Chuck Norris, Christoph Waltz, Michael Cera,  and Franz Kafka. Choose just 1 for $250, of course. Check out my website and/or facebook page to see them all. I'm open to selling other works as well; just message me on FB or email me! Here are just some of those pieces:

      

          

Includes E-BOOK!

(use PayPal please)


$450 now just $400: BEASTED ACRYLIC + E-BOOK!

An extra special, BEASTED acrylic painting, 18"x24" or larger. This is as crazy and as awesome as my caricature art can get. You'll get rich color, extreme exaggeration and an incredibly unique caricature. Expect the unexpected! 1-3 people and/or pets allowed. I need good photo and video reference. 

     


Of course you also get my E-BOOK!

(use PayPal please)


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP :)

-donate just $5 if you'd like to help me accomplish my goals but can't afford much. You'll get an official thank you in my e-book as well!

-please help share this campaign on facebook

-spread the word to friends and family, especially those looking for an awesome early-shopping Christmas idea!


THANK YOU ALL!!!

-Eric

story:
Who are we?

We are a group of friends based in the Bay Area, with roots throughout the world. We have come together as a community to build art for Black Rock City. We started with the original Typsy Gypsy Art Car back in 2012 which was a lot of fun for us and all the Participants we met throughout the City. In 2013 we installed Finestra Anima out in the open playa, and we loved the interaction between Participants and reading their wonderful comments.

This year, we're bringing the Gypsy back for it's third year, and we're making some big improvements!


What is the Tipsy Gypsy?

Simply put, the Tipsy Gypsy is a people mover. We are a comfortable & shaded escape from the heat of the day, and we love taking our fellow Burners on wonderful playa adventures. Our 16 foot trailer holds 20 Burners, and we have a few bike hooks for our 2-wheeled friends. 


For 2012 & 2013, we used a wonderful little tractor to pull everyone around in the desert. We ran into many issues though, as it was underpowered and broke down several times out in deep playa.

We have said good-bye to our little tractor, and are currently building The Psychedelephant! Built around a 10 foot box truck, this wonderful elephant will pull the Tipsy Gypsy and her occupants everywhere. Sitting atop the body will be a loft for Participants to enjoy.

During the day, you'll see wonderful fabric patterns creating the body of the elephant, and a large plush head made of vibrant colors. At night the side panels and head will brightly glow, showing the shape of the different body parts.

Why $1,400?

Selling our old tractor gave us a nice head-start! We've also been fundraising within our community, and we've got just shy of $2,500.

With the box truck & gasoline being around $2,000, and The Psychedelephant materials (lumber, hardware, fabric, paint, lighting, PVC) being around $1,900, we have a total budget of $3,900... and we're looking for $1,400 more to finish!


Thank you!

If you can't contribute, but want to help.. please share with your friends!

We'll see you in the desert, Burners!

story:
Help us grow under-served artists


My name is Juan José Bautista, Founder of Arte Primitivista, born in Managua, Nicaragua, a third world development country. I am a System Engineer that loves naive art, I started this project from scratch with my own resources and savings in Dec 2011.

We had tough times in the beginning and when we hit the bottom, we tried to learn from it . The best thing we have learned, is to listen to what people have to say. We listen more to our artists,  to the art lovers, to the community and this has helped us now build long-term relationships with every actor, trying to deliver more value to everyone’s lives.

We deliver unique stories of Primitivista/Naive Art through the Internet, with direct collaboration with our, under-served, artists / artisans, for the preservation of culture, environment, promotion and fair trade.

Primitivista painters in Nicaragua are typically people from modest underserved communities that interpret their surroundings via painting. They learned basic techniques, and use of color in a series of government sponsored workshops and schools, that ran during the 80s in the country.

Nevertheless  the naive artists from Nicaragua do not have any external support any longer  Almost none of them has a stable income and barely roof over their head. But what we see is their introspective dedication, that all big artists from history had. In many cases these simple people have to do odd jobs to supply for their immediate needs, in order to buy their work supplies. Our mission is to stabilize their income, help them grow and give them better opportunities.


Art Naive Festival in Poland


This international festival of naïve art for the 7thtime will be held in Szyb Wilson Gallery in Katowice, Poland. This is an unique event in Europe. Their record is  over 1500  paintings and sculptures,  287 artists and 34 countries. .  They get a lot of international attention,  where the international naïve art community gathers.


We receive an invitation from the organizers of this festival, please feel free to write them at projekty@szybwilson.org. This is very good opportunity to nicaraguan artists to show their heart on paintings, by the first time, and grow trought their participation.

Four of our artist will participate with two paintings each one, we are looking to double this number of artist the next year.


Days of Love



Our Artists

We are collaborating with more than 20 artists all over Nicaragua. The following are the artists that are going to participate this year in the Festival thanks to your support.

Alvaro Gaitan

Alvaro Gaitan began painting in 1980 through a workshop with Luis Alvarado, thanks to Father Ernesto Cardenal, in the Salesian College in Masaya. Alvaro also enjoys writing, has published art articles in the literary press. His technique is oil on canvas, which used to express the nature, happiness, joy, country life, his main motivation.


Abel Vargas

He was born on the Island of Ometepe in 1958. He is 1st Place winner at the I Bienal Centroamericana Primitivist Painting "Asilia Guillen". Abel Vargas began to paint professionally in the 80's, a period in which his painting is seduced by the touch naive.

A naive painting style which incorporates the tender, and melancholy of the early naive Nicaragua itself, and was born on unconsciously in the archipelago of Solentiname.

However, the workshops promoted by the poet Ernesto Cardenal in Solentiname Abel Vargas motivate a naive painting that takes you to recreate the atmosphere of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua, although the black dark tones prevail.

Originally from the island of Ometepe, and motivated by the lush landscapes of his youth, is mid 90's, where Vargas is released a little naive technique, and begin to recreate a magical landscape of green power, "turned soles" , to revitalize the strength of the animal and vegetable.


Pablo Paisano

A native of Ometepe, Nicaragua, land of lakes and volcanoes. With 35 years of experience in painting style includes primitivism and abstract. 

From humble character, hardworking and passionate about art, his work highlights the Nicaraguan landscape inspiration, because in the words of Paul Paisano: "In my paintings shoulder the elements of my homeland, because I enjoy the game of colors when I paint".


William Gonzalez

"My passion for environmental issues, inspire me to paint considering the beauty of nature as a gift of God, which we must preserve and conserve"



Live with Passion

This video is copyrighted on youtube for a nicaraguan channel so we could not add subtitles in english, sorry for that.


What We Need?

  • $190 for refastening of the loom on the Festival for 8 paintings + bank transfer.
  • $650 for shipping and handling for 8 paintings with insurance. Using Fedex with special discount we requested.
  • $70 to get the Export Bill from INC (Nicaraguan Institute of Culture) for 8 paintings.
  • $150 for buying the materials for packaging.
  • $280 for paying Custom Duties in Poland.
  • $680 for shipping of 8 paintings back to Nicaragua + bank transfer.
  • $2,020 Total


What We Have?


  • Registrations and confirmation fee to participate with 8 paintings in the Festival.
  • 8 beautiful paintings previous selected from 4 different artists. You can check more details in the Gallery section.
  • Special discount to send paintings with Fedex.


What You Get?

We want to give our best to you. Most of these rewards are special for this campaign, you can not find it otherwise.


Thank You Printed PostCard

Select a 6 x 4 inches Printed Post Card, with a Thank you note signed by all the artist that are going to participate in this Festival. This includes Snail Mail shipping.

Your name will be added to a list of supporters to Nicaraguan artists participating in the Festival and published in our web site and Facebook page, unless you want anonymity.




ThankYou PostCard Art

Post Card Art (6 x 4 inches) painted on Canvas from your favorite Artist, in the back a thank you note signed by all the artist that are going to participate in this Festival.

Includes Snail Mail Shipping anywhere in the world.

Your name will be added to a list of supporters to Nicaraguan artists participating in the Festival and published in our web site and Facebook page, unless you want anonymity.


Triptych Post Cards Art

3 Post Card Art (6 x 4 inches) painted on Canvas from your favorite Artist. They all are one painting if located aside.

Includes Snail Mail Shipping anywhere in the world.

Your name will be added to a list of supporters to Nicaraguan artists participating in the Festival and published in our web site and Facebook page, unless you want anonymity.


Vertical Primitivista Painting

Original Primitivista Painting (33 cms. height by 11.5 cms. width) from your favorite Artist, where you can choose the topic, including Express and Secure Shipping anywhere in the world. This also includes a Certificate of Authenticy.

Receive also a Thank You Printed Post Card.

Your name will be added to a list of supporters to Nicaraguan artists participating in the Festival and published in our web site and Facebook page, unless you want anonymity


Squared Primitivista Painting

Original Primitivista Painting (40 cms. height by 40 cms. width) from your favorite Artist, where you can choose the topic, including Express and Secure Shipping anywhere in the world. This also includes a Certificate of Authenticy.

Receive also a Thank You Printed Post Card.

Your name will be added to a list of supporters to Nicaraguan artists participating in the Festival and published in our web site and Facebook page, unless you want anonymity.


Fully Personalized Painting  (FEATURED)

Personalized Primitivista Painting (60 cms. height by 80 cms. width) from your favorite Artist, including Express and Secure Shipping anywhere in the world.  This also includes a Certificate of Authenticy.

Read More about Personalized Paintings

Your name will be added to a list of supporters to Nicaraguan artists participating in the Festival and published in our web site and Facebook page, unless you want anonymity.



If we reach the goal we are going to send all the paintings, if not, we are going to send paintings in accordance of the amount raised.


What people say about our work

"Primitivista Arte provides a great opportunity to buy naive art paintings from outstanding artists. We even had the possibility to participate in the process of the creation of a painting done especially for us. This resulted in a very beautiful painting that brings a lot of joy in our home. The service was excellent and very personal at all stages."

Norbert Heinemann, Germany


Thank you for trusting in us!

I am a System Engineer that loves naive art, I started this project from scratch with my own resources and savings in Dec 2011.We had tough times in the beginning and when we hit the bottom, we tried to learn from it . The best thing we have learned, is to listen to what people have to say. We listen more to our artists,  to the art lovers, to the community and this has helped us now build long-term relationships with every actor, trying to deliver more value to everyone’s lives.We deliver unique stories of Primitivista/Naive Art through the Internet, with direct collaboration with our, under-served, artists / artisans, for the preservation of culture, environment, promotion and fair trade.Primitivista painters in Nicaragua are typically people from modest
underserved communities that interpret their surroundings via painting. They
learned basic techniques, and use of color in a series of government sponsored
workshops and schools, that ran during the 80s in the country.Nevertheless  the naive artists
from Nicaragua do not have any external support any longer  Almost none of them has a stable income and
barely roof over their head. But what we see is their introspective dedication,
that all big artists from history had. In many cases these simple people have
to do odd jobs to supply for their immediate needs, in order to buy their work
supplies. Our mission is to stabilize their income, help them grow and give
them better opportunities.Art Naive Festival in PolandThis international festival of naïve art for the 7thtime will be held in Szyb
Wilson Gallery in Katowice, Poland. This is an unique event in Europe. Their
record is  over 1500  paintings and sculptures,  287 artists and 34 countries. .  They get a lot of international attention,  where the international naïve art community
gathers.We receive an invitation from the organizers of this festival, please feel free to write them at projekty@szybwilson.org. This is very good opportunity to nicaraguan artists to show their heart on paintings, by the first time, and grow trought their participation.Four of our artist will participate with two paintings each one, we are looking to double this number of artist the next year.Days of LoveOur ArtistsWe are collaborating with more than 20 artists all over Nicaragua. The following are the artists that are going to participate this year in the Festival thanks to your support.Alvaro GaitanAlvaro Gaitan began painting in 1980 through a workshop with Luis Alvarado, thanks to Father Ernesto Cardenal, in the Salesian College in Masaya. Alvaro also enjoys writing, has published art articles in the literary press. His technique is oil on canvas, which used to express the nature, happiness, joy, country life, his main motivation.Abel VargasHe was born on the Island of Ometepe in 1958. He is 1st Place winner at the I Bienal Centroamericana Primitivist Painting "Asilia Guillen". Abel Vargas began to paint professionally in the 80's, a period in which his painting is seduced by the touch naive.A naive painting style which incorporates the tender, and melancholy of the early naive Nicaragua itself, and was born on unconsciously in the archipelago of Solentiname.However, the workshops promoted by the poet Ernesto Cardenal in Solentiname Abel Vargas motivate a naive painting that takes you to recreate the atmosphere of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua, although the black dark tones prevail.Originally from the island of Ometepe, and motivated by the lush landscapes of his youth, is mid 90's, where Vargas is released a little naive technique, and begin to recreate a magical landscape of green power, "turned soles" , to revitalize the strength of the animal and vegetable.Pablo PaisanoA native of Ometepe, Nicaragua, land of lakes and volcanoes. With 35 years of experience in painting style includes primitivism and abstract. From humble character, hardworking and passionate about art, his work highlights the Nicaraguan landscape inspiration, because in the words of Paul Paisano: "In my paintings shoulder the elements of my homeland, because I enjoy the game of colors when I paint".William Gonzalez"My passion for environmental issues, inspire me to paint considering the beauty of nature as a gift of God, which we must preserve and conserve"Live with PassionThis video is copyrighted on youtube for a nicaraguan channel so we could not add subtitles in english, sorry for that.What We Need?
$190 for refastening of the loom on the Festival for 8 paintings + bank transfer.

$650 for shipping and handling for 8 paintings with insurance. Using Fedex with special discount we requested.
$70 to get the Export Bill from INC (Nicaraguan Institute of Culture) for 8 paintings.
$150 for buying the materials for packaging.
$280 for paying Custom Duties in Poland.
$680 for shipping of 8 paintings back to Nicaragua + bank transfer.
$2,020 Total
What We Have?
Registrations and confirmation fee to participate with 8 paintings in the Festival.

8 beautiful paintings previous selected from 4 different artists. You can check more details in the Gallery section.
Special discount to send paintings with Fedex.
What You Get?We want to give our best to you. Most of these rewards are special for this campaign, you can not find it otherwise.Thank You Printed PostCardSelect a 6 x 4 inches Printed Post Card, with a Thank you note signed by all the artist that are going to participate in this Festival. This includes Snail Mail shipping.Your name will be added to a list of supporters to Nicaraguan artists participating in the Festival and published in our web site and Facebook page, unless you want anonymity.ThankYou PostCard ArtPost Card Art (6 x 4 inches) painted on Canvas from your favorite Artist, in the back a thank you note signed by all the artist that are going to participate in this Festival.Includes Snail Mail Shipping anywhere in the world.Your name will be added to a list of supporters to Nicaraguan artists participating in the Festival and published in our web site and Facebook page, unless you want anonymity.Triptych Post Cards Art3 Post Card Art (6 x 4 inches) painted on Canvas from your favorite Artist. They all are one painting if located aside.Includes Snail Mail Shipping anywhere in the world.Your name will be added to a list of supporters to Nicaraguan artists participating in the Festival and published in our web site and Facebook page, unless you want anonymity.Vertical Primitivista PaintingOriginal Primitivista Painting (33 cms. height by 11.5 cms. width) from your favorite Artist, where you can choose the topic, including Express and Secure Shipping anywhere in the world. This also includes a Certificate of Authenticy.Receive also a Thank You Printed Post Card.Your name will be added to a list of supporters to Nicaraguan artists participating in the Festival and published in our web site and Facebook page, unless you want anonymitySquared Primitivista PaintingOriginal Primitivista Painting (40 cms. height by 40 cms. width) from your favorite Artist, where you can choose the topic, including Express and Secure Shipping anywhere in the world. This also includes a Certificate of Authenticy.Receive also a Thank You Printed Post Card.Your name will be added to a list of supporters to Nicaraguan artists participating in the Festival and published in our web site and Facebook page, unless you want anonymity.Fully Personalized Painting  (FEATURED)Personalized Primitivista Painting (60 cms. height by 80 cms. width) from your favorite Artist, including Express and Secure Shipping anywhere in the world.  This also includes a Certificate of Authenticy.Read More about Personalized PaintingsYour name will be added to a list of supporters to Nicaraguan artists participating in the Festival and published in our web site and Facebook page, unless you want anonymity.If we reach the goal we are going to send all the paintings, if not, we are going to send paintings in accordance of the amount raised.What people say about our work"Primitivista Arte provides a great opportunity to buy naive art paintings from outstanding artists. We even had the possibility to participate in the process of the creation of a painting done especially for us. This resulted in a very beautiful painting that brings a lot of joy in our home. The service was excellent and very personal at all stages."Norbert Heinemann, GermanyThank you for trusting in us!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mapendo Sumuni. I am a 30-year Congolese woman, who recently opened the first art gallery in Goma, eastern Congo. My aim is to show case the extraordinary work of Congolese artists, promote their work and find them outlets to help them express their individual beauty that lingers inside.


The art house Kivu Nuru offers a rich collection of products by painters, sculptors, tailors, potters and many other talented artists. Their pieces of art speak to the vibrant culture of designers who call Goma home. Their work reflects their unbound desire to create in a challenging environment. A testament to their hope and resolve.  


Please take a look at the video and I will walk you through my art house.


What We Need  

To sustain the art house for the following year, we will need:

  • $2,000 for training workshops for artists. 
  • $1500 for additional material, incl. fabric, wood, and clay. 
  • $500 for five sewing machines. 
  • $1,200 for annual salary of one seamstress.
  • $250 for promotion, incl. flyers, posters, and banners.
  • $250 extra.

Each artist will continue to pay his commission for their products sold in the shop. 


The Impact

Over the last twenty years, eastern Congo has been the theater of the world's deadliest conflict since World War II. While our country remains beset by problems, we have to look forward and rebuild our lives and future. Art offers a unique form of resistance and means for individual self-empowerment. With so many young aspiring talents in Goma, we can change the trajectory of Congo for the better. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word and make noise about Kivu Nuru. Visit our website, like us onFacebook, and follow us onTwitter.

If you missed our campaign, you can still preorder a copy of the book from our website

HURRY, limited number of copies. This book is not available in stores. Get the book here











If you missed our campaign, you can still preorder a copy of the book from our website

HURRY, LIMITED time only! Limited number of copies. This book is not available in stores. Click here











We asked 200 artists one question."If we could make a book that would solve all of your art problems, what would that book be?" The following problem areas came up repeatedly:

1. Character design                                        

2. Action poses

3. Drawing faces                                            

4. Drawing hands

21 Draw SOLVES all of these problems

We hired over 100 of the most famous artists in the world to work on this project. We have artists from Disney, Marvel, Dreamworks, Rockstar games, Capcom, Sony and other giants of the entertainment and gaming industry. We specifically selected artists who have experience as character designers. About 50% of the images are black and white and 50% are grey scale.

Each artist was asked to pick one unique character design and draw it in the following poses:



An example to clarify: One of our artists picked a "hero" character reference. He draws the hero in 2 full body reference poses (front & side), 3 action poses, the hero's face with different expressions and the hero's hands with different gestures. 10 images altogether. Get it? Good. 















If you missed our campaign, you can still preorder a copy of the book from our website

HURRY, LIMITED time only! Limited number of copies. This book is not available in stores. Click here

The best way to help the project is to buy a copy of the book. If you can't afford to buy a copy but you love this project you can click here . It takes 10 seconds to complete and you will get the satisfaction of knowing that you helped make this book a reality. 

We are a group of international artists with headquarters in Sweden and main operations in the US.

We also have an amazing network of professional industry artists from the US, UK, Canada and all over the world working hard to make this book a reality. 

Added to this, we have a group of US shippers, packers, customer services reps and more waiting for the book to be printed.

We have one goal: To make this book a reality. 

If you have any questions you can contact us in the following ways:

Email: contact@21-draw.com

Facebook:  www.facebook.com/21draw (best option)

Twitter: www.twitter.com/21_draw

Website: www.21-draw.com

Skype User Name: twenty_one_draw






If you missed our campaign, you can still preorder a copy of the book from our website

HURRY, LIMITED time only! Limited number of copies. This book is not available in stores. Click here


International friends must add shipping manually. You do this by:

1. Choose your perk above

2. You will see a box that reads "How much would you like to contribute?" 

3. Add the cost of your shipping to the cost of your perk. Easy!



Email: contact@21-draw.com

Facebook:  www.facebook.com/21draw (best option)

Twitter: www.twitter.com/21_draw

Website: www.21-draw.com

Skype User Name: twenty_one_draw


Do you accept PayPal? 

Yes, click here: http://www.21-draw.com/paypal/

How do I add International Shipping? 

Shipping must be added manually. Follow these steps: Click on the perk you want. You will see a box that reads "How much would you like to contribute?" Add the cost of your shipping to the cost of your perk. Easy! If you have already contributed but forgot shipping, you can edit your pledge amount through your account.

Why is international shipping so expensive? 

First off, we want to acknowledge that the cost of shipping internationally is expensive. We worked with multiple carriers in search of the best solution to ship these books. Most importantly, we want the book to arrive safe and fast which is why we are using FedEx.The book weighs 4 pounds which increases the cost by a huge amount. It's hard to believe but in many cases we will actually be losing money. Click on your perk and add shipping above.

Where do I add my shipping address? 

You can add it when you contribute. Don't worry about this anyway - at the end of the campaign, a survey will be sent to all contributors requesting your shipping address, email and any other information required to process your order.

You said the electronic version is "protected". What does that mean? 

It means that the electronic version cannot be copied, and can only be viewed by people who purchased it.

Why are you called 21 Draw? 

When we started this project we only had a budget to hire 21 artists. However,  a huge number of the artists were so enthusiastic that we couldn't resist adding more. Hence, the reason why we need you now. So please contribute by choosing your perk above.

What are the risks? 

The main risk is making sure that you get this book on time and that it is the greatest book you have ever owned. That's no small task, but we are serious when we say that you will love every single page of this book or you get your money back.  If you are unsure about anything contact us here: contact@21-draw.com

story:
Kina was Olympia's 2016 Individual World Poetry Slam Champion! This means that Kina has an opportunity to represent Olympia at IWPS this October in Flagstaff AZ, where she will compete against the other 71 poets who have qualified from around the nation. The Individual World Poetry Slam is an annual competition where poets from around the country compete against each other. 

This year it's in Flagstaff Arizona. It's a great opportunity for Kina to grow as an artist, increase her performance and writing skills and bare her soul on a National stage.  

This campaign will raise the funds to cover Kina's travel and housing expenses. Anything helps. Thanks for reading!
story_txt:
Kina was Olympia's 2016 Individual World Poetry Slam Champion! This means that Kina has an opportunity to represent Olympia at IWPS this October in Flagstaff AZ, where she will compete against the other 71 poets who have qualified from around the nation. The Individual World Poetry Slam is an annual competition where poets from around the country compete against each other. 
This year it's in Flagstaff Arizona. It's a great opportunity for Kina to grow as an artist, increase her performance and writing skills and bare her soul on a National stage.  
This campaign will raise the funds to cover Kina's travel and housing expenses. Anything helps. Thanks for reading!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! Michael X. Rose here, an artist working in the Hudson Valley Region of NY State. I specialize in bring scenes of Terror and Mayhem to life in oil on canvas in an "Old Master" tradition. Romantic, Symbolist, and the Sublime are my territory. "If it bleeds, it leads, " said William Shakespeare.

  • This campaign is to raise the rent money for a one month exhibition at Catalyst Gallery (Pop-Up). Also, help pay for promotional materials.
  • The Gallery will be a tour-de-force of the bizarre, fantastic, and eye-popping horror with your help. YOU get a painting at half price!

What We Need & What You Get

The Breakdown:

  • We need 1,200$. Rent is 1,100. That leaves 100$ to print a postcard publicizing the show and to buy some sexy adult beverages for the Opening Reception. 
  • My perks are awesome; I've cut my painting prices IN HALF and you get to pick the subject matter of your personalized painting. As long as it's in my genre, I'll paint it. Just give me 3-6 months and you 'll have an Old Master painting of Doom, Horror, Chaos , and Doubt. 
  • If we don't reach the goal, whatever we raise will defray the rental costs of the gallery. You will still get your prize. My 8 kids just won't get new shoes or eat that month (yes, I really have 8 kids, :-) ).  

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • This will be the second annual Catalyst show for Michael X. Rose. The first one was a smash with over 400 people attending the opening.
  • This will be my 5th successful fundraiser for pop-up exhibitions, the others being three for Fountain Art Fair in NYC and last year's Catalyst show. Sponsors have loved the paintings they've gotten as rewards and I have many repeat pledgers who come back year after year for another new painting. 
  • Event though over 1000 people visited the gallery during the exhibition, only one painting was sold for 200$. The publicity and contacts generated is amazing, but sales are low. This is why your help and support is so critical to this project. 

Risks & Challenges

If  I don't meet the goal, this will be the last season of the Catalyst Pop-Up Show. The costs are modest but too much to be carried by one artist without your generous help.  

It's a lot of work creating the reward paintings, but it's fun too; partnering with supporters to create a work of art on a theme that they selected and truly love. 

  • To enter the gallery with the rent paid, means I can show larger, riskier works that have less sales potential but perhaps greater aesthetic value..
  • Funding a great opening bash with exotic food and delicious wines and beers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Friends, Comrades, and Art Lovers,please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. THANKS, I LOVE YOU ALL!!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Gallery will be a tour-de-force of the bizarre, fantastic, and eye-popping horror with your help. YOU get a painting at half price!  What We Need & What You Get
 The Breakdown:  We need 1,200$. Rent is 1,100. That leaves 100$ to print a postcard publicizing the show and to buy some sexy adult beverages for the Opening Reception.  My perks are awesome; I've cut my painting prices IN HALF and you get to pick the subject matter of your personalized painting. As long as it's in my genre, I'll paint it. Just give me 3-6 months and you 'll have an Old Master painting of Doom, Horror, Chaos , and Doubt.  If we don't reach the goal, whatever we raise will defray the rental costs of the gallery. You will still get your prize. My 8 kids just won't get new shoes or eat that month (yes, I really have 8 kids, :-) ).      The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:  This will be the second annual Catalyst show for Michael X. Rose. The first one was a smash with over 400 people attending the opening. This will be my 5th successful fundraiser for pop-up exhibitions, the others being three for Fountain Art Fair in NYC and last year's Catalyst show. Sponsors have loved the paintings they've gotten as rewards and I have many repeat pledgers who come back year after year for another new painting.  Event though over 1000 people visited the gallery during the exhibition, only one painting was sold for 200$. The publicity and contacts generated is amazing, but sales are low. This is why your help and support is so critical to this project.     Risks & Challenges If  I don't meet the goal, this will be the last season of the Catalyst Pop-Up Show. The costs are modest but too much to be carried by one artist without your generous help.  
It's a lot of work creating the reward paintings, but it's fun too; partnering with supporters to create a work of art on a theme that they selected and truly love.   To enter the gallery with the rent paid, means I can show larger, riskier works that have less sales potential but perhaps greater aesthetic value.. Funding a great opening bash with exotic food and delicious wines and beers.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Friends, Comrades, and Art Lovers,please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. THANKS, I LOVE YOU ALL!! Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What is White Raven Ink?

White Raven Ink is a small (one-woman) letterpress and print studio located in rural Nova Scotia, Canada. I design and print greeting cards and fine art prints from my own artwork, using letterpress, linocut, and related printmaking techniques. I also do fine bookbinding and a little papermaking.

I've been working with pop-up structures and other hand-cut paper items for a while now, and have plans to combine cut paper with letterpress for a new line of greeting cards. Hand-cutting would make these cards far too expensive (not to mention time-consuming), but a die-cuting machine that would allow me to cut my own designs would keep costs down and let me create affordable products.

What I Need

The main things I need to add die-cutting to White Raven Ink's offerings are:

  • a die-cutter
  • software to translate my designs
  • lots of paper, cutting blades, and other consumables

Die-Cutter

I've done a tonne of research and have picked out two models of die-cutter, a cheaper one and a more expensive one. Which I purchase will depend on how much this campaign raises.

Option 1: Sizzix eclips

This machine comes with the necessary software and performs all of the necessary functions for die-cutting my own designs. It would work well, though it doesn't have a lot of potential for expansion in terms of larger sizes, thicker materials, or scoring/engtraving. On sale, I can get this one for about $300 plus shipping.

Option 2: Black Cat Cougar

This machine is considerably higher priced, but it's also bigger, cuts a wider variety of materials, and does scoring and engraving in addition to basic cutting. Software is included and even though it's still a desktop machine, it's close to industrial quality. This machine would cost between $750 and $1100 plus shipping, depending on what size I get.

 

Other Equipment

If I raise enough to buy a die-cutter, I'll be deleriously happy, but in the unlikely event that I end up exceeding my funding goals by a substantial amount, there are other pieces of equipment I'd love to add to my studio (all things I'm going to need to replace soon, anyway).

  • computer: My poor old laptop is well over six years old, and showing its age. I'd love to replace it with a desktop iMac.
  • graphics tablet: Anyone who has done much designing on a computer will probably know how much easier a graphics tablet makes things. I currently have a Wacom Graphire 3, which I purchased way back in 2003 (!), and I'd really like to replace it with an Intuos.
  • software: Though the die-cutters come bundled with die-cuttting software, I prefer to design with Adobe's Creative Suite. I'm currently running CS4, but it would be nice to upgrade.

What You Get

Goodies! By supporting this campaign you get first dibs on the new die-cut greeting cards, letterpress items from White Raven Ink's catalogue, and other cool handmade, hand-printed stuff.

Die-Cut Cards

Since the aim of this campaign is to buy die-cutting equipment, the main funding incentives are cards from the new line. I'm currently working to have two sets of designs ready for sale by the holidays, but time permitting I may add more.

Dragons

The first set will be a series of four dragons, one each for earth, air, fire, and water. The prototype in the image (that one's hand-cut) is fire.

Holiday

I'm also working on some more complicated, multi-layer pop up cards with a winter theme. The one in the picture is one I hand-cut for my mother last year, but it will give you an idea of where I'm headed. There will be four different designs.

Handbound "Book" Cards

These are the same pop-up card designs, but hand-bound in hard covers. They look like a book from the outside, and when opened, the heavier covers stay open flat on a table, so you can use the cards as decorations. The example in the image is the one I made for my mother last year. These make for a more substantial gift than just a card, and can be enjoyed just like a pop-up book.

Sculpture

Every dragon sculpture will be a little different, since even if they're die-cut, they'll still be hand assembled. My plan is to offer these both as fully-assembled art pieces, and as pre-cut kits you assemble yourself. Although the sample image is in white, I'll probably make them in colours, too. Eventually, there will probably be a letterpress-printed version, but for now they're just cut.

Letterpress Goodies

If you choose the highest level of support, you'll get a pile of letterpress cards and other goodies in addition to the die-cut stuff. The pictures below show a sampling of what you might get, though I haven't decided on what exactly will be included yet. More than likely, you'll get way more than $500 worth of stuff, because I love giving people stuff.

Stretch Goals and More Cool Stuff

As the campaign goes on if it looks like we'll meet or exceed the funding goal, I'll be adding more items to the rewards. I don't know what they'll be yet, but I'm thinking about bookmarks (both die-cut and letterpress), stickers, fridge magnets... Maybe even letterpress-printed t-shirts. You're welcome to make suggestions if you have a great idea.

As the campaign goes on, I'll be adding more images of designs in progress and prototypes, so stay tuned. And if a miracle happens and I get tonnes of time for designing, I may add other choices tot he rewards aside from the dragons and holiday cards.

Other Ways You Can Help

Obviosuly, not everyone who wants to support the campaign can, but there are other things you can do to show your support:

  • share this campaign with your networks on Twitter, Facebook, or wherever else you hang out
  • check out my Etsy shops (go to Etsy, and search for WhiteRavenArts, anagramforink, or OsteoSophy--those three shops are all me)

A million thanks to anyone who has actually read this far! Your support can make this happen.

story:
the project...

Project HOPE Art believes that Art is the universal language which transcends differences in cultural and customary barriers.  Art is a tool for education that encourages creative thinking, problem solving and growth.  Art gives a voice to the voiceless.  Art is good for the soul.  

PHA supports performance artist Pamela Crawford's Project Express Yourself via our Visiting Artist Program.  Her goal for her two weeks in Haiti with PHA partner organizations is to bring self and group expression to the children of Haiti through the art of Hooping.  Pamela will teach hooping skills that will culminate in a community performance at the end of her residency in Haiti.  This performance and the days leading up to it will be filmed for documentation.

This form of dance and exercise carries many physical, mental and emotional benefits.  In dance as a whole, children find ways to use movement for exploration, and to communicate ideas, issues, and their own feelings and thoughts. Adding a hoop to the foundation of dance not only has a fun and memorable impact on their childhood but throughout their life. 

the impact...

Sometimes children can become so bogged down with the worries of daily life that they forget to let a little of their own creativity come out as they develop into adults. By nature, we are individuals who are yearning to express ourselves to the world.  Fulfilling the natural desire to express who we and share that expression with others is one of the best ways to find peace of mind. The children of Haiti will explore the world of hoop dance to help inspire self esteem, self expression, self respect and provide stress relief. 

what we have and what we need...

This is a project fuelled by passion. Project HOPE Art and Pamela Crawford believe deeply in our mission and will make this project a reality with your help.  PHA has made 6 trips to Haiti since its inception in 2010. We are now proud to bring visiting artists to Haiti so they can share their skills and talents.  Pamela is based in Los Angeles, CA where she has taught hoop enthusiasts and children the beauty of hoop dance for the past five years.  She also trains hoopers and fitness experts to become certified hoop teachers as the Teacher Training Coordinator and Master Trainer for Hoopnotica. 

The $4250 raised in this campaign will be used to cover the main expenses of executing this project such as transportation, lodging, equipment and filming costs. All PHA team members and Pamela Crawford are volunteering their time, energy and personal expenses into this project.  Any funds we may raise above the $4,250 will go towards the greater PHA mission and its Haitian project partners by bringing supplies and materials to those who need it most.  PHA is fiscally sponsored by Fractured Atlas which makes all of your donations tax deductible.

Our aim is to complete this fundraiser in October and execute this project in January of 2013.

ways to help...

You can help, not just by donating, but also by sharing this campaign anywhere you can, as often as you can!

Visit www.projecthopeart.org for even more ways to help.

story:
Our Story

We are a collective formed through academia. 15 artists and writers from 10 different countries coming together to reveal our final projects. Not one project is the same; the interests, influences and subject areas are as diverse as our backgrounds. We are rich in ideas, enthusiasm and passion for art and visual expression. Help us realise our vision and make the exhibition as memorable as the work it contains. 

What We Need 

This year, all funding from the University was cancelled to the MA courses. As a result, our exhibition is entirely self funded. We have each donated to the exhibition individually but anything extra would really help us go the extra mile and make something we are all proud to be a part of. 

The Impact

Just  snippet of what your contribution would go towards:

A banner - we really need a banner at the entrance to the gallery and this is an expense of £300 

The catalogue and invitations - we are fortunate enough to have a fantastic designer in our collective who has created an innovative catalogue... but production and printing costs equate to £1000

The Challenge

We are all emerging artists passionate and committed about getting our work out in to the world. Unfortunately, this comes with a price tag. Making work in itself comes at a great expense. We have all contributed to the exhibition costs but any and every donation will make a difference to us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on social media to see the build up to the show! We are sharing our work in progress, the hurdles,  the breakthroughs and the inspirations. Remember to share with your friends! 

The exhibition will be at Ambika P3, opposite Baker Street station from 1st - 6th September. 

Instagram: new.stories

Twitter: @new__stories

Facebook: New Stories

www.newstories2016.com

story:
LAZAGNE MAGAZINE/ PASSION FOR ART

Lazagne is an Italian magazine (bilingual ENG-ITA) aimed to promote the work of artists, thinkers, and writers who share a common feature: the love for ART and CULTURE.
Lazagne Magazine was born in Venice, Italy, in September 2012.

The objective of Lazagne is to fill its pages with characters and curiosities that gravitate around the worlds of art, photography, music and culture in general, to create an extremely tasty blend.

Independence, transversalism and beauty are the basis of Lazagne magazine.
Look for artists, discover them, study them and love them! Passion from the cosmopolitan air that cleverly interweaves art, photography, design, fashion, film, music, theater and literature.

WE NEED …

Contributions to the expenses of the next issue of Lazagne Art Magazine # 8, which will be released in late January.

it is difficult to pursue a project with its own forces. And that's why we ask you to help us. With simplicity, we love the culture, the art and the artists that we insert in Lazagne magazine. We believe that the irony is an elixir of life. Buy yourself a piece of LAZAGNE. You will not regret!

We want to continue to love art and artists.
We want to continue to believe in our dream, to prove that art and culture are as useful as breathing and eating!
How like eating... a good "Lazagna".
Become a backer of Lazagne Magazine.
Become a backer of a dream.

LAZAGNE MAGAZINE/ TEAM

Anna Bertozzi Founder  - Art Director/ Visual Designer and Photographer
Sabrina Ravaglia  Production Director
Lara Vitali  Visual Designer
Veronika Aguglia Fashion Editor

www.lazagnemagazine.com



LAZAGNE MAGAZINE#8  / ARTISTS

Chico De Luigi (Italy), Michael Kampe (Germany),  Amélie Nothomb (France), Viola Emaldi (Italy), Isidro Ferrer (Spain) , Can Pekdemir (Turkey) ,
Lori Nix (United States).

LAZAGNE MAGAZINE#8  / BUDGET

The estimate to print Issue N.8 is approximately $3.000. The Lazagne Team, has worked and will work endlessly, with passion and diligence, to bring our vision to goal.
In order to do so, we need a little help from you.
Because...Lazagne magazine is honest , loves the irony and it is as it appears!


LAZAGNE MAGAZINE#8  / BAG

Limited Edition LAZAGNE Magazine  "Lead the way" Bag.

LAZAGNE MAGAZINE#8 / T-SHIRT




LAZAGNE MAGAZINE#8  / PAGE THANKS

Your name and your website will be published on the Thanks Page.


LAZAGNE MAGAZINE/
ARTWORK ANDREA SALVATORI

Artwork "Waiting on the moon" dim. 10.5 cm pottery and porcelain. ©Andrea Salvatori
www.salvatoriandrea.it

story:
This year we have added two venues streamlined the number of performances and increased the quality of each. We continue to learn and grow. We are growing the event into a truly regional, even national, event. Along the way, we want to transform the festival and experiment with new events and formats.

Growth, transformation, even simple survival requires financial support.  The local storytelling organization, StorySwap, has committed all of it's resources to this festival. We enjoy support of the Grable Foundation and  Pennsylvania Partners in the Arts. Now we are asking for your help as well.

 Your donation will help us to bring in the featured performers: Connie Regan-Blake, Jim May, Alton Chung, and Lyn Ford. We are very excited that they are all able to come and we would love to be able to treat them as the very special guests that they are. We are also sponsoring a story scrum, a liar's contest, ghost stories, workshops, a lunch for Senior's, and a master class.  Help  us promote the festival and the stories it brings through the entire Pittsburgh region and beyond, and help us bring in the crowds of listeners eager to hear great stories.

If you cannot donate, you can help us by spreading the word about the festival (and this fund-raising campaign), by contacting us to volunteer at the festival itself, and by coming and enjoying the exciting stories on August 7th & 8th 2015
