story:
Interface is run as a labor of love by gallery director, Suzanne L’Heureux, who founded the gallery seven years ago. The primary emphasis has been on building relationships with and among artists and supporting their work.

  • The gallery offers artists a chance to take risks, explore new ideas and introduce new bodies of work.
  • We present works created by a mix of local, national, and international emerging and established artists to emphasize a broad contemporary art context.
  • Our interdisciplinary Creative Engagements series instigates generative exchanges among artists and audiences and across creative communities.
  • We offer financial support to exhibiting artists.
     


 

Over the last year alone, Interface distributed over $5000 to artists and other cultural producers who presented with us.

Like many non-profit art spaces, Interface relies on a variety of models to support this work. While we have been fortunate to receive several grants, we still need the ongoing support of our community. We need to raise another $3000 to cover our expenses until the end of the year and another $5000 to put us in good stead as we plan for the year to come.

To accomplish this, we are instigating:

  • This online campaign
  • An online auction - Click Here
  • An Art Sale and Party on September 6th, from 6-8 pm - Click Here
     


 

More and more, we are losing independent art spaces in the Bay Area that provide meaningful, professional exhibition opportunities for artists. Interface serves an essential function in our changing cultural landscape. We provide a crucial link in the arts eco-system for early to mid-career artists who have yet to gain recognition by commercial galleries and local institutions. We operate on a shoestring. And we do it because we love art and because we are dedicated to supporting and expanding our art communities.

Despite the high costs of operating in the Bay Area Interface continues  to present dynamic programming that enriches the local art scene. We need your support to continue to do it!

Exhibitions at Interface have been highlighted on many local and international publications and platforms including, Art Forum, Art Slant, Art News, Contemporary Art Daily, Art Practical, The San Francisco Chronicle, SFAQ, the East Bay Express and KQED Arts. Additionally, Interface has received grants from the Clorox Company Foundation, The Zellerbach Family Foundation, The Awesome Foundation, Southern Exposure, The Kenneth Rainin Foundation and The Phyllis C. Wattis Foundation for the Arts.

Your support will help us continue to do this work!
story_txt:
Interface is run as a labor of love by gallery director, Suzanne L’Heureux, who founded the gallery seven years ago. The primary emphasis has been on building relationships with and among artists and supporting their work.
The gallery offers artists a chance to take risks, explore new ideas and introduce new bodies of work.
We present works created by a mix of local, national, and international emerging and established artists to emphasize a broad contemporary art context.
Our interdisciplinary Creative Engagements series instigates generative exchanges among artists and audiences and across creative communities.
We offer financial support to exhibiting artists. 
 Over the last year alone, Interface distributed over $5000 to artists and other cultural producers who presented with us.Like many non-profit art spaces, Interface relies on a variety of models to support this work. While we have been fortunate to receive several grants, we still need the ongoing support of our community. We need to raise another $3000 to cover our expenses until the end of the year and another $5000 to put us in good stead as we plan for the year to come.To accomplish this, we are instigating:
This online campaign
An online auction - Click Here

story:
7 years of providing exciting programming and inclusive, safe space for leading regional art practices with residencies, podcasts, exhibitions and more..

As one of the only independent art spaces in Jamaica NLS has been a site for access to new cultural production, interrogation of social norms, and thought leadership locally and internationally. The organisation supports challenging and experimental art practices, providing artists of diverse backgrounds and identities with safe space, both intellectually and physically, to develop culturally interrogative work. For 7 years NLS has continued to create audiences for art through a podcast programme, open studios, artists’ notebooks and lectures, residencies, experimental exhibitions, and internships that provide avenues for public discourse and the exchange of ideas.

Recognizing the Caribbean as a hub of leading art practices...

With the support we give to diverse art practices NLS recognises the Caribbean as a hub of leading thought and praxis. This has been increasingly validated in the past 5 years not only with visual artists in the Caribbean and its diaspora being the subject of major museum exhibitions and major international awards, but also with the international partnerships NLS has secured. Most recently NLS has been awarded a three-year grant from the Prince Claus Fund for Culture and Development Next Generation partnership in support of our critical programming. 

In a context where the majority of art school students have dropped out or pursued different careers for lack of financial options, NLS has helped create a career pipeline and access to resources with the growing international and local support we receive.

Be an active member of our art community. Invest in the work. 

Your support is helping NLS to:

  • Increase our physical capacity to provide larger multimedia exhibition space and live/work space for two resident artists simultaneously, facilitating greater exchange, community-building and a secure environment for artists working on challenging projects.
  • Increase the stipend support we invest in artists
  • Acquire shared equipment for residents, staff, volunteers and interns in training: a computer, printer, camera and library. 
 

With your help we reach our minimum goal of $15,000.

Your contribution to this campaign benefits artists directly through the building of the project space and stipend support. 

We say thank you with limited edition perks from tote bags to art prints designed by accomplished artists who have passed through our programs.  

 

Any amount helps. It's as simple as sharing.

You can contribute as little as $1 USD (about $130 in Jamaican Dollars). If you can’t contribute today, there are other ways you can help us reach our goal 

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remember every share connects us to your wider community, use the share tools!

story:
It's that time of year again, TTITD. As you may know, each year I create an original design for our Community and for the front entrance for Burning Man, it's the first piece of art welcoming people to the Playa. It's become a tradition for many to stop and jump out to take their photo in front of it. Let's continue that tradition but with something new.

This year I am making something different and much LARGER for the I-ROBOT theme. I do get a small art stipend from BMHQ and I cover the rest of the costs myself. But, this year I am ready to stop being so selfish and let other people share in the enjoyment and great satisfaction of funding art for Burning Man. How noble is it that? I’m like Gandhi that way…Steve Gandhi, Iowa State, Class of ’86.

Along with your art funding, you will receive special acknowledgement in the form of a humorous email, snarky Facebook Post, enthusiastic hi-five, aggressive pat-on-the-back, sagacious raised eyebrow or other 'validation method' at my disposal. (Final form of acknowledgement to be determined by myself and a panel of judges.)

You'll also recieve credit in the “Making of” video and on a plaque under the piece.

I also have a few other perks as is costumary for these types of fundraisers.

Donate $25 - Limited Wooden Medallion Commemorating this project. (Final design to be determined.)

Donate $50 - 11 x 14, Numbered and Signed Photo Print of the finished piece.

Donate $100 - 11 x 14, Numbered and Signed Print of the finished piece + a set (x2) tickets to a show at The Great Northern in San Francisco. Thanks Micah & Brett!

Donate $100 - 11 x 14, Numbered and Signed Print of the finished piece + a set (x2) tickets to  the  ElectroSwing Extravaganza 'Trapeze Worldwide' - Bass and Burlesque. Thanks Boe!

Donate $100 - 11 x 14, Numbered and Signed Print of the finished piece + a set (x2) tickets to a show at Opulent Temple's Post Burning Man Party "Dust Off" or their Halloween Party at The Midway. Thanks Syd!

Donate $1000 - You get this original piece of Multi-Layered Acrylic Art Work from My Personal Collection. (I really don't want to part with this, but I will.)

What's it going to look like?

(Designs from previous year)

Although, I can not show you what I’m making just yet, it’s kind of a secret, but you'll be sent updates as we progress, but you can trust it will be cool and funding will go to paying fellow artists, materials, vodka & Monster energy drink.

Now it's off to work. See ya on the Playa.

"It's My Humility that Makes Me Awesome."
-Mad Dog

 

You can see the "Making of" videos on my web site here:

story:
The Artist

Gianluca Vassallo is an Italian artist based in Sardinia. His work examines social dimensions of art through photography, video and installations. He’s been producing and composing for film, theatre and dance companies for 15 years. 


The exhibition “Sapere Avvenire” for Palazzo delle Arti di Napoli (PAN Museum) kickstarted his artistic career in 2010. Vassallo is currently known in the European art scene as one of the emerging contemporary artists to watch. His works are on display at: Kiel Stadtgalerie (Germany), Schauwerk Museum (Sindelfingen, Germany), MART (Rovereto, Italy), Man Museum (Nuoro, Italy) and in various locations throughout Italy. 

Some of his art works are (or are going to be) part of several prestigious art collections in Europe: VAF Collection,  I Cotroneo Collection, Fondazione Banco di Sardegna Collection, Fondazione Meta Collection

Curators of his work were: Sonia Borsato, Ivo Serafino Fenu, Davide Mariani, Veronica Caciolli, Maria D’Ambrosio, Peter Waiermaier, Marina Vergiani.


The Project

Free Portrait is driven by a vision of contemporary art as interaction between the artist and the audience, the medium being just the artist’s ability to build an instant empathy with his subjects. The artist behaves as a “human recorder”, trying to leave a mark in other people’s life by simply sharing a single moment with them.

 

Wearing a sandwich board that only reads “Free Portrait”, Mr.Vassallo has been taking black and white portraits while also conducting an artistic and social experiment. As a result, the project is building a collective portrait of the City. Each photo is neither stolen nor exactly requested by the subjects, who most of the times just bump into the artist on the street. The visible sign on the board saying “Free Portrait” immediately announces an intention and a chance for both the artist and the subject.


Since New York is a city filled with people giving away “Free advices”, “Free poems”, “Free hugs”, this project might be felt as just one more tips-appreciated-moment – attractive and somehow unappealing at the same time. On top of that, what’s clear since the first eye-contact is that more than a photo is concerned here. When they agree to be photographed, people take charge of telling a story. The incipit is made up of their own way to break silence when meeting a stranger.


Project status and new funds

Free Portrait is made, at the time, of 1.300 photos, but my goal is 5000. So, I need new funds to finish the project.  The project so far has been  self-funded spending 12.000 dollars. I need new funds to go back to New York, try to photograph 3500 people with the usual practice (that provides the sign in my hands, wait for people ask me to be photographed, the meeting, the shooting, the goodbye), renting a space to show the work to the city, to pay the curator Peter Weiermair

story:
Here's whats happening:

My name is Katelyn Bladel, I am recent fine arts graduate, and I am heading out to Rosebud Indian Reservation in South Dakota on July 21st through the 28th.  I will be helping out at the Boys and Girls club in  Mission, SD where my friend Glen Marshall is the director.  I have put together some fun art lessons for each day and am looking forward to having a wonderful week creating art with them!

The first time I ever went to the reservation was on a mission trip when I was 13 years old.  We would go out there for a week and hold a Vacation Bible School for the kids, my church went to a town called St. Francis, about 30 minutes away from Mission.  Our week was filled with piggyback rides, crafts, water balloon fights, and laughter.  I instantly fell in love with kids and their families and always wished I could stay longer than a week in the summer, and a few days each winter break.  I have kept in contact with many of "my" kids and now that they are old enough they are on facebook (the joys of technology!) and we chat often.

For the last couple years it has been hard for me to make it out there for more than a couple days (art kids are poor and they need to work, all the time) but now I am making the plunge, first a week this summer, and who knows how long next time!

 

After kid's club I will either be in St. Francis hanging out the kids or out exploring some of the most beautiful landscapes I have ever seen.  My love for the rez has already made it's way into a print or too, and I am excited to have some new images to keep on creating!  When I get back I will be living in the printmaking studio, making prints from the photos I took.

Any contributions to my week on the reservation would mean so much to me.  The kids on the reservation get great art classes during the school year but it is always fun to have a summer program with activities where you can have fun and learn!

I'm also hoping to do at least one more community based art project while I'm there, maybe some mud stenciling? :)

 

Where your money is going:

So I'm asking for 500 dollars... why you ask?

About 200 dollars goes right to gas to get there and back from Moorhead, plus some extra to go out to St. Francis, and just general adventuring picture taking time.

Another 225 dollars goes to supplies for 10-30 kid's art projects for 5 days.  This is the most important amount of money, and the minimum I hope to raise in this quick campaign.  I want to make sure that none of the money for the art supplies comes out of the local Boys and Girls club funding, and I hope to have some extras to leave there with them.  They have a whole art wall that needs to be filled!

The extra 125 is set aside for wiggle room with gas and supplies, fees, and also for postage and packaging to get your sweet perks to you!

Speaking of seeet perks!  I will be making and printing a variety of fine art photographs and printmaking prints as a thank you and for your viewing pleasure.  You get to help fund what is sure to be a great week for the kids on the reservation and you get some art in return!  Everyone wins!

And just so you know... The first priority for me is paying for these art supplies, so if I don't receive my full funding it is guaranteed that at least 225 will go to the fun art stuff I need for the kids!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute doesn't mean you can't help or be involved.  Feel free to share this campaign on any social media site.  You can also follow me on my blog: katelynelaine.wordpress.com or on instagram: katelynbladel89

Thank you for reading and any help you can give, you are all appreciated!

story:
As a creative, compassionate and passionate person I have been developing, for many years, an idea on how to use art to help others in a very particular way. I love art and have been a patron, and advocate for the arts even with my very limited budget.   And even with this limited budget I have done some pretty cool things for the arts. Along the way I have also made quite a bit of fine art of my own that people have seemed to enjoy, but I have also created major works of art on a very large scale with the help of volunteers and businesses from a few targeted communities in the region that I live.

My passion is in connecting with people and together making what i call "Community Collaborations."  Through these community collaborative projects I take people through the process, that an artist goes through, to make a work of art, and by doing so, in a particular way, will make a work of art, while also making . . . Art WORK! These community collaborations are designed to serve 1 or more particular causes and the community as a whole.  Now that i have successfully made a number of these collaborative projects with help from community members now I want to take it further than ever thought of previously.   I want to take the ideas to the national level via a cross country tour called TACNET (read more about that at www.ThisArtistsDream.com in the National Vision Section)

To do this effectively I feel that I need to be able to hold a position in society where people will hear me out and where it might become easier for me to reach the people and the funding needed to carry out all of these projects. So, that is where the U.S. Arts Ambassador hat comes in.  While I hold this "office" I plan to make a whole lot more art but in collaboration with others.  I also will push to get the arts back into the public school system turning STEM to STEAM.

I have a long list of projects I am working on one piece at a time and a lot more I would love to oversee. I have a Local, State, National and International Dream. I want to be able to fund other artists to make some of their most impressive works of art. I mentioned above TACNET that stands for The Arts Collaborative's National Energy Tour.  This is a project that I have been working on planning for years.  Now I am ready and would love to be able to know and say that the tour will start next summer but realistically if I can get the funding I would shoot for summer of 2016. While on this tour I will have a lot to share with the public as well as a list of things to discover in each of the communities I visit. Ultimately, I hope to energize and inspire the nation on a grass roots level. I plan to do this by sharing my own art collection in a traveling art museum unlike any the public may have encountered before. This collection features representative pieces of art from today's sister art movements that have to do with Energy and Synergy. I will also visit schools, civic groups, churches and anyone else that may be interested in an inspiring lecture on Art, Creativity and the Power of the Imagination. When the lecture is over I will leave behind a Creativity Challenge that the school or organization can accept to participate in, if they like. This Creativity Challenge will be to make a work of art in a particular way that will encourage unity in their community. Part of my trip will be to identify individuals with the same type of vision that might like to be the Arts Ambassador for their state or region.

Okay, now even with just this little piece of the vision your head may be swimming so let me throw you the tow line and just say: "HELP FUND ME!!!" I will in turn use the funds i raise to fund others by creating the jobs that i know are needed to make all of these ideas a reality. I am well on my way but need your help. I have never asked for help in a way like this but NOW IS THE TIME!

I pledge not to abuse the power granted to me, I pledge to use money wisely and to keep the public's needs in mind when working on behalf of society. I pledge to help other visionary artists in their dreams IF they can benefit society. This is not a political office supported by tax dollars so therefore I will have a different set of personal moral and ethical guidelines to hold myself to. This I promise to uphold and with help from my future staff I will be able to do more with my art that can benefit others. I pledge to keep the public informed of great inspirational stories that i gather from the road and from my journey.

Is this convincing enough? If you still want to know more read about me. I have left a good trail from my first days as an artist until now. I would recommend starting here http://www.thisartistsdream.com.

My passion is in connecting with people and together making what i call "Community Collaborations."  Through these community collaborative projects I take people through the process, that an artist goes through, to make a work of art, and by doing so, in a particular way, will make a work of art, while also making . . . Art WORK! These community collaborations are designed to serve 1 or more particular causes and the community as a whole.  Now that i have successfully made a number of these collaborative projects with help from community members now I want to take it further than ever thought of previously.   I want to take the ideas to the national level via a cross country tour called TACNET (read more about that at www.ThisArtistsDream.com in the National Vision Section)To do this effectively I feel that I need to be able to hold a position in society where people will hear me out and where it might become easier for me to reach the people and the funding needed to carry out all of these projects.  So, that is where the U.S. Arts Ambassador hat comes in.  While I hold this "office" I plan to make a whole lot more art but in collaboration with others.  I also will push to get the arts back into the public school system turning STEM to STEAM.I have a long list of projects I am working on one piece at a time and a lot more I would love to oversee.  I have a Local, State, National and International Dream.  I want to be able to fund other artists to make some of their most impressive works of art.  I mentioned above TACNET that stands for The Arts Collaborative's National Energy Tour.  This is a project that I have been working on planning for years.  Now I am ready and would love to be able to know and say that the tour will start next summer but realistically if I can get the funding I would shoot for summer of 2016.  While on this tour I will have a lot to share with the public as well as a list of things to discover in each of the communities I visit.  Ultimately, I hope to energize and inspire the nation on a grass roots level.  I plan to do this by sharing my own art collection in a traveling art museum unlike any the public may have encountered before.  This collection features representative pieces of art from today's sister art movements that have to do with Energy and Synergy.  I will also visit schools, civic groups, churches and anyone else that may be interested in an inspiring lecture on Art, Creativity and the Power of the Imagination.  When the lecture is over I will leave behind a Creativity Challenge that the school or organization can accept to participate in, if they like.  This Creativity Challenge will be to make a work of art in a particular way that will encourage unity in their community.  Part of my trip will be to identify individuals with the same type of vision that might like to be the Arts Ambassador for their state or region.Okay, now even with just this little piece of the vision your head may be swimming so let me throw you the tow line and just say: "HELP FUND ME!!!" I will in turn use the funds i raise to fund others by creating the jobs that i know are needed to make all of these ideas a reality.  I am well on my way but need your help.  I have never asked for help in a way like this but NOW IS THE TIME!I pledge not to abuse the power granted to me, I pledge to use money wisely and to keep the public's needs in mind when working on behalf of society.  I pledge to help other visionary artists in their dreams IF they can benefit society.  This is not a political office supported by tax dollars so therefore I will have a different set of personal moral and ethical guidelines to hold myself to.  This I promise to uphold and with help from my future staff I will be able to do more with my art that can benefit others.  I pledge to keep the public informed of great inspirational stories that i gather from the road and from my journey.Is this convincing enough? If you still want to know more read about me. I have left a good trail from my first days as an artist until now.  I would recommend starting here http://www.thisartistsdream.com.

story:
Who We Are

Boulder Art Therapy Collective (BATC) was established in November 2014 with the mission to create community through art. We are a group of therapists interested in making art more accessible to everyone, especially those who may not see themselves as artists. We understand the inherent healing possibility that happens in the process of creating art, particularly in community with others, and so we designed our space with that deep healing potential in mind.  We believe that creating something is good for the soul’s well being, just as physical exercise is good for the body.  Art making brings us back to our senses. It makes us feel connected to our deeper longings. It heals us. Making art in community creates the opportunity for people to share in ways that automatically and deeply builds connection.  

Our organization is open for individual, family, couples, and child therapy with additional hours in the week devoted to our Open Door art making sessions, trainings, and workshops. Our Open Door Studios is a welcoming place for individuals to connect with others while engaging in the creative process.

What is Art Therapy?

Anyone can use art therapy to explore and manage emotional states. Art therapy encourages utilizing art and the creative process as a way toward self expression, communication, and psychological and spiritual healing. It works toward reconciling emotional conflicts, fostering self-awareness, developing social skills, managing behavior, solving problems, reducing anxiety, aiding reality orientation, increasing self-esteem, and integrating difficult emotional content and trauma. In particular, the creative process helps children who may not yet have the language capacity to express their experiences. 

What We Need
We have poured our heart and soul into creating a relaxing space for those in need of healing.  Our mission has always included inclusivity and we cannot fully express how important it is that art is accessible to everyone in the community. Part of our mission is to reach out to underserved community members and towards this goal we have created a scholarship fund so that low income community members may have access to our programs, primarily our Open Doors Studios and individual therapy. Some of the populations we aim to serve are:

  • children  with a history of abuse and neglect
  • families with domestic violence history
  • cancer survivors
  • homeless population
  • children and adults who struggle with depression and anxiety

By backing our project, you will impact the life of an individual or family by providing them the opportunity to transform their lives in a positive way.

What You Will Receive

Below are some of the perks to go along with your generous donation:





 


Other Ways You Can Help

In conjunction with our Indiegogo campaign, we are also launching a community mural project in which individuals, families, and businesses can "sponsor" a 5'x5' section of a wall. This 120 foot wall sits directly in front of BATC and can use some beautifying. We would love you to join in! Funds raised will also go directly into our scholarship fund. We will be painting the wall the entire month of September. If you are local to Boulder or in a nearby city, please stop by one of our day time Open Door hours to participate. For more info on sponsoring a section of the wall, please contact us at info@boulderarttherapycollective.com. On Saturday, October 3rd, we will hold a one year anniversary party and unveil the finished mural.

story:
What is Bulgarian Mythological Creatures (And Where to Find Them) ?

The book is an illustrated bestiary, under the form of a diary. It follows the journey of two explorers, seeking mysterious creatures they've only heard about in legends. In this diary, we can see their sketches and illustrations, read about their experience, and get advice on what to do if we actually meet them, what herbs to get to protect ourselves or how to win their trust.

Какво е Български Митологични Същества (и Къде да ги намерим)?

Илюстрoваната книжка ни предлага поглед над серия фолклорни същества от българската митология, представени под формата на дневник. Сюжетът проследява мисията на двама млади изследователи, които издирват същества, за които само са чували от легенди и митове. В този дневник можем да видим техните скици и илюстрации, да прочетем за техните преживявания и техните съвети какво да правим, ако случайно се натъкнем на някой недоброжелателен звяр.

 

 

The Prototype

The prototype I have created of the book contains 46 coloured pages. I have received overwhelmingly possitive feedback on it, also some constructive critisism that I will definitely draw from.

Прототип

Създадох прототип на книжката от 46 (цветни) страници, за който получих вълнуващо добри отзиви, както и конструктивна критика, от която се възползвах.

Audience

My book is going to be suitable and engaging for both young adults and children alike.

Публика

Книжката ще е подходяща както за деца, така и за по- големи.

Why am I doing this?

I started this project when I was working on my final project for my degree in Visual Arts (May 2016) at the University of Bordeaux, and with time the idea started growing.

I have always been passionate about mythology and the supernatural, and when I had the chance to work on such a big project the idea to combine this passion with my own roots just came naturally. Whilst I was working on my research, I found out that slavic and Bulgarian tales are rarely depicted in any visual art forms. I did work with some academic texts and researches, but I was left quite dissapointed to find out that our mythology is barely ever the star of today's art scene. With this illustrated book, I aim to offer an alternative way for my readers to get to know a piece of our culture. The long academic texts seem to put off readers, this is why I decided to share my view on some of my favourite characters through illustration. I really hope we manage to keep our folklore and legends alive, and find a way to integrate them in today's environment.

Защо реших да създам Български Митологични Същества (и Къде да ги намерим)?

Започнах този проект като част от дипломната си работа за бакалавърска степен по визуални изкуства в Université Bordeaux Montaigne (май 2016), а с времето идеята се разрастваше.

Свърхестветвеното и митологията винаги са представлявали интерес за мен. Тази страст съвсем естествено се свърза назад във времето с моите корени. Докато търсех информация, се натъкнах на факта, че славянският и най- вече българският фоклор биват много рядко застъпени във форми на визуалното изкуство. Работих с академични текстове и проучвания, но останах леко разочарована от факта, че нашата митология толкова рядко присъства в съвремената арт сцена. С тази илюстрована книжка искам да предложа на своите читатели един алтернативен начин да се запознаят с някои от любимите си герои, а може би дори и да научат нещо ново за тях. А тези, които не познават нашата митология, да се запознаят с частица от българската култура. Дългите академични текстове рядко привличат нови читатели, затова реших да споделя своя поглед за някои от фолклорните герои чрез илюстрация. Наистина се надявам да успеем да опазим нашия фолклор и да намерим начин да го включим в нашето ежедневие.

Budget

Although the book has a finalized look, there are some details that need polishing.

I decided to collaborate with a writer to ensure that the story is as captivating as the illustrations.

The biggest chunk of the budget would go into publishing and printing, as printing quality coloured illustration books tends to be very expensive – quality comes at a price!

An important tast to think about would also be the distribution of the book. I will be shipping copies directly to the backers who order it – the rest of the crowdfunded budget will go towards achieving that. I will also do my best to get copies for sale in local book stores.

Бюджет

Въпреки че книжката вече има завършен вид, някои елементи имат нужда от доусъвършенстване. Реших да потърся помощта на писател, за да съм сигурна, че историята ще е толкова пленяваща за читателите на книжката, колкото и в представите ми. Най- голямата част от бюджета ще бъде използвана за публикуването й (принт+дистрибуция), тъй като печатът на качествени цветни страници е на доста висока цена.

Важна част от процеса е и дистрибуцията. Книжките ще пристигнат до адрес на всички, закупили от кампанията. Ще бъдат създадени и копия, които ще се разпространавят чрез локални книжарници.

 

Why is my goal „flexible“?

Even if I don't reach my final goal, the entire amount collected will still be invested in the same areas of the project. That would mean that the scale of what I have intended for the book release will not be the same, but it would still be a good start and will still be immensely appreciated!

If we reach 50% of my goal (300 GBP) I will still print out copies of the book for all the backers who ordered it.

No matter what percentage of the goal we reach, everyone who ordered a piece of merchandise will receive it as planned.

Защо имам „flexible goal“ /гъвкава цел/?

Дори и да не достигна финалната си цел, цялата сума от кампанията ще отиде към съответните сфери от проекта. Ако достигнем 50% от финансирането (300 GBP) ще бъдат принтирани копия за всички поръчали книжката. Без значение какъв процент от кампанията достигнем, всички поръчани продукти като тениски и чантички, ще бъдат изпратени на адрес.

Every piece of physical merchandise (tote bags and t-shirts) are screen printed by hand from the author.

 

About the author:

Tsveta Petrova is a bulgarian illustrator, based in the UK. Soon to graduate wiith a Master's degree in Illustration, she adores watercolour and working on numerous projects at once. You might have seen her work on social media platforms, such as Facebook, Instagram and Behance.

About the co-writer:

Detelina Shishkova is a journalist and researcher based in Bulgaria. She carries a book around with her at all times to indulge her literary passion. When not reading or writing, Detelina can be found watching movies and cooking.

 

 

Екипът:
Цвета е български илюстратор, живеещ в Англия. Скоро се дипломира с магистърска степен по илюстрация. Тя обожава акварела и да работи над многобройни проекти едновременно. Може би сте виждали нейни творби в социалните мрежи като Фейсбук, Инстаграм и Behance.

Детелина Шишкова е български журналист и рисърчър. Тя винаги носи книга със себе си, за да задоволява страстта си към литературата. Когато не чете или не твори, Детелина обича да гледа филми и да се занимава с готварство.

Risks and challenges.

My biggest challenge would be managing deadlines as I am a fulltime MA student and a fulltime employee, but I am really passionate about this project and I believe I can manage to get everything done in a reasonable time frame. The biggest chunk of the work is already done - the production of the book itself. All I have left at this stage is to polish the text and retouch a few of the illustrations I am not one hundred percent happy with.

Рискове

Най- голямото предизвикателство би било опазването на всички зададени срокове, тъй като съм студент и служител на пълно работно време. Но пък за сметка на това съм изключително мотивирана от този проект и вярвам, че ще успея да се справя на време с всичко. Най- голямата част от работата вече е свършена- изработването на самата книжка и илюстрации. Всичко, което ми остава до момента е доизпипване на текста и на някои от илюстрацийките.

The biggest chunk of the work is already done - the production of the book itself. All I have left at this stage is to polish the text and retouch a few of the illustrations I am not one hundred percent happy with.РисковеНай- голямото предизвикателство би било опазването на всички зададени срокове, тъй като съм студент и служител на пълно работно време. Но пък за сметка на това съм изключително мотивирана от този проект и вярвам, че ще успея да се справя на време с всичко. Най- голямата част от работата вече е свършена- изработването на самата книжка и илюстрации. Всичко, което ми остава до момента е доизпипване на текста и на някои от илюстрацийките.

story:
I'm going to make art in Europe!


first stop: Berlin!


I am Suz Evans. I grew up in Cincinnati, Ohio where I spent a lot of time painting with my mom, biking down old train rails and ducking under branches in queer escape. There was no question about what I would do with my future, I knew I would be an artist. 

After high school I moved to Massachusetts to attend Montserrat College of Art (holla Masseratiz). There I earned my BFA in printmaking and art history and studied under many brilliant people, such as curator Leonie Bradbury, contemporary art historian Martha Buskirk and experiential artist Sandrine Schaefer. Thanks to these astounding advisors and professors, I have the knowledge and skills to expand and grow my practice within critical, liminal spaces, and in this instance, the thresholds of travel. 

photo credit: Sandrine Schaefer

what is the Critical Process Tour?

necessary life experience, obv what I should be doing, again and again
The CPT is a self-directed performance tour of Europe. This tour is all about strengthening my art, with specific emphasis on formalism, documentation, theory and writing. I will be creating pieces in every city in which I dwell and visit and make experimental documentation from those performances. The tour has been designed to challenge my current process of art making. 
I have carefully selected several cities in Europe in which I will stay for a few weeks at a time. I will meet queer artists, go to museums, and spend a lot of time thinking, writing and making art.
Thus far I have chosen Berlin and Madrid. I also have interest in Istanbul, Ljubljana, Copenhagen and Rome. 

  an image from Free Slaps

photo credit: Verónica Genevíeve Ochoa 

Berlin is a city of the arts and filled with opportunity. For many reasons historical and social, the government invests more dollars to the arts than any American city. Germany has strict rent control, which keeps living costs low. A room in Northampton, MA costs about the same as one in Berlin. This attracts many emerging artists whom have developed a strong and integral community, unlike New York's ruthlessly capitalistic market and scene.
Berlin is has some interesting movement right now. Because of the structure of their law, Germany is more welcoming to refugees than other European countries. Berlin has a rapidly growing population of refugees from Syria and other countries in conflict, which the city is taking on in various fashions. As I will be unemployed during my stay in Berlin, I will use some of my time to volunteer.
I am learning the German language and so excited to practice speaking/learning through immersion! My interest in language is both from passion and linguistic interest, particularly from a sociological lens. 
Madrid is also a city of the arts (and food, of course.)  I have longed to experience Spanish culture, as it stands out in Europe amongst its Anglo neighbors.

 (still from the feminist ceremony, 2013, photo credit: Suz Evans) 

I can do this! And I will do this! But only with your help.... My monetary goal will provide me enough money to travel Europe for several months. This freedom will help me develop my career at an extraordinarily faster rate than I can achieve under the current circumstances of my work life and artistic practice. I will be able to apply to grants and residencies with the portfolio that I develop.


what i'd like to achieve:

1. raise enough money to finance my supplies and assist me in my travels

2. find wonderful homes for my artwork that I've made in the past 3 years

3. inform my support system, friends, family and the public about my ideas, goals and upcoming relocation


my expected expenses:

$1000 for plane tickets and travel

$800 estimated rent 

$2000 (food, art supplies, etc)

$550 for several months of school loan payments

( 3,000 will cover most of this! )


now, I bet you want to know:

What's in it for you?

My very own original art!   like this painting:

Dinner Party (Ch 7 The Kiddie Pool) photo credit: Jeff Derose


ooOOoooo nice right? oh yea, look at those queer cosmic figures..
and what else but mail order COMICS! like this one:

but really,

why should you give me your money?

1. You've been wanting some of my art, and realize that now is the perfect time to buy. **must be done in person! no shipping!

2. You recognize that this is a great advancement in my career, and you observe that I am taking the risks necessary to become a practicing full-time contemporary artist.

3. You just love me, like regardless of anything.

are you unconvinced? i could give out special perks.. like.. we could become pen pals, or i could wine and dine you over the internet. ; )


(durational dance performance at the Smith College Art Museum, 4 hrs, 2015 Photo credit: Stephanie Greene)  

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

more about the tour:

My performance is typically site-specific and public. As I move around, from city to city, I will have to do work to understand where I am. My work will be affected by different spaces. In turn, I will affect spaces and audience differently as I make movement, gesture and object with my body. Also my mind will be so clouded by new information that I will inevitably make new things. I can explain it like this.... Moments of Intentional or Unintentional Live Art: 

MOIOULA as acronym/hashtag, or even shorter, moi. (I made this up, it's real.) Space, site, formalism and dialogue are crucial elements to compositions of moi. The closest thing I can liken it to would be Allan Kaprow's happening:

         "make it unsure even to yourself if the happening is life or art"

                   -Kaprow's How to Make a Happening

In effect, MOIOULA can be anything and everything, but remains specific to inherent characteristics of the concept. One thing might be moi, another might not, but everything has the potential. 

to quote Kaprow once more, 

                                     "you've got to be pretty ruthless about this"

         thank you all for reading!!                                                                                           <3 <3

story:
Who am I?

My name is Camille Lauren. I'm a Creative soul who loves to blend colours in acrylic paint. I've been drawn to expressive arts my whole life, and I create in s many mediums as I can get my hands on. Poetry, graphic design, illustration, body art, mixed-media painting are all forms of expression that I enjoy. Want to know more? Check out my bio here: My Biography 
Want to read my most recent interview with DARLA Magazine? Get to know me.

  • I've recently been granted a special opportunity to pursue modelling professionally. My passion for all things art began long ago, but I had not realized how much I truly enjoyed transforming in front of the camera until my very first photoshoot 5 years ago. I've had the pleasure of photographing with extremely talented photographers in Toronto over the years, and now I'd like to take the next step. In order to be ready to perform in such a competitive field, I need to invest in a portfolio that shows my true potential not only as a creative individual, but also as a model. Now, I'm a resourceful person; I love to style myself, do my own hair and make-up, but I'm willing to invest in the best professionals, in order to get the outcome I'm looking for: Stunning photos & booked jobs!

  • And you know what? You can help me make this happen!  I’m so thankful for supporters like you. Your support on this campaign is truly appreciated.

What I Need & What You Get

  • This funding is going to pay for the clothing, and expertise of stylists, make-up artists, hairstylists, editing and of course the incredible photographer who will be capturing me. She has a pristine eye for style, beauty and personality. I'm confident that she will bring out my creative essence in this shoot.

  • My perks include limited edition, signed art prints, tee-shirts, buttons, even original acrylic paintings on canvas, and more! Want to see the kind of art I'm talking about? Click here: Art

  • If I don't reach my entire goal to cover all of the expenses associated with my portfolio, I will continue to create artwork that will be for sale, until I have saved up enough.

The Impact

I believe that everyone is a piece of Art. This campaign is about expanding definitions of beauty, and encouraging each other to continually push the boundaries of creative expression. Your support of this campaign shows:

  • Encouragement to those with alternative career paths, by showing support for a young Creative woman, and helping to support this unique opportunity
  • Support for others to see their own light, and trust in their inner path

    Risks & Challenges

As an artist, it can be challenging to put yourself out there. It's taken me plenty of self-development, and a whole lot of confidence to pursue my additional interests in fashion, acting and modelling. Of course with every new endeavour, and especially Creative ones that are as public as this one, there is a possibility of failure. But I believe life is meant to be lived out loud, in full colour. If you share the same burning passion, you'll understand.

  • I've been lucky enough to meet amazingly supportive people along the way. Read what they have to say about me here: Praise


Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways to contribute! If you want to lend a helping hand, :)

  • Please share this campaign with your circle! (facebook, twitter, google+)
    There are plenty of Indiegogo share tools that you can use!

story:
ME!

As far as taking it to the next level with my circus career, Montreal is where it's at ! I plan to continue working with the coach I trained with over the summer to solidify the act I already have and add those last minute tricks in. If you already know me, you know that the circus is my LIFE! And if you don't know me...well...the circus is my LIFE! I want to be self employed as a performer in the next year and if I can get to Montreal to train for a few months at a time, then that has a REAL shot at reality. How cool!


YOU!

Have you ever wanted to fly through the air with the greatest of ease? Have you ever dreamed of running away to join the circus? I'm making those dreams my reality and YOU can help me see them through. Think about it: a $2.00 donation will get me a daily metro pass to the studio to train, $20.00 for some groceries, $50.00 for a lesson, $100.00 for rent- use your imagination. EVERY donation counts!


US!

My goal is to raise $1,000.00 before January 1, 2012. This goal would cover five one hour classes a week, food, metro pass, and rent for the time I plan on spending in Montreal. If I reach this goal, I will be able to keep my focus on training and not on finances (which, as we all know, can be distracting and stressful). If I do not reach my goal, I will need to pick up extra hours at work to save, cutting into my training time.


THEM!

Tell your friends! You can live vicariously through my circus adventures by donating today! I'll be constantly updating my social network accounts with pictures, videos, and stories so you'll really feel like you're there with me. Oh and first show I'm in, you'll be guaranteed a ticket (maybe even in the front row)!

story:
Last year, we made a big splash with our Self Care Day Planner and your feedback was magical! 

This year, we've worked hard to create a day planner that not only stands out with prestige and sophistication, but that better accommodates the lives of creative minds and entrepreneurs. 

 

THE DESIGN

Like our original Self Care planner, the Selfpreneur Planer features a daily battery that serves as a mood tracker and realistic planning tool, as well as a space to record Daily Gratitude. 
We've added extra space for your daily tasks and a water intake tracker (let's face it, none of us drink enough water!)

We've completely overhauled our monthly goal setting section and separated it into two key pieces: Monthly Review and Monthly Goals. 
Record your notable insights each month and your ongoing projects & collaborations- all in the same book! 
We've even included a short notes section at the end of each month to record any additional information you might not have room for. 

THE STYLE

Designed to withstand a little extra wear, the 7.5" x 10" Selfpreneur Planner features a grey linen-bound hardcover. Across the front reads "SELF", debossed subtly (ooh lala!)

We understand that your branding is an important part of your biz, and so we've left our little charm & whimsy to the printed end sheets. Cheeky, we know! 
We've included a full 12 months of strategic planning printed n smooth, acid free 60lbs paper. 

Each weekly spread spans Monday thru Sunday, but we didn't skim on weekend space. We all know those are sometimes your busiest days! 

And this year, we made  the bold decision to leave your planners undated!
*GASP!*
Your spreads will include the days of the week along with space for you to fill in the dates. 
This was a tough decision, but we want you to plan with intention and have the flexibility to use your planner to its fullest. We also wanted to be friendly to the Earth! 
Don't worry though; You'll find a handy yearly calendar (2018, 2019, 2020) at the front of your planners.
*PHEW!*

All of this wrapped up into a hand-sewn, reusable linen dust bag. 
It's all in the details, Superstars!

 

We need your help.

By pre-ordering your Selfpreneur Planner, you are helping us to offset the initial printing costs for our (very) small business, and helping us to expand our reach by keeping our products accessible.

We wanted to give you more without the added price tag: My goal for the Selfpreneur Planner was to keep it at a similar price point to our original Self Care Day Planner.
By now, you likely know that small batch printing often means a higher cost, and so we're aiming to print more planners so that we can pass those savings onto you! 

We want you to have access to beautiful tools that are designed with your wellness in mind. Creatives & Entrepreneurs need tools that help us to prioritize self care. We need tools that help us to prioritize our self care so that we can continue doing what we love.
(But our Selfpreneur Planner is designed for non-creatives as well!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help us expand our reach but can't pre-order your planner? 
Here are some other ways you can help: 

  1. Contribute/Donate even $1.00. Every single dollar makes a difference. Truly!
  2. SHARE, SHARE, SHARE! Help us by sharing our campaign, and say a few words about why you feel the Selfpreneur Planner is important (this is a vital component). 
  3. Tell someone you feel might benefit from this innovative tool for creatives! 
  4. Follow our journey on social media

 

Thank you all so much for your support, love and encouragement! We cannot WAIT for you to start incorporating our Selfpreneur Planner into your daily Self Care regime.

Leave a little kindness wherever you go,

Aly & Blue

story:
Located in an alleyway on the border between Chinatown and Tribeca in downtown New York City, resides possibly the worlds’ smallest museum, a home to overlooked modern-day artifacts of humanism and beauty from cultures around the world. 

At the bottom of a defunct elevator shaft-way, in the bowels of what was once a garment factory on lower Broadway, visitors can lose themselves among hundreds of items and their subsequent stories.

Each object is accompanied by a number which directs you to a detailed story that can be found in the museum guide or in the audio guide, accessible through any mobile phone.

Detail of Museum by Naho Kubota.

Museum has had a successful first year of operation with over thousands of visitors from around the world, including a Brazilian tourist who requested a visit during his 5-hr layover at JFK, Multiple design class pilgrimages, construction workers on lunch breaks and even a very famous family taking refuge in the space while on the run from the paparazzi.

Visitors from around the world.

In order to continue providing the people of the world a new way to see and understand the objects around them, we need your help.

As we approach the winter and the next 12 months of Museum's calendar, we’re planning to de-install and install two new complete exhibitions, add climate control, air purification, and a gift shop. We will also host a litany of new performances, readings and demonstrations free and open to the public and the city at large.

Layout for Tom Sachs Mars Rocks

The upcoming exhibition will include works and collections from artist Tom Sachs, designer Jim Wolrod, Screw Magazine/Midnight Blue founder, Al Goldstein, Baron Von Fancy’s prison ephemera, Kim Hastreiter’s father’s Ass Pads, Peter Allen’s Fake Vomit from around the world and much more.

Your donation will help us accomplish the upcoming programs and an audio guide as well as secure the space for another year. We’re happy to be working with Fractured Atlas which is a 501(c)3 so all donations are tax-deductible.

Thank you and please give whatever you can.

GOALS AND FUTURE:

Museum is a valuable addition to the downtown community and would not exist without the support of friends like you. With your help, Museum can continue to provide a vibrant cultural experience to its visitors; supporters and strangers alike. We hope you will take the time to view our donor options and gift list and aid us in creating this indispensable institution of curiosity. In order to provide a fuller description of our needs, here is a brief list of improvements we hope to make. In order to continue for a second year we need to raise at least $20,000. 

If we do not raise our goal, the doors of Museum will be shut permanently. The upcoming year is already planned to be an exciting one with at two new exhibitions, as well as a vibrant series of special performances, readings and screenings for the Museum community.

Each new installation is a time intensive process involving extensive labor to create the exact armature for each object. Each item in the Museum collection is measured, fitted and seamlessly mounted to the Museum walls. Then a catalogue number is assigned and the object is entered into the Museum Audio Encyclopedia, whose description is easily retrievable to any visitor by using the toll free Museum hotline. Each object is documented and remains a part of the digital archive, and new museum guides are printed. This process involves the talent and concentration of multiple individuals

In order to safeguard our collection we must install an eco-friendly climate control/de-humidifier. This will insure the safety of our collection during seasonal fluctuations. We will also invest in a waterproofing system for rainy/inclement weather. 

We thank you for taking the time to read about Museum. With your support, Museum will continue to be a memorable experience for all who visit…

Best

Museum
story_txt:
Located in an alleyway on the border between Chinatown and Tribeca in downtown New York City, resides possibly the worlds’ smallest museum, a home to overlooked modern-day artifacts of humanism and beauty from cultures around the world. 
At the bottom of a defunct elevator shaft-way, in the bowels of what was once a garment factory on lower Broadway, visitors can lose themselves among hundreds of items and their subsequent stories.
Each object is accompanied by a number which directs you to a detailed story that can be found in the museum guide or in the audio guide, accessible through any mobile phone.

Detail of Museum by Naho Kubota.
Museum has had a successful first year of operation with over thousands of visitors from around the world, including a Brazilian tourist who requested a visit during his 5-hr layover at JFK, Multiple design class pilgrimages, construction workers on lunch breaks and even a very famous family taking refuge in the space while on the run from the paparazzi.

Visitors from around the world.
In order to continue providing the people of the world a new way to see and understand the objects around them, we need your help.

story:
Short Summary

Did the sculpture appear to move in an impossible way?  Was it mesmerizing, meditative, or hypnotic?  Imagine it on your wall.  Now is your opportunity to have an affordable fine art piece that is beautiful when still, but absolutely captivating when in motion.  Your donation will not only buy you a fascinating sculpture; it will also help an emerging artist fulfill a dream of providing fine art at a reasonable cost.

What We Need & What You Get

Each kinetic sculpture is designed to produce an optical moiré pattern that entertains with a simple spin of the hand.  Although the sculptures are visually attractive when still, they become truly fascinating when in motion unfolding a variety of constant changing patterns.  As the sculptures begin to slow down, they show an interesting kaleidoscopic effect as the wheels start to rotate back and forth. You can see this "rocking effect" in our main video when Trance, one of our sculptures is introduced and at the very end of the video.  No battery, motor or other power source is used.  Sculptures are handcrafted from Russian Baltic Birchwood, are 29 inches wide and go for approximately 40 minutes.  There are four designs to choose from: Flow, Flux, Trance, and Kaleidoscope.  To see more videos visit Spunwheel.com

Your donation will be invested in equipment to bring our sculptures to the next level.  We intend to purchase a CNC machine and an outdoor tent display for art festivals. 

The Impact

Our goal is to create a sculpture with the quality of fine art without the high price tag.  The only way to get a similar product would be to pay $600 to $6,000.  We believe that art should be accessible to everyone.  Your contributions will help us purchase equipment to make our sculptures even more affordable.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  You can help us by sharing our campaign using the social media tools below.  Thank you for reading our campaign.  We hope that you enjoyed viewing our sculptures.

Shipping

We will ship our kinetic sculptures to all states throughout the U.S. for free and all provinces and territories in Canada for an additional $75 per sculpture.  Sculptures will be shipped by September, 30 2013. 

Contact Us

If you have any additional questions, then email us at CustomerService@spunwheel.com

story:
Fraser First Booster Club

Fraser First Booster Club is active in funding to build a premier barrier‐free playground in Macomb County to be located in Fraser’s McKinley Park. It’s a big but doable goal – to raise the $650,000 required to build Fraser’s first barrier-free playground at McKinley Park. Unlike other parks, a barrier-free playground’s universal design allows everyone to easily access the play equipment, structures, approaches and pathways. Once completed, this innovative and inclusive play environment will be available to all children. It will be specifically designed to meet the needs of the county’s twenty five thousand children with sensory, developmental and physical challenges. Inviting play, encouraging friendships and showing all children that their individual uniqueness rests in their talents. 

Art in the Garden - Doorways to Play

In 2011 Fraser First Booster Club found a creative way to involve students with the fundraising for the Barrier Free Playground. Art in the Garden auctions art from community students to fund raise to benefit the goal of Barrier Free play in our community. Past Art in the Garden events featured clay tiles and decorated chairs. 

This year we are featuring "Doorways to Play", in which artists will create works created from doors. These artists come from Fraser schools and local charter schools. These artists are eager to help but are in need of supplies needed to create their masterpieces. 

How you can help

Your donation will give a student artist the materials needed to create their "Doorway to Play", and allow them to share their talents to better their community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are interested in assisting further with this great cause, consider joining the Fraser First Booster Club or volunteering your time. More information can be found at www.fraserfirst.com

story:
Indigo Artist Collective


                                 3rd Annual Spring Bike Tune-Up

Who/What is the Indigo Artist Collective:

Indigo Artist Collective (IAC), formerly known as Indigo Hippie CO (IHC) is a Brooklyn based collective of creative entrepreneurs and artist who together have over two years of experience in music,visual arts,art curating, event productions, and youth development. In the last 5-10 years we have seen a rise in childhood obesity in the Bed- Stuy community. The mission of the Indigo Artist Collective Spring Bike Tune-Up is to enrich the lives of local inner city children,families,and communities through artistic expression,community building events,cultural awareness,and promotion of physical activity and healthy living through biking.

Launched in February 2011, Indigo Artist Collective’s first event was based on their initial love and passion for the Arts. The members of Indigo Artist Collective, recognizing the need to enhance the current art landscape in the service area of the BedfordStuyvesant community of Brooklyn, decided to embark on a series of Brooklyn Back Yard Neighborhood Concerts. These concerts were not only designed to give local artists the opportunity to express themselves through the arts. Also a way to showcase their talent. IAC fostered a sense of community, belonging and culture among the residents of Brooklyn. Artist, Individuals, families and children were successfully recruited to come out of their homes,and into their backyards to enjoy the sounds of the local artist and bands that were playing at one central back yard of Halsey Street. These backyards became“connected” like 1 big family and could be seen as such by the naked eye of spectators.

As the organization grew and the demand to keep bringing arts to the communities increased,the IndigoArtist Collective embarked on their next initiative, which was driven in part by the feedback and input from the families and residents of those who participated in the 2011Brooklyn Backyard Concert Series. Launched in January of 2012,the Indigo Collective’s BedStuy BrunchClub became one of the premiere artistic social,cultural and networking events in the area. During the BedStuy Brunch Clubs, the“Crème de la crème”of the Brooklyn creative community would come together to fellowship,eat and network on the engrossing topic of artistic expression, community building and cultural enrichment. A selection of topics serve as an aperitifs to various brunch menus prepared by esteemed independent culinary artists like Zap Williams, Lorenza Collins and Omena El.The energetic and smooth sound of a live band tops off the meal during the run of BedStuy Brunch Club series.These brought up the topics Health Eating , Active Living and Child Obesity. IAC wanted to stand up in the frontline for the  fight against childhood obesity. By having bicycles donated to Kids in need being our way of contributing our efforts this war. 

Spring Bike Tune Up (SBTU) Event Narrative

May is National Bike Month—The ideal time to ride. Riding a bike can be a great way to enjoy mild temperatures while remaining active. Bed-Stuy is one of many poverty stricken neighborhoods in the nation that suffers from high risk of childhood obesity.  Bicycling has all sorts of health benefits—engaging your legs while being easy on the joints, and providing a sense of freedom and enjoyment for youth. 

For the past two years IAC has produced the Annual Spring Bike Tune-Up based strategically in Bedford-Stuyvesant to help the fight against Childhood Obesity by supplying new and used bicycles to youth, ages 5-13. To date, we have donated over 75 bicycles and this year we are hopeful to exceed that number.  The Annual Spring Bike Tune Up will take place at Fulton Park.  The park will be filled with activities to draw in and entertain the whole family.  This grassroots event will be enriched by local culinary artisans, live bands performances, an art showcase and a live BMX bike exhibition. On-lookers can also have fun getting a free face painting, taking chances at winning one of the raffle prizes, gain cycling knowledge though bike maintenance and safety clinics,  while not forgetting to take home a complimentary bike light or bell. Trained mechanics will be on site doing free bike tune-ups. IAC wants to give families who may not be able to afford bikes for their children, an opportunity to enjoy cycling alongside teaching healthy living and art appreciation. 

SBTU will also be a platform to educate and attract youth to participate in the Indigo Performing Arts Center, coming soon. This center will be a haven for youth enrichment through after-school art and music programs.


2014 SpringBikeTuneUp Plans:

This year our goal is to expand. We want make This years SBTU event to be bigger, better and more effective than ever. We want to offer bikes, equipment and services to over 200 youth in the area and encourage art and community participation. There will be a live Mural collaboration with a unique bike messenger bag making demonstration by Jacobs Eye. The Jacobs Eye new spring line will be displayed along with special bike bags and accessories created custom for the event, in addition to the Indigo Artist Collective logo and the spirit of the bike/heart/brooklyn theme.

This years SBTU will be held on May 24th at Fulton Park on Chauncey and Stuyvesant st. in the Stuyvesant Heights area of Bedford Stuyvesant.  We have confirmed support and endorsements from Brooklyn Restoration Plaza, Recycle-a-Bicycle, NYC Health Department,  Alliance for Safer Streets (B.A.S.S.), Weeksville Heritage Center,Red Bike and Green, Bridgestreet Development Corporation and Transportation Alternatives. 

We have confirmed participation with the following Artist And Bands.

Omega Sirius Moon

Iam Popula

Major Taylor

VoxXx

Meridian

Art for Skins

Mista Martin

Leola Bee

Glow Society

Estetika Exposure 

Shaneice Sharp


-----WILL YOU HELP US GIVE THE GIFT OFA BIKE TO A CHILD/YOUTH?-----

In order for this effort to be a success,  it will take support from our local community!  We are aware that there are many worthwhile charitable initiatives to support, but we believe that you will be able to see for yourself how appreciated your support is from the youth and families involved. Your sponsorship or donation will help give an inner city youth hope against the fight against child obesity by exposing the youth to an opportunity that they may otherwise never know of or afford. Providing this opportunity will help to encourage a sense of belonging amongst the youth involved. Along side encouraging healthy active living the #1 solution to this dreadful disease Obesity. As all work done under the Indigo Artist Collective is for a charitable purpose,your donation/sponsorship is tax deductible under the IRS501C3 codes.

  Our fiscal sponsor for this event is : 

Syabrite Productions

402 Park Ave

Suite 2

Brooklyn, New York

11205


please arrange your bike pick up with :

DaShaughn Miler

 353 Tompkins

 brooklyn Ny 11216 

347-380-3773

 indigoartistcollective@gmail.com

story:
Miss Bands for Boobs Pin Up Pageant Art Gallery

Every year, we put on several fundraisers to raise funds for the fight against breast cancer.  Bands for Boobs Benefit Concert was founded in 2010, in Woodland, California.  We are a hard working group of volunteers trying to make a difference.  3 years ago we started raising money by having a pin up pageant and crowning a Miss Bands for Boobs.  In our first year we had 15 contestants, last year we had 36, this year we have 54!   

In 2013, with the help of our pin up models, we were able to raise over $11,300! We received the honor of being the 2nd Top Fundraising Team in the Community Category!  In the 4 years we've been doing this we've raised over $26,700!

This year we have the opportunity to hold a fundraiser by displaying all our 54 Miss Bands for Boobs Contestants in an art gallery.  The only part of this fundraiser that we do not have sponsors for is the framing of our prints.  We are asking for your help in getting these images ready to be displayed for our fundraiser April 4th.  The only reason or event survives is because of support from the community, and we need it now!

We are determined to top last years amount raised. Every year we strive to do better than the last and we plan to not stop until this disease is gone forever!  We are doing our part in the fight against breast cancer and we urge you to do your part too! 


Please visit our facebook pages at 


http://www.facebook.com/bandsforboobsb


http://www.facebook.com/teamcupcakesforthecure


Visit our latest event pages here:


Bands for Boobs 2014 -https://www.facebook.com/events/247562405421108


Miss Bands for Boobs Pin Up Pageant Art Gallery https://www.facebook.com/events/746095495414436/

story:
*Share your page and links with us on Facebook after contributing: Cosplay SoCal - click here-

Cosplay & 3D Printed items

Hi we are part of a community of artists, photographers, and cosplayers.  We currently offer cosplay commissions, props, and 3D Prints

Our campaign is aiming to raise money to upgrade our community productivity with better tools and supplies!  We make cosplay and 3D printed objects.  We also run Cosplay-SoCal.com, a website dedicated to promoting the cosplay community here in southern California. Work is sluggish due to the lack of better equipment.

 We have friends from everywhere as well!  Our goal is to reach a point in our community to create great stuff at a more precise and accelerated way!  We hope to be at conventions with our products as exhibitors and represent the cosplay community.

Contributions will skyrocket our team's production quality and we will be able to make our items quicker!


What We Need & What You Get

Here is what we will need:

  • We need to raise $10,000!
  • Funds go towards 3D printers, filament colors, 3D scanner, & other art supplies (foam, paints, primers, tools, packaging, etc)
  • Just think of all the custom items we are going to make!!  we want to make great items and ship them out to you!

The Impact

Many of us are just artists and art is our livelihood.  We also promote fairness and equality among all cosplayers.  Contributions will also go towards:

  • Website updates & upgrades
  • Hosting free cosplay gatherings/events in San Diego
  • Free Contest giveaways
  • Feeding us
  • Convention booths

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Visit our Facebook Page! https://www.facebook.com/cosplaysocal
  • Contact Admin Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/eddiehxc.cosplay
  • SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN on your Facebook, Twitter, etc,

We thank you in advance!

Look at some of the cool stuff we have made recently!
story_txt:
*Share your page and links with us on Facebook after contributing: Cosplay SoCal - click here-Cosplay & 3D Printed itemsHi we are part of a community of artists, photographers, and cosplayers.  We currently offer cosplay commissions, props, and 3D PrintsOur campaign is aiming to raise money to upgrade our community productivity with better tools and supplies!  We make cosplay and 3D printed objects.  We also run Cosplay-SoCal.com, a website dedicated to promoting the cosplay community here in southern California. Work is sluggish due to the lack of better equipment. We have friends from everywhere as well!  Our goal is to reach a point in our community to create great stuff at a more precise and accelerated way!  We hope to be at conventions with our products as exhibitors and represent the cosplay community.Contributions will skyrocket our team's production quality and we will be able to make our items quicker!What We Need & What You GetHere is what we will need:
We need to raise $10,000!
Funds go towards 3D printers, filament colors, 3D scanner, & other art supplies (foam, paints, primers, tools, packaging, etc)
Just think of all the custom items we are going to make!!  we want to make great items and ship them out to you!
The ImpactMany of us are just artists and art is our livelihood.  We also promote fairness and equality among all cosplayers.  Contributions will also go towards:
Website updates & upgrades
Hosting free cosplay gatherings/events in San Diego
Free Contest giveaways
Feeding us
Convention booths
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Visit our Facebook Page! https://www.facebook.com/cosplaysocal

Contact Admin Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/eddiehxc.cosplay

SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN on your Facebook, Twitter, etc,
We thank you in advance!Look at some of the cool stuff we have made recently!

story:
The Worry Machine...

In a town that exists without worries, one girl seeks out the fears and anxiety that the Worry Machine, an invention of a clever tinkerer, has done away with. But, her persistent search for answers lead to a major breakdown of the machine. Releasing twenty years of worry onto a previously worry free town. The town calls for her to set things right, she agrees and discovers through her journey that a world without fear also lacks love. And a life without duality can deceive an entire town.

As our world flounders into the realm of the Internet, human connection is at the same time more and less intimate. Everything is twice removed. The Worry Machine takes our current and easy world with magic drugs and diets and demands to know what would happen if machines really could solve all of our problems. The Worry Machine questions our “wretched contentment:” it paints a picture of a world “liberated” from worries, but shows that such a world, free from the negative, life-conditioning emotions such as anger and fear, produces a society of half-beings, their lives having been lost to complacency.

After four years of writing, several drafts, and one staged reading, The Worry Machine is finally ready for an all­ out production. Through dogged determination and (to be honest) a bit of luck, The Worry Machine has found a home in The Seattle Fringe Festival.

The Worry Machine will be at Annex Theatre on Capitol Hill running:

  • Thurs. Feb. 25 @ 7:30pm

  • Sat. Feb. 27 @ 5:30pm

  • Sun. Feb. 28 @ 7:00pm

  • Sat. March 5 @ 4:00pm


Why Seattle Fringe?

The Seattle Fringe is a fabulous group of individuals that promote local and new work. They realize the importance of affordable, accessible art and they keep their ticket prices low. Theatre should be for everyone!

You can find out more about them here: http://seattlefringefestival.org/

And you can donate to their cause here: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/seattle-fringe-festival-2016#/


Funds Breakdown:

Of course you want to know where your money is going. Have no fear! Here is a breakdown of how your donation will be put to use.

$1200 goes to paying performers and artistic team. It is so very important to us that we respect our actor's time and pay them for their talents.

$450 goes to The Seattle Fringe to cover space rental for four nights of performance

$300 goes to rehearsal space rental. 30 hours at $10 an hour for space rental through Theatre of Puget Sound. It ain't cheap!

$550 pays for costumes, set and marketing materials.


The Impact

Theatre has a responsibility to go beyond simple entertainment, to help an audience realize something true within themselves, and question the status quo. If a piece of theatre does not prompt conversation it is not doing its job. The Worry Machine explores concepts of fear and social acceptance of anxiety. The characters each deal with their worry in their own way without preaching a correct answer. As a writer I seek to challenge my audience, ask questions without answers, and tell a story that is universal to all.

Other Ways You Can Help

POST the link to our indigogo to your facebook page!

TALK about our show with your friends!

AND OF COURSE come see the show!

The Worry Machine will be at Annex Theatre on Capitol Hill running:

  • Thurs. Feb. 25 @ 7:30pm

  • Sat. Feb. 27 @ 5:30pm

  • Sun. Feb. 28 @ 7:00pm

  • Sat. March 5 @ 4:00pm

Hope to see you there!

story:
Verge Center for the Arts closed escrow on its building at 625 S Street on August 23rd, 2013 and we are now prepping for 6 months of construction before our grand re-opening next spring. We are super excited about everything we'll have to offer once we re-open, and we want you to join in on the fun! 

Becoming a member now will enable you to participate in behind the scenes programming including, hard hat tours, off-site lectures and art events, first look at our new resident artist studios, a preview of future programming in our new exhibition space, and advanced notice on programming through Verge's cultural partners. Signing up during construction grants you membership from construction through our first full year of operation. 

All funds from this campaign will go towards planning our first year of programming in the completed space. In addition to exhibitions, we'll host classes for adults and children, lectures, events, and more resident artist studios. For those of you who are already Verge members, you may enjoy these same preview benefits until the term of your current membership ends. However, we encourage your support now to ensure our success through construction before we officially reopen to the public.

Join Verge now and help establish Sacramento's newest cultural institution!

Be sure to follow us on social media while we're under construction to see what's happening. Search for us with #ibuiltverge, #futureverge and #vergeart

www.facebook.com/vergeart
www.twitter.com/vergeart
http://instagram.com/vergeart
http://vergeart.tumblr.com
