story:
Hey guys, Kahoko here. Some of you may be wondering, what is this? Why am I here? And what is this all about? Well, that's what I'm about to explain. I created this page because I am trying to fund a project to get myself started in the art world. No, I don't do fine art or big fancy paintings. I draw chibis, and I make plush pillows. But before I get into all of that, I'd like to give you guys a bit of background on what exactly inspires me to do what I do and why I chose to do this instead of say, a normal job. 

I created this project, Giri Giri Petshop, when I was dating someone I really cared about. I gave him a nickname, as silly as it was; and it was 'panda'. After a conversation one night he convinced me to make myself a panda plush, so I could feel like he was always with me. When it was completed, it kind of looked like one of those smashed, badly shaped onigiri balls that girls who don't know how to cook make and give to their boyfriends in anime. But it was cute! From that moment on, I felt that I loved this shape, for plushies, chibis, all sorts of things. So I continued working in this style, keeping the thought in mind that it started out of love and will always be reminiscent of those bad cooks who love their boyfriends dearly.

On another note, I've always had a rough time working with people on things that were assigned to me. Not because I don't want to do them, but because it's just hard for me to do things that don't interest me much. I have anxiety and I'm in the process of being evaluated and treated for other things, like Borderline Personality Disorder. These things make it difficult for me to interact with other people in a normal way, so for me to make a living without dealing with all of the stress and pressure that slowly breaks down my mental state until I'm incapable of giving any more to something that I just didn't want to do anymore... I decided that I need to do something that makes me happy, that I enjoy, that I WANT to do. And I love anime, I love drawing, I love making things.. but I need your help.

Because of me being unable to work a normal job, I don't have the funds to start this project. I need money to pay for my travel, my hotel, convention and table fees, and for my inventory. Sure, some of the stuff I can handle and make at home, but I'd really like to expand my inventory to things like buttons, and stickers, and phone charms. Everyone likes phone charms, right? And who doesn't love buttons with cute little chibi characters on them? That's where you come in, even the smallest donation will help me get a push in the right direction. Even if I don't make my goal, the money collected will be used to print and create everything that I can. And of course, each and every one of you will receive something in return for your help. 

All designs that you can choose from for your perks can be found at the following address. I will be adding more as I create them, so keep an eye out! https://www.facebook.com/GiriGiriPets?fref=ts

Thank you so much for your time and willingness to at least take a look at what I'm working on! All donators will receive a live shout out in thanks for their support on my live twitch stream.

story:
Firstly, Who Am I?

I'm best known on the internet as CryoGanix. I am a 19-year-old novice stained glass artisan, currently in training under a master artisan with over 45 years of experience in making stained glass pieces. I've been making glass projects for just under a year now, and have only gotten better with each piece that I've made.

What Makes My Work Unique?

All stained glass artisans—young and old—are taught that a margin of error is acceptable, especially when it comes to small gaps in the glass that can be hidden by lead or filled in with solder. They are taught that most mistakes can be made into opportunities or that the mistakes can be completely hidden by the joining medium.

That is only somewhat true with my work. Instead, I work to make sure each and every individual piece of glass lines up perfectly with the surrounding pieces, forming the tightest and most perfect fit. The only margin of error I will ever accept while making a project (especially for a client, friend, or family member) is cutting away some glass from a piece that is too big. If the glass piece is any smaller than what it needs to be and it forms any type of gap in the pieces, I will put the least complicated piece aside to be used as scrap glass and will re-make that piece.

I believe that everyone should get what they pay for, and they're paying for quality and beauty. I will not stand for anything less than the absolute best that I can do; the quality of my projects are what defines my skill, and that includes how much work and care I put into each and every small piece of glass.

This kind—my kind—of dedication is an extreme rarity these days, especially among the dying art of stained glass.

What Do I Have Planned Next?

As you can see in the image above, I am planning on making a stained glass window (not a suncatcher or hanging piece, but an actual window) of the character Discord from the television show My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic. The project is planned to be 3ft wide by 5ft tall (36" x 60").

It will not have any hanging rings attached to it and it is not intended to be hung. This piece is meant to be a permanent addition to your house, whether that's being physically installed in a wall or being the centerpiece of your room of choice (such as on top of a fireplace mantle).

At first, this piece will not be for sale. It will follow me to every convention I go to and serve as a testament that all of you helped make this artisan's dream a reality: to make the stained glass projects that will entertain, amaze, and inspire viewers for years, even decades or centuries.

What's Stopping Me?

For the first 15-16 years of my life, because of my severe ADD, I neglected my physical health and instead focused on what made me happy or what gave me instant satisfaction, such as playing a video game instead of taking a shower or brushing my teeth. As you can imagine, that is a very serious issue, which has unfortunately caught up with me over time. I've had numerous fillings (12, if I remember correctly) and had my two top wisdom teeth pulled, but those are by far the least of my worries. Now, I am on Vyvanse, which is an anti-ADD prescription, and I am taking extreme care of myself and have a lot more concentration when I do stained glass.

I went to the dentist a few days ago because of my front tooth hurting whenever I would drink something cold. It turns out that my four front teeth require root canals, and if they aren't done by July 22nd, they'll have to extract at least one, if not all of the teeth. Because of the very intense time constraint (and no doubt impending pain!), I opted to have the procedure done on Monday, July 15th, which is tomorrow at this time of writing.

Now on to the bad news. The procedure, in total, will cost $7,736.00 after insurance. I simply do not have that kind of money. I fix computers and make stained glass projects for a living, that's it. I have decided to finance the procedure using my grandfather's credit. Still, because of what I do for a living, I will have to do commissions almost nonstop for many years to come, and will have no time to do any personal projects or charity projects.

This kind of setback would destroy me psychologically.

This Is Where You Come In.

As an effort to raise the money required for the procedure, I have started this crowdfunding campaign. I am relying on nothing but people's kindness and understanding in order to get past this very big obstacle in my life and continue showing people the beauty of stained glass.

Even by just sharing this link to your friends, you will be doing me a very serious favor. I understand that not everyone can afford to donate money, since they themselves still need that money for very important reasons. However, spreading the word of this fundraiser takes just a few clicks (or 4 button presses, if you're familiar with Ctrl+C and Ctrl+V) and you will be helping me tremendously.

I am only asking for $7,000 because I am selling my motorcycle as soon as possible, which will fetch about $1,000 (2001 Kawasaki Ninja 500R). The remaining $300 from the $7,736 total will go towards the materials needed to make the Discord stained glass window, which cost about $280-300 in total.

Even if 7,000 people donated just $1, this fundraiser would be tremendously more successful than I would have ever imagined.

 

EDIT: I've since had the four root canals done just hours ago, and I have to say that this is far and away the worst pain I've ever experienced. Root canals aren't that bad, nor are extractions, but everything changes when the teeth having serious work done are your front teeth.

A word to the wise: Take care of your front teeth.

story:
Dear non-hungarian Friends out there! For english summary please scroll down.

Miről van szó?

A LASSULÁS projekt

  • egy kiállításból és
  • a Kuckó önkéntes program támogatásából áll.

A kiállítás egyben érzékenyítő tér, a családon belüli erőszakra irányítja a figyelmet.
A jelenség 95%-ban nőket érint, ezért a nők elleni diszkrimináció legszélsőségesebb formájának tekinthető.

A kiállítás a falakon lévő képek és a térben elhelyezett érzékenyítő kártyák kontrasztjára épít. A kártyák pontos és hiteles információkat áramoltatnak a látogatók felé a családon belüli erőszak fajtáiról, arról, hogy mik a jelek, mik a tévhitek, hogyan lehet segítséget kérni és hogyan lehet jól segíteni?

A képek egy részével a www.virtualisoromok.blogspot.com oldalon tudsz ismerkedni.
Az érzékenyítő kártyák névjegykártya méretűek, elvihetőek. A kártyákon szereplő informatív tartalom mellett mindegyiken fel lesz tüntetve a Nők a Nőkért Együtt az Erőszak Ellen (NANE) Egyesület - mint segítő szervezet - elérhetősége.

Mekkora támogatásra van szükség és hogyan hasznosul?

Körülbelül 111 000 Ft összegyűjtését terveztem, de minimum 500 dollárban határozható meg a célösszeg. Ez valamivel több.

Azt gondolom, ez elérhető cél,  de bármekkora összegű támogatás gyűlik össze, előre fogja vinni a projektet.

Hogyan oszlanak el a felajánlások?

  • A kapott támogatások 40%-a az érzékenyítő tér létrehozásának költségeit fedezi.
  • A jobb oldalon láthatod a hozzájárulási lehetőségek listáját. Mindegyikhez tartozik egy ajándék, amivel megköszönjük neked, hogy támogatod a törekvéseinket. Az összeg 20%-át az ajándékok keretezésére, nyomtatására, belföldi postázására fordítom.
  • A fennmaradó 40% a már említett Kuckó önkéntes programhoz kerül.
    A Kuckó pártfogoltjai már kiszakadtak a családi otthonból, de a programnak köszönhetően élményeket és hasznos holmikat kapnak. Ha szeretnél többet tudni a csapatról: https://www.facebook.com/kuckoprogram/

Hol tart most a projekt?

A kiállítási anyag elkészült, a kiállító tér megvan. A váci Katona Lajos Városi Könyvtár barátságos hangulatú galériája fogadta be az anyagot. A megnyitó október 6-án, 17.30-kor lesz.

Korábbi terveim szerint a megnyitó idejéig tartott volna a kampány, de jobbnak éreztem úgy időzíteni, hogy a gyűjtés a megnyitó után is folytatódjék. Így közben lehetőséged van személyesen is megismerni az anyagot.

Miért jó, ha támogatod?

A közgondolkodás megváltozása hosszadalmas folyamat, de mivel folyamat, ezért halad és iránya van. Rajtunk múlik, hogy merre tart és hogyan. A LASSULÁS projekt ebbe a folyamatba csatlakozik bele. Azt is lényeges megfogalmazni, hogy a társadalmi felelősségvállalás lehet a mindennapok része, sőt, fontos, hogy hétköznapivá, általánossá váljon. Elkezdődhet egy klikkeléssel is.

Milyen egyéb módon tudsz segíteni?

Több ötlet is felmerült:

  • Sharing is caring! Kérlek, oszd meg a kampányt a barátaiddal is.
  • Ismersz olyan személyt, egyesületet, vagy céget, aki(k)ről tudod, hogy szívügyük lehetne a LASSULÁS? Köszönöm, ha segítesz, hogy kapcsolatba kerülhessünk.
  • Ha szimpatizálsz az önkéntességgel, keresd a KUCKÓt! Nagyszerű csapatba kerülhetsz.
    Itt egy cikk róluk, ízelítőképpen: http://wmn.hu/2016/04/24/kezek-szavak-szivek-hogyan-lesz-kucko-a-gyermekotthonokbol/

Néhány gondolat még érdekes lehet...

"Ha sietek, akkor a rutin mozgat. A testemet és a gondolataimat egyaránt. A tanult minták kényelméből ítélek meg helyzeteket. Ahhoz, hogy új nézőpontokat fogadhassak be, hogy felülírjam a saját programjaimat, le kell lassulni, esetleg meg is állni."

Amikor elkezdett bennem körvonalazódni egy új kiállítás gondolata, a fiammal voltam várandós. Sokszor eszembe jutott az a tény, ami azóta már az egyik érzékenyítő kártyán szerepel: "A családon belüli erőszak áldozatainak több mint 25%-át akkor is megverik, amikor terhes. (Az ilyen esetek 10%-ában a verés vetélést okoz.) Sokszor épp a terhesség ideje alatt kezdődnek a verések, vagy akkor válnak súlyosabbá." (forrás: nane.hu)

Ez a gondolat nem hagyott nyugodni. Végül úgy döntöttem, a kiállítás nem lehet öncélú. A fizikai vagy lelki sérüléseknek a tabusítása, lekicsinylése csak a teret növeli a bántalmazók számára. A kiállítással ezt a teret szeretném szűkíteni.

---------------

A kártyákon szereplő információk forrása: nane.hu

A videóban elhangzó zene Bruno Sanfilippo alkotása. Köszönet érte! // Music by Bruno Sanfilippo - Piano textures 3 V - Thank you so much, Bruno for your kind help! 

https://www.bruno-sanfilippo.com

 

*^*^*^*English version*^*^*^*

 

What is our project?

The SLOW DOWN project consists of

• an exhibition and

• the support of the Kuckó (Shelter) volunteer program.

The exhibition is also a sensitizing space, raising awareness for domestic violence. 
In 95% of the cases, this problem affects women, therefore it is considered to be the most extreme form of discrimination against women.

The exhibition is based upon the contrast of artworks on the walls and sensitizing cards placed in the space. The cards are providing the visitors exact and authentic information on various forms of domestic violence, i.e. what are the signs, the common misconceptions about it, how to ask for help and provide help effectively.

You can already find a few of the artworks on our website: www.virtualisoromok.blogspot.com
The sensitizing cards come in the size of a business card, so visitors are free and encouraged to take them home. Apart from the relevant information on th bis subject, each card contains the contact details of the Women’s Rights Association Nők a Nőkért Együtt az Erőszak Ellen (NANE) Egyesület, as a possible organization providing help.

 

How much support do we need and how will we use it? 

I have planned to collect circa 111 000 HUF, but the minimal financial goal of the campaign has to be 500 USD, which is a little bit more. I believe this is a reasonable goal, but any little support will curb this project.

How are the perks distributed?

• 40% of the support received will cover the costs of creating the sensitizing space.

• You can see the list of different perks on the right side. With each perk, you will receive a gift to thank you for supporting our activity. 20% of the support received will be used to print, frame and mail these gifts.

• The remaining 40% will be transferred to the above mentioned Kuckó (Shelter) volunteer program.
The little protégés of Kuckó are children who were forced to leave their family homes behind, and the program provides them with memorable experiences as well as useful items. If you would like to know more about the volunteering group, go to: https://www.facebook.com/kuckoprogram/

 

What is the current state of the project?

The artworks are ready; the exhibition space has been fixed. The cozy gallery of Katona Lajos City Library in Vác agreed tohost the exhibition. The opening will be on the 6th of October, at 5.30 p.m.  

In my earlier plans the fundraising campaign would have lasted until the opening of the exhibition, but I felt it was even better to continue with the campaign afterwards, and meanwhile you will have the chance to get acquainted with the project in person.

Why is it worthwhile to join the campaign?

It takes a long time to achieve a shift in public thinking, but since it is a process, it has a direction and it is ongoing. It depends on us, how and where it will lead. The SLOW DOWN project is embedded into this process. It is also important to express that social responsibility can be part of everyday life; in fact it is important that it becomes regular and general. It can start even with a simple click. 

What other ways are there to help?

We have several ideas:

• Sharing is caring! Please share this campaign with your friends!

• Do you know a person, an association or a company, who would be happy to join the SLOW DOWN project? Thank you for helping us to get in touch! 

• If you are interested in volunteering, look for KUCKÓ! You can join a fantastic team. 
Here is a teaser article about them in Hungarian: http://wmn.hu/2016/04/24/kezek-szavak-szivek-ho...

 

A few more interesting thought

"If I am in a hurry, I am animated by routine. My body and my thoughts equally. I assess situations from the comfort of learned examples. In order to acquire new perspectives, and to overwrite my own procedures, I have to slow down, maybe even stop for a while.”

When the idea of a new exhibition started to take shape in my mind, I was expecting my son. I often remembered the fact, which is since printed on one of the sensitizing cards, that “More than 25% of the victims of domestic violence are beaten even if they are expecting. (In 10% of these cases the beating results in miscarriage.) In some cases the beatings start or become more severe during pregnancy.” (source: nane.hu)    

This thought didn’t leave me alone. At the end I have decided that the exhibition cannot be solely art for art’s sake. The tabooing and the derogation of mental or physical injuries solely provide more free room for offenders. I would like to narrow this roomwith my exhibition.

 

Music by Bruno Sanfilippo - Piano textures 3 V - Thank you so much, Bruno for your kind help! 

https://www.bruno-sanfilippo.com

Translated by Orsolya Bálint

story:
Short Summary

HI, I'm Andy! And my business, its called Remnant Preservations, its a taxidermy studio- which I suppose makes me a Taxidermist. A year and a half ago I decided I never wanted to sleep soundly again and opened up Remnant Preservations, I have to say its been the hardest and best adventure of my life. 
This campaign is to help me bring Remnant Preservations one step closer to the my full dream, which is providing not only needed services for those who have had pets pass away and preserving wildlife to be respected and admired, but also to provide an educational setting for those students, hobbyists and inquisitive minds. 
Your contributions will help me obtain tools for students that will be taking classes learning how to taxidermy in a hands on environment, preserve a variety of animals, participate in bone cleaning and articulations. 
In addition to directly supporting and helping Remnant Preservations, I want to use this opportunity to also donate to the Wildlife Rehabilitation Center of Northern Utah. WRCNU is a volunteer based center, meaning it operates solely on donations by its community members. I have many animals I have found injured and on the verge of death to this rehabilitation center and am countlessly blown away by the dedication and hours its volunteers put in (several do unpaid 40 hour work weeks for the sake of helping wildlife recover from man made and naturally caused injuries). I will be donating 15% of the funds raised directly to them, along with outright donations for stretch goal achievements. If you could like to only donate for WRCNU, simply state so in your donation and I will ensure that your full donation goes directly to them
  

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the break down of costs, so you know exactly what you're contribution is providing: 

15% goes directly to WRCNU, 8% is taken by Indie GoGo and processing fees, Student Tool Kits will cost $50 each, we would like to get a min. of 15 but will certainly need more as the quest progresses. This goal also includes the cost of shipping for the perks below!  And then, theres the heftier equipment, our freezer have reached a rundown state and we have an opportunity to replace them at the fraction of normal costs thanks to an amazing opportunity by a local HVAC company in SLC (they asked to remain anonymous for this campaign) We also have need to replace our air compressor, which unfortunately we don't get a new deal on and is crucial to daily operations in the shop and student classes.  Any additional contributions raised will go towards raw materials for the shop and workshops. 

If we do not reach the entire goal, we will create fewer student kits, and prioritize freezer and equipment replacements as needed. 

What do you get with your contribution? Here are the Perk Options:

For Contributing $125  you will receive a reserved place in our Taxidermy Bunny or Rat Taxidermy class. You will be able to have a hands on experience in traditional taxidermy experiences which will include skinning your specimen, prepping it, mounting it, posing it and finish work. You will leave with your specimen in hand, instructions for aftercare as well as the option to attend future classes at a discounted rate. Dates for these classes will be determined based on how many contributors sign up to asses class sizes. 


For Contributing $50  You will receive a dry- preserved bunny in a naturalistic pose. Shipping is included.  The bunnies colors will be an assortment, and will not require a plaque to stand on their own, meaning you can put them virtually anywhere in your home! You will also receive a tip sheet sheet with your specimen on how to care for taxidermy pieces to prolong their life.  


 For Contributing $30   You will receive BOTH a preserved baby quail and a preserved baby chick. These little chicks will be in a variety of sitting and standing naturalistic poses, in order to get these out in a timely fashion after we reach our goal- we will not be able to give the option for specific poses. You will also receive a tip sheet sheet with your specimen on how to care for taxidermy pieces to prolong their life.  Shipping is included.

For Contributing $10  You will receive a screen printed patch with Remnant Preservations Hyena logo on it. Shipping is included in this. 


All Perks will come with a special card which will give you a discount for either a specimen to be preserved or for one of our workshops or classes. 

Be sure to select your perk when you give your contribution and be sure to leave your shipping address and contact information : ) 

The Impact

Completing this goal is going to hugely impact the studio and our community, my dream of providing educational and affordable classes to our community is one that extends beyond myself.  I have had dozens and dozens of requests for classes and opportunities to interact with animals in this unique way, on a weekly basis. I would love to be able to extend a quarterly class for High School, Jr. High and Elementary age students to attend for free to further spread the knowledge, history and trade skill that Taxidermy has to offer. And be a reliable and steady source of help for hobbyists and students alike, this campaign is one of the biggest steps in achieving and making it all a reality. 

Risks & Challenges & Other Ways to Help

Since Remnant Preservations has been established for the past year and a half, as well as my own experience over the past several years in taxidermy, the biggest challenge in achieving this goal will simply be spreading the word! Share this campaign with your friends and family, this is especially helpful if you aren't in a position to contribute a donation! 

Fulfillment on these perks will be based on donation volumes and I will keep contributors updated through our Instagram ( @remnantpreservations) , facebook ( www.facebook.com/RemnantPreservationsTaxidermy ) and here on Indie GoGo.

This goal also includes the cost of shipping for the perks below!  And then, theres the heftier equipment, our freezer have reached a rundown state and we have an opportunity to replace them at the fraction of normal costs thanks to an amazing opportunity by a local HVAC company in SLC (they asked to remain anonymous for this campaign) We also have need to replace our air compressor, which unfortunately we don't get a new deal on and is crucial to daily operations in the shop and student classes.  Any additional contributions raised will go towards raw materials for the shop and workshops. 
If we do not reach the entire goal, we will create fewer student kits, and prioritize freezer and equipment replacements as needed. 
What do you get with your contribution? Here are the Perk Options:
For Contributing $125  you will receive a reserved place in our Taxidermy Bunny or Rat Taxidermy class. You will be able to have a hands on experience in traditional taxidermy experiences which will include skinning your specimen, prepping it, mounting it, posing it and finish work. You will leave with your specimen in hand, instructions for aftercare as well as the option to attend future classes at a discounted rate. Dates for these classes will be determined based on how many contributors sign up to asses class sizes. 

For Contributing $50  You will receive a dry- preserved bunny in a naturalistic pose. Shipping is included.  The bunnies colors will be an assortment, and will not require a plaque to stand on their own, meaning you can put them virtually anywhere in your home! You will also receive a tip sheet sheet with your specimen on how to care for taxidermy pieces to prolong their life.  

 For Contributing $30   You will receive BOTH a preserved baby quail and a preserved baby chick. These little chicks will be in a variety of sitting and standing naturalistic poses, in order to get these out in a timely fashion after we reach our goal- we will not be able to give the option for specific poses. You will also receive a tip sheet sheet with your specimen on how to care for taxidermy pieces to prolong their life.  Shipping is included.
For Contributing $10  You will receive a screen printed patch with Remnant Preservations Hyena logo on it. Shipping is included in this. 

All Perks will come with a special card which will give you a discount for either a specimen to be preserved or for one of our workshops or classes. 
Be sure to select your perk when you give your contribution and be sure to leave your shipping address and contact information : ) 
    The Impact Completing this goal is going to hugely impact the studio and our community, my dream of providing educational and affordable classes to our community is one that extends beyond myself.  I have had dozens and dozens of requests for classes and opportunities to interact with animals in this unique way, on a weekly basis. I would love to be able to extend a quarterly class for High School, Jr. High and Elementary age students to attend for free to further spread the knowledge, history and trade skill that Taxidermy has to offer. And be a reliable and steady source of help for hobbyists and students alike, this campaign is one of the biggest steps in achieving and making it all a reality. 
    Risks & Challenges & Other Ways to Help
Since Remnant Preservations has been established for the past year and a half, as well as my own experience over the past several years in taxidermy, the biggest challenge in achieving this goal will simply be spreading the word! Share this campaign with your friends and family, this is especially helpful if you aren't in a position to contribute a donation! 

Fulfillment on these perks will be based on donation volumes and I will keep contributors updated through our Instagram ( @remnantpreservations) , facebook ( www.facebook.com/RemnantPreservationsTaxidermy ) and here on Indie GoGo.

story:
"You've Got the UNIVERSE in Your Hands"

THANK YOU!!!!!!   This campaign did not make the 21,800 goal but we did pretty darn good! Some lessons were learned - and many blessings were received. Super grateful for all of your support! Looking forward to doing the work necessary to fulfill all of the 230+  gifts and making the book happen. 
Thank you all again so much!  - And for anyone interested in the book after the indegogo has closed - please check out AquariusDreams.com


"You've Got the Universe in Your Hands" is an empowering visionary arts children's book which celebrates the awesome miracle of being alive in this conscious, loving universe! It's a reminder which kids love to hear. It is currently available in black and white as a downloadable PDF - or as a limited edition signed hardcopy- and - with your help - is on it's way to becoming a full color illustrated book and a digital interactive ipad/tablet app.

Working on the song of it as well..

https://soundcloud.com/ryan-be/universe-in-your-hands-1


The story .... Came through inspired by my then 5 year old cousin Emma- who's name it turns out - means "wholesome and universal"  . . .


You’ve got the UNIVERSE in your hands.

I’m not making this up, it really is true – you’ve got the whole universe right here with you.

You’ve got the universe in your hands. Let me explain the way hearts and stars may understand.

Each star in the night, just like each grain of sand,

is made of the same stuff as each woman and man.

And each woman and man and all of the children

and every dog, every cat, and every sweet little kitten,

are all made of the same UNIVERSE, far and wide.

The very same UNIVERSE that IS you and I.

Now, you don’t have to believe this, though what you believe may matter.

The TRUTH is you are made of the STARS as they scatter.

You are made of the SUN and of this EARTH.

But it is of the great and holy words

“ I AM ”

that we all came to birth!

You are made of the winds, and the waves in the sea,

of the endless vibration, sweet deep harmony.

You are made of LOVE and of POWER and STRENGTH.

Of so many things for which we all give thanks!

So GIVE THANKS!!!

Thank your parents, your ancestors ‘n’ the stars;

and give thanks for LOVE, CONSCIOUSNESS, CREATION, CREATOR…

…YOURSELF.

Give thanks for Love ‘n’ YOURSELF, for your come-to-life powers!

And give thanks for the fish, the birds and the bees and the flowers and the trees.

For the high snowy mountains and the sacred, fertile valleys.

And for all the good things that have brought you to your feet!

And all the things that may bring you to your knees.

All that is, all that was, and all that ever will be....


And for reminding you, if you wish, some sometimes think to thank me,

but I’m just like you; look through true and you’ll see…

How I love you so, ever so … oh so dearly.

And I will always be here, and you will be too…

…F O R  I  A M  T H E  U N I V E R S E…

And so are you.


You’ll get the UNIVERSE  in your hands!

  • When you pre-purchase the book - or invest in my art - you'll receive what you pay for and a bunch of love and gratitude as well. I've tried to price my perks and art as honestly and reasonably as possible. Your support makes you part of bringing this story to life!...

The book is NOW available as the black and white digital sketches which are to be the backbone of the finished book....For only $3 or up-  you can download, cut, fold and bind a book yourself.  PDF will be mailed to your e mail address shortly after contribution is received.  Print as many times as you like! For $8 you get the mini book and a coupon code for $10 off the published book in 2014. For $18 you'll get a signed copy of the Black n White mailed to you ! And starting at $33 you can pre order the color, sustainably printed published first run of the book...

Making it happen.

     I'm giving this project all the love, devotion, intention and attention it deserves... There's all kinds of green publishing variables to consider as well (scroll down for more details on publishing). For the most part, indegogo support will function like a publisher's advance. With funds in place, I will be able to focus in on the 30 plus pages of illustrations; which will also become the digital layers for the i pad / tablet book.. This projects requires time and concentrated attention.

Art is Process...

     My art is mixed media: nontraditional digital meets analogue. I layer photos and sketches as digital collage, play with screen printing and alternative printmaking and yes...actual paint. I pour love and prayer and life into my creations. See more at AquariusDreams.Com

Perk #13, Courageous Healer

Perk #14, Dawn of the Buffalo

Perk #15, Elements of the (Big) Heart

Perk #16, Flight of peace (dove)

Perk#17,  Humming the Hearts Song

Perk#18, Immortality

Perk#19, It is of the words "I AM" that you came to birth...

Sneak peak at current book ...

Since my work begins as digital "sketches" and layouts, much of what you saw in the sneak preview in the video is just that, the unfinished digital "sketch" layouts. They are a good start; but with your support, the illustrations will have a more organic painterly feel like the images above...


Sneak peak from the current version Black and white version of the book... color is coming!!!!

Epic / Green Publishing

Because this book is about the UNIVERSE being in our hands there is an underlying message of caring for our planet, ourselves and respecting the fact that we are borrowing our resources from the children and the next 7 generations. I know I have to honor nature when I make it. I have a connection for publishing this book in the US at an Environmentally responsible printing company on recycled or, (waiting on print tests,) possibly even Tree Free paper. I am open to offers from other publishing houses as well; but need the message to be respected in the way the book is made. Love that apps can be tree free... I’m aiming to make the full color hardcover version of the book as epic as can be. Your help will allow me to pour love and attention into every square inch of the illustrations and the care of the publishing details for the finished published version. 

The "Heart of Gold" $33 perk .. Organic American Apparel and screen printed in Ithaca!


What's the $ for?

The budget is $21,800 for me to publish & fulfill the campaign by sending you books and making you art!

These numbers are a pretty good estimate which a friend in publishing helped with .

~$600 Fine-Art Scanning of illustrations

~$895 Art Editing (Photoshop Mastering)

~$1,800 Book Layout Design Fanciness

~$175 Printing Test

~$10,874 1000 Main print run right here in the US. (Nothing against China, or other places; there just isn't very much environmental oversight, and I wouldn't have the opportunity to possibly print the book tree-free)

~$5,000 Perks: Fulfillment and Shipping

~$1,500 Indegogo Campaign Costs (roughly 10-15% of raised funds)


Stretch Goals / Interactivity

More specific Stretch goals for this project will be announced once the initial goal is reached. I've already started to dream of an interactive ipad/tablet app version of the story. Working on the video for this has expanded my awareness of what is possible with text/ movement/ sound and imagery and I'm beginning to dream even bigger. Interactivity might include, for instance, being able to upload images of your parents and grandparents. Talks have already begun with a prominent digital media house which is interested in moving forward on that project with me. All those who support my gifts on this campaign will be given a discount on the interactive version of the story when we are fortunate enough to move in that direction. 

The "Bless your Heart and Hands" $33 perk 11x24 limited edition screen print on wood. 


WHO I AM

Who are you?

My name is Ryan B. Curtis, and you may say that I'm a dreamer... 

I’ve been an artist all my life and I've been making a living at it for a number of years. I have worked in a variety of media and have shown all over the country.  My themes have centered mostly around nature and spirit. I have approached many of my creations with the intention of bringing some kind of a healing energy through my work. It has been a journey and I’ve met so many amazing people...like YOU! Thank you to all who have supported me on this path, and great thanks to Great Spirit for the path itself.

AquariusDreams.com 




Risks and Challenges, nothing we cant surmount!

The biggest challenge with publishing this book is nailing down all the pre-production details, working closely with a printing/ publishing company, hand-picking the papers, printing page samples to ensure the colors are just right, and delivering the final product(s) to you without delay. My greatest joy in moving forward with this project is making each and every color illustration all that it can be and sparking the magic knowing in a child’s heart and mind that they are so loved by the greatness from which they come.

My biggest priority is for the end product to be of the highest quality and for the message to reach all those intended to receive it!  I am willing to take risks to make it happen, including going out on this limb in sharing the process with you!

So much gratitude. Lets make great things happen!

The whole story told here . .  take 2! 

https://vimeo.com/82572610

story:
About Us

Dia De Los Muertos (DDLM) Collective

Hola! We are Adrian Roman, better known by the artistic community as “Viajero” and Benjamin Rojas, better known as “Borish”. We are Brooklyn based visual artists of Puerto Rican and Salvadoran descent, respectively. Dia De Los Muertos community interactive installation is a collective project that for three consecutive years we have been working on together.

Dia De Los Muertos community interactive installation first took place in 2011 at Fresthetic gallery in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Since its inception we knew this installation was destined to travel; that once we share it with the rest of the world it would not only belong to us, but to the many communities that decided to take part of it every year on November 1st and 2nd. Past installations have consisted of us collaborating in creating a structure and designing a Calavera on the outside, and on the inside it houses the community altar where people would come to honor the life of those who have passed and celebrate the legacy they have left with us. We remember them with prayers, songs, candles, dance, food, among many other things people add to the altar. 

                        Photo Credit: Dia De Los Muertos, Brooklyn, 2012. Photo by John A DeMato

For more information on the project, here are links to last year’s  interviews and articles on Dia De Los Muertos:

DNA Info
Columbia University Journalism School
Home Reporter News


Transition into another level

This years Dia De Los Muertos installation has been invited by New York City Councilwoman Melissa Mark Viverito and the Hispanic Federation to create our community altar in El Barrio, East Harlem and we are thrilled say that we have a great program laid out that includes performances, screenings, workshops and panels that will take place at the Julia de Burgos Cultural Center on November 1st and 2nd.


                

Our theme for this years altar is "Migration" ...  both physical and a spiritual migration from one land to another or from one world to another, and what could be a better place to honor this journey than El Barrio, East Harlem, neighborhood that has served as the meeting point to so many cultures in the world. This year’s interactive altar will explore the reasons why people migrate and honor those who have died while in transit. By writing notes to their loved ones on the walls surrounding the altar, symbolically completes the circle of communication between our world and the spirit world.

With the support of the Caribbean Cultural Center African Diaspora Institute, a Harlem Based cultural institution, we have been able to accept Councilmember Viverito’s invitation, but we still need to raise an extra $1,500.00 dollars to cover production, promotion, documentation and memorabilia costs for this event that will allow us to connect people from different communities, with this shared experience of remembering those who were here before us by thanking them for having paved our ways into this world.


This is where you come in!

        Photo Credit: Dia De Los Muertos, Brooklyn, 2012. Photo by John A DeMato

As we mentioned earlier the Caribbean Cultural Center African Diaspora Institute is committed to support our work by sponsoring the program of events that will be part of this project, which includes intergenerational workshops where participants will be able to create memory boxes to add to the altar, performances, screening of a short process video followed by a Q & A  with the artists and a multicultural panel.


Right now is urgent that we raise $1,500 dollars to cover the following:

  • Building materials: We need materials to build and create the altar. See pictures from last year’s altar here.

  • Flowers for the altar: Flowers are a very important element on Dia De Los Muertos altars around the world. Traditionally, the flowers used on the altars are marigolds.

  • Food and sweets for the altar: The food is an important aspect of the celebration. Food used in tribute varies according to the taste of the deceased, but few items are traditional, such as candied delicacies, sugar skulls, pan dulce, among other things.

  • Transportation of the altar: Our art studio is currently located in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, which means that we need to transport the altar from Brooklyn to East Harlem, where the community altar will take place.

  • Promotion: We want this event to be a total success. We want to gather  people from the five boroughs and beyond, to provide an experience that connect us all and this is why PROMOTION IT’S SO IMPORTANT. We will use part of the funds to print flyers, pay for distribution, public relations and online ads

  • Documentation: Last year we began documenting the process of preparing this Dia De Los Muertos Community Altar and Art Installation and we were blessed to have our friend Amilcar Cariño from Hardbox Productions documenting the journey, and this year we need him to continue this work. Is our goal to produce a documentary out of this wonderful event in the future, so we really need to have him back in the team.

  • Production of memorabilia: We now you will love your experience at the Dia De Los Muertos Community Altar and Art Installation, and that you will want to cherish it forever and share it with your friends, family and neighbors. This is why we want to create a photo book, t-shirts and prints that you can buy as a donation to DDLM 2014.


The Impact

Your contribution would help us bring our project to El Barrio. Our vision is for this installation/celebration to be multi-cultural experience that can eventually be taken to different cities and countries across the world. El Barrio is a diverse community of people that are only familiar with the traditional ways of Dia De Los Muertos. Your contribution will help provide an experience for people of all ethnicities and beliefs to come together as a community and acknowledge the people in their lives that have passed on. The installation will provide a space of honoring, mourning, and most of all celebrating them. 

Our previous installations have been successful in many different ways. Our first was created as a celebration between friends and family to come together and share a personal and intimate experience with one another. We also took the opportunity to collaborate together as artists on this project as a representation of community working together with one voice. Our success was in bringing all of our friends and family together as one. Our second installation was very successful in getting the community, local businesses and a local church involved in supporting our project. It was recognized by many different local media and press for our dedication to victims of hurricane Sandy.

As artists we are always looking for new ways to express ourselves. Through this expression we know it's our responsibility to also speak for our communities and relate to them as well. Today, we have lost many natural ways of communication, physically and spiritually which have been the foundation of our communities. We want to use this day of celebration to celebrate life, to honor our ancestors who paved the way for us, and to FEEL together as one community.

Want to help but can't donate?

  • Spread the word! Share this campaign within your Facebook and Twitter network. If you are a blogger, please blog about it. If you know someone that knows someone, please SHARE! Tip: Remember to use the IndieGoGo Share Tools.

  • Volunteer!  If you have time to donate we also love that! We need extra hands for November 1st and 2nd, to help us setup the altar, handle refreshments, guiding attendees throughout the event, handling sales/donation table, among other things. If you want to get involve and donate time, please write to diadelosmuertoscollective@gmail.com

With the support of the Caribbean Cultural Center African Diaspora Institute, a Harlem Based cultural institution, we have been able to accept Councilmember Viverito’s invitation, but we still need to raise an extra $1,500.00 dollars to cover production, promotion, documentation and memorabilia costs for this event that will allow us to connect people from different communities, with this shared experience of remembering those who were here before us by thanking them for having paved our ways into this world.

This is where you come in!


        Photo Credit: Dia De Los Muertos, Brooklyn, 2012. Photo by John A DeMato
As we mentioned earlier the Caribbean Cultural Center African Diaspora Institute is committed to support our work by sponsoring the program of events that will be part of this project, which includes intergenerational workshops where participants will be able to create memory boxes to add to the altar, performances, screening of a short process video followed by a Q & A  with the artists and a multicultural panel.


Right now is urgent that we raise $1,500 dollars to cover the following:

Building materials: We need materials to build and create the altar. See pictures from last year’s altar here.
Flowers for the altar: Flowers are a very important element on Dia De Los Muertos altars around the world. Traditionally, the flowers used on the altars are marigolds.
Food and sweets for the altar: The food is an important aspect of the celebration. Food used in tribute varies according to the taste of the deceased, but few items are traditional, such as candied delicacies, sugar skulls, pan dulce, among other things. 
Transportation of the altar: Our art studio is currently located in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, which means that we need to transport the altar from Brooklyn to East Harlem, where the community altar will take place.
Promotion: We want this event to be a total success. We want to gather  people from the five boroughs and beyond, to provide an experience that connect us all and this is why PROMOTION IT’S SO IMPORTANT. We will use part of the funds to print flyers, pay for distribution, public relations and online ads

Documentation: Last year we began documenting the process of preparing this Dia De Los Muertos Community Altar and Art Installation and we were blessed to have our friend Amilcar Cariño from Hardbox Productions documenting the journey, and this year we need him to continue this work. Is our goal to produce a documentary out of this wonderful event in the future, so we really need to have him back in the team.

Production of memorabilia: We now you will love your experience at the Dia De Los Muertos Community Altar and Art Installation, and that you will want to cherish it forever and share it with your friends, family and neighbors. This is why we want to create a photo book, t-shirts and prints that you can buy as a donation to DDLM 2014.


The Impact
Your contribution would help us bring our project to El Barrio. Our vision is for this installation/celebration to be multi-cultural experience that can eventually be taken to different cities and countries across the world. El Barrio is a diverse community of people that are only familiar with the traditional ways of Dia De Los Muertos. Your contribution will help provide an experience for people of all ethnicities and beliefs to come together as a community and acknowledge the people in their lives that have passed on. The installation will provide a space of honoring, mourning, and most of all celebrating them. 
Our previous installations have been successful in many different ways. Our first was created as a celebration between friends and family to come together and share a personal and intimate experience with one another. We also took the opportunity to collaborate together as artists on this project as a representation of community working together with one voice. Our success was in bringing all of our friends and family together as one. Our second installation was very successful in getting the community, local businesses and a local church involved in supporting our project. It was recognized by many different local media and press for our dedication to victims of hurricane Sandy.
As artists we are always looking for new ways to express ourselves. Through this expression we know it's our responsibility to also speak for our communities and relate to them as well. Today, we have lost many natural ways of communication, physically and spiritually which have been the foundation of our communities. We want to use this day of celebration to celebrate life, to honor our ancestors who paved the way for us, and to FEEL together as one community.



Want to help but can't donate?
Spread the word! Share this campaign within your Facebook and Twitter network. If you are a blogger, please blog about it. If you know someone that knows someone, please SHARE! Tip: Remember to use the IndieGoGo Share Tools.
Volunteer!  If you have time to donate we also love that! We need extra hands for November 1st and 2nd, to help us setup the altar, handle refreshments, guiding attendees throughout the event, handling sales/donation table, among other things. If you want to get involve and donate time, please write to diadelosmuertoscollective@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Simone Miller, and I am a recent graduate of Culver City High School. I'm currently attending CSSSA, the California State Summer School for the Arts, where I'm majoring in Ceramics within the Visual Arts department. The problem is, I'm having trouble paying for this amazing experience, especially as someone who will be attending college this fall.

CSSSA is a summer art "camp" at Cal Arts in Valencia, where I'm living and taking intensive art classes for four weeks. I'm living here with other talented artists from all disciplines of art (visual, dance, theatre, animation, film, and music) taking classes from 9AM to sometimes 9PM for six days a week. Here at CSSSA, I'm following the footsteps of my older peers and expanding my knowledge in the arts, something that will help contribute to my future. I will be majoring in Architecture at Cal Poly San Luis Obispo this fall, so developing my knowledge of the arts and 3D mediums will help give me an edge to the type of art forms I want to create as an architect. I really view this as one of the most important opportunities I have embarked.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The costs of the program is $1500 in total. I did receieve a $500 scholarship from CSSSA, however there were other elements not included in this fee that racked up the cost back to around $1500, such as art supplies ($140), field trips ($165), and gas and extra food.

Whatever amount of money raised will go towards funding this opportunity here at CSSSA. Any extra money raised will go towards buying necessities for college this fall. 

Every day here at CSSSA, I'm having many different adventures with very unique people, and I'm making a wide range of art pieces, so please be excited about the perks, as a way to see what your contributions have helped me create!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass this around! Whether it's telling others or posting the link on social networking sites and promoting the campaign. Any and all help is very appreciated!

story:
Aidez-moi à réaliser deux de mes rêves! 

1-Aller en Inde
2- Faire un voyage humanitaire. 

Vous savez ce sentiment logé au plus profond de votre être, qui des fois se réveille et soudainement vous pousse à dire oui; à vous lancer dans une aventure; à sortir de votre zone de confort; à changer de direction pour accomplir quelque chose que vous avez toujours voulu faire? C'est exactement ce que j'ai ressenti, il y a quelques mois de cela, alors que l'annonce du voyage en Inde à été lancé à mon église. Ce n'était pas dans mes plans, ce n'était pas dans mon horaire, mais poussé par une conviction, un désir profond, un appel d'y aller, j'ai «levé la main» et j'ai dit oui.

Les faits:

Quand: Du 20 au 31 août 2015

Où : Dans le Nord-Est de l’Inde dans une ville du nom de Siliguri

Quoi : Camp de jour avec les enfants du quartier (orphelins, écoliers, enfants de la rue);

Faire des travaux manuels dans l’école et l’orphelinat du Quartier;

Rencontre avec villageois, distribution de sac de riz et  de nourriture.

L'argent va servir à financer le voyage, les frais de VISA et les vaccins. S’il y a un surplus, je vais faire un don à une cause qui me tient à cœur (je vais bien entendu vous tenir au courant).

story:
WHAT WE ARE PLANNING

We are a community of Finnish architects, artists, designers, engineers, entrepreneurs, scientists, and other creatives. Read more about our team on https://spaceonfire.com/team.html

The core of our installation is a parametrically designed wooden space approximately 120 sq meters in size (1300 sq feet), combining the best of innovative Finnish wood architecture and cutting edge space technology. This pavilion receives and broadcasts signals from and to space and transforms them into an immersive audiovisual experience in the middle on Deep Playa, Burning Man 2017.

The project aims to bring space closer to each one of us and help us realize that space technology and space exploration is no longer the privilege of national governments and multinational corporations.

 

OUR PAST PROJECTS

The team members have already delivered two resonating well received art pieces to the playa and beyond, both receiving wide praise internationally. In 2015, the team brought the first Finnish installation called “The Pike of Mana” and in 2016 they collaborated with Burners Without Borders to bring “Koulu School” to the Man Base. The idea behind Koulu School is to build a school with minimal resources. Since Burning Man 2016, Koulu School has been tested in post-disaster situation in Nepal and at Zaatari refugee camp in Jordan. Both of the pilots have produced promising results for turning the concept into a humanitarian aid program.

  • More about Pike of Mana (2015): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pjN3BKG0aP4
  • More about Koulu School (2016): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x7SEdlZVRyk

 

WHY THE ‘COSMIC EGG’?

The team has realized that Burning Man is a great testing ground whether it comes to refugee situations or colonizing Mars. The pavilion is a prototype of a parametric, self-load-bearing structure that can easily be scaled up to structures as big as 3000 square meters (32 000 square feet). Because of the optimal durability and efficiency of the design, these types of structures are a common choice when designing structures to be built on the surface of Mars.

The satellite ground station that is used in the project will be tested for extreme conditions and scalability. The project explores the possibility to build a global, open-source satellite ground station network hosted by public science centers. Some of our project members are affiliated with CERN (The European Organisation for Nuclear Research) and Heureka Science Centre in Finland. The objective would be to bring satellite data available to the greater public.

The project will produce data for two peer-reviewed papers in management science to learn about holacracy and radical innovations, and two in architecture and structural engineering to learn about a new type of joint design and how to build asymmetric parametrically designed structures with straight blocks. The study will be conducted by researchers at Aalto University in Finland.

 

FUNDING

This far, the project has been funded with two grants from Finnish foundations 38.000€ in total - and hours and hours of voluntary work. With this money, we have been able to acquire and process the wood for the space dome for Burning Man as well as our prototype in Finland, as well as send the dome to The USA.  Right now, we would need your help in order to make the experience within the dome as amazing as it can be. Altogether, we would need to raise about 20.000 euros (23 000 USD).

  • Ground station materials & radio equipment
  • Sound equipment
  • Lighting
  • Transport (2 Uhaul trucks and gasoline)
  • Wiring and electronics
  • Custom-made fire pit 
  • 2 x 3000 watt inverter generators (reliable and safe for electronics)
  • Tools & scaffolding
  • Shade for the build period
  • Firewood
  • Logs around the fire to sit on and other decorations
  • Indiegogo expenses
  • Perks, VAT & shipping

As perks, we are offering exclusive items designed for our project by leading Finnish artists and designers.

Our goal for the fundraising is flexible. The more money we manage to raise, the better the experience will be. With a minimum of 10.000 EUR we can transport the installation to Black Rock City, receive signals from space with a simple antenna, have more modest and less immersive audio-visual experience with scaled-down sound and light equipment. 

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

The biggest risks for the installation not happening this year are a lack of funding, the installation getting stuck in customs, or force majeure.

We have made sure that the shipping of the structure is handled according to rules and regulations, all of the pallets are accordingly stamped, and the shipment is properly insured. However, in case the container gets lost, stolen or any other ‘force majeure’-situation happens to it, is naturally out of our reach.

Moreover, we have made sure that the project does not depend on any single person. In case a key person falls ill, suffers fatality or alien abduction, is denied the entry to United States, then the other project members have the experience and expertise to carry on with the project. The project documentation is available to every project member, and it includes all the necessary tasks and contacts.

We also avoid dependency on third parties as much as we can. Therefore we take care of the transport and build on our own, and have designed the installation so that it is possible to build without external help or heavy machinery.

The project team has already constructed one prototype in Finland and has the confidence that the structure can be built in time unless an external influence intervenes with the build schedule.

In case of extreme weather conditions on the playa during the build, we have to stand down and make sure that the construction can be finished safely.

 

FOLLOW AND SHARE

To support our campaign and cause, please follow us on social media and invite your friends to participate as well.

Website: www.spaceonfire.com
Facebook: www.facebook.com/spaceonfire

Twitter: www.twitter.com/spaceonfire_fi
Instagram: @spaceonfire_fi

IndieGoGo: https://igg.me/at/spaceonfire
#spaceonfire

ALL PRICES OF THE PERKS ARE INCLUSIVE OF WORLDWIDE SHIPPING AND FINNISH VAT.

story:
OUR STORY...

Outback Creative started as an initiative to share Australia’s outback beauty and culture, through the brilliance of Australia’s finest rural & Indigenous artists. Outback Creative is now an interactive platform for talented Australian artists, art lovers and collectors, showcasing to the world premium outback art, both in digital and physical form. 

www.outbackcreative.com.au

OUR VISION...
To give our amazing artists worldwide recognition for their artwork through books, online gallery and art displays at events. 

Our project's milestones are:


1) To publish a premium coffee-table Art book showcasing the work of many talented Australian artists. The book will display all 70 of our artists and their work, it will tell the stories of their art and of the Australian Outback. Each artists submits 3 pieces of art and their stories to be included in the book. 

2) To promote Australian Art through local events. The Outback Creative has been invited to 5 events to showcase our artwork and sell our books. 

3) To market local artists outside of Australia through main social media platforms and website. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here are your unique perks:

  • $20 - single entry to the draw to win  "Australia Dreaming", plus 5% discount storewide (on the Outback Creative website).
  • $40 - double entry into the draw to win "Australia Dreaming, plus 5% discount storewide (on the Outback Creative website).
  • $60 - triple entry into the draw to win "Australia Dreaming", plus 5% discount storewide (on the Outback Creative website), plus a copy of the book.
  • $80 - quadruple entry into the draw to win "Australia Dreaming", plus 5% discount storewide (on the Outback Creative website), plus a copy of the book.
  • $100 - 5 entries in the draw, plus 5% voucher storewide (on the Outback Creative website), plus a copy of the book. 
  • $200 - 10 entries in the draw, plus 10% voucher storewide (on the Outback Creative website), plus a copy of the book.
  • $400 - 20 entries in the draw, plus 10% voucher storewide (on the Outback Creative website), plus a copy of the book.
  • $800 - 40 entries in the draw, plus 10% voucher storewide (on the Outback Creative website), plus 2 copies of the book.
  • $1000 - 50 entries in the draw, plus 10 % voucher storewide (on the Outback Creative website), plus 2 copies of the book. 
  • Anything over $1000, perks to be negotiated with Ranald McMaster, ph: 0447310501.

* anyone who purchases a perk that contains a book will not receive them until after the book is printed. Books will be sent out on the 15th of October. So if you have spent money on a perk and are expecting a book you will have to wait till after this date to receive it. 

* "Australia Dreaming" is on original oil painting on canvas which represents not only the beauty of our country but also our brand's logo and ethos.

*to receive your voucher please remember to include your email or email Charles (charles@outbackcreative.com.au) to receive your discount voucher for the Outback Creative online store. 

 Eleonora Pulcini's Australian Dreaming 
It will be framed and ready to be hang. Its dimensions are the following: 140cmW x 110cmH x 3.5cm thick canvas edge (including framing dimensions).

If you would like to see more of her art please go to link below:

https://www.facebook.com/eleonora.oilpaintings/


Terms and Conditions: 
Backers to provide valid contact details to charles@outbackcreative.com.au
Free shipping Australia wide for the book (released 15th of October 2018). For International postage backer will be contacted via email and invoiced for postage.


If we don't reach the target we will relaunch the campaign and the winner of the painting will be randomly selected between the backers of all the campaigns until we reach 16k, over the period of 11/07/18 - 7/12/18. 

Winner of painting will be drawn on the 8th of December 2018. The announcement will be made on the Outback Creative Facebook page, so give us a like and follow us to find out details of winner closer to date. 

https://www.facebook.com/outbackcreative/ 

Sharing is caring...

We believe in the power of our Australian community, kindness always need to be passed on. So the money raised isn't just about us. Outback Creative will be participating in many events in 2018 and 2019 and will be choosing various charities to donate too per event; with a particular interest in donating too rural charities.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would be very grateful if you could share our campaign and why not jump on our social media platform and give us a thumb up! https://www.facebook.com/outbackcreative/. You can also buy prints of Australian Dreaming, enquire with Charles - charles@outbackcreative.com.au

If you would like to see more of her art please go to link below:
https://www.facebook.com/eleonora.oilpaintings/
Terms and Conditions: Backers to provide valid contact details to charles@outbackcreative.com.auFree shipping Australia wide for the book (released 15th of October 2018). For International postage backer will be contacted via email and invoiced for postage.
If we don't reach the target we will relaunch the campaign and the winner of the painting will be randomly selected between the backers of all the campaigns until we reach 16k, over the period of 11/07/18 - 7/12/18. 
Winner of painting will be drawn on the 8th of December 2018. The announcement will be made on the Outback Creative Facebook page, so give us a like and follow us to find out details of winner closer to date. 
https://www.facebook.com/outbackcreative/ 

Sharing is caring...
We believe in the power of our Australian community, kindness always need to be passed on. So the money raised isn't just about us. Outback Creative will be participating in many events in 2018 and 2019 and will be choosing various charities to donate too per event; with a particular interest in donating too rural charities.
Other Ways You Can HelpWe would be very grateful if you could share our campaign and why not jump on our social media platform and give us a thumb up! https://www.facebook.com/outbackcreative/. You can also buy prints of Australian Dreaming, enquire with Charles - charles@outbackcreative.com.au

story:
Hi everyone!

My name is Naira, I'm Argentinian and Milo's mother, who is already 1 year and 8 months old.

I'm a graphic designer, and recently  started a kids event business, which consisted of tents setting and more. At first, the main goal was to have pijamas parties, but then it transformed into a broader array of events.

Decoration includes lighting, wreaths, cushions, dolls, fabric, bed sheets, and my iconic dream-catchers at the top of the tents. Incredibly this has been what  caught the attention the mos. From the beginning people started asking me for them, their prices,  where did I buy them? But they are all homemade by me! I didn't pay attention to this at first, but I felt flattered, tho it wasn't my goal at the time.

Very soon after, I earn a spot at a fair and took my tents, I prepared all decorations just like when I set up my events and It happened again, people asking  me for the dream-catchers, so I immediately thought "That's it!" This is what I must focus on!

Now I am in the middle of the quarantine, looking for materials, insisting and asking for delivery. I have already gathered all spare materials I had in home to create and bring to life new models and be able to continue with the project. With the world put on a hold, it is the perfect moment to create, reconnect with art, and hand-craft. I'm fully inspired to continue bringing life to this project, to keep creating my beautiful dream-catchers, and filling people with joy.

That's why I have created an Indiegogo Campaign, with your help I can continue to bringing joy not just by selling them, but helping you creating them. With this goal and teaching I will be able to expand myself,tell you their stories  and their meaning.

To thank your support, videos, tips, tricks, history and meaning are included,so you can also  create magic from home, in family and with much love!

Making dream-catchers is a therapy, the dedication and love of crafting them fills us with satisfaction.

Let's co-create together

story:
Short Summary of the Visual art Exhibition

I am Peipei Li and major in Business Design and Art leadership at Savannah College of Art and Design. I curate a contemporary visual art exhibition entitled Sweet Aspirin, which is a look of the inside of social concern such as obesity, child abuse, suicide, feminism and artificial intelligence by the artist Xiaolu Zhang.

Social concerns affect people’s life a lot. My purpose of doing this exhibition is to encourage people to pay more attention to the current issues such as obesity, child abuse, and suicide, and give more care to those people and Savannah citizens via the exhibiting Zhang’s artwork.

Sweet Aspirin addresses as a tool to begin a conversation that people will want to talk about those topics but they don't know how to talk about it, with ART. People who are suffering and not suffering from those topics can be on the same page when they look at the paintings.  The exhibition will give people a chance to know more about having a positive attitude to look at those social concerns. It will also give local help.

The exhibition is a 3-day project event including 20 pieces of exhibiting works. Each piece of artwork reflects a different topic from the social concerns that people are curious. It will be FREE and open to the public, from May 11th - May 13th, at Sulfur Studios in Savannah Ga.

What We Need & What You Get

  • $500 for 3 days Sulfur Studios Rental Fee
  • $150 for Food and Beverage
  • $60 for Installation Materials
  • $50 for Art Labels
  • $50 for transportation fee

Marketing Promotional Materials

  • $150 for 60 Posters Prints
  • $180 for Flyers+ Exhibition Catalogues
  • $150 for 500 Postcards Prints

Perks

  • Bronze ($10- $25): A thank you letter via email.
  • Sliver ($26- $55):  Thank you note via email and exhibition postcards.
  • Gold ($56-100): Social media mention, thank you note via email and exhibition postcard. 
  • Platinum ($200 +): All the above, plus your name displayed in the exhibition catalog. 
  • Platinum ($500 +): All the above, plus artist/exhibition documentary 

The Impact

  • Evoke people that the world can be happy, peaceful, and colorful,  giving hope by using her bright colors, and strong and powerful art language.   
  • Give more care to those people and Savannah citizens via the exhibiting Zhang’s artwork.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Sharing the event with your friends.

Thank you so much for your contribution. Appreciate for your help! 

Exhibition Curator: Peipei Li

For more information please visit: 

https://www.facebook.com/SweetAspirin.exhibition/

story:
About Under Our Skin

Under Our Skin is a mixed-media visual and textile art class for women in  Simcoe County, Ontario. The project explores stability, self-worth and common ground through art-making.

Created and taught by Barrie artist/educators Mar Lewis and Susan Kendal, Under Our Skin explores various visual and textile art techniques.

We’ve partnered with Redwood Park Communities and its United House, which offer transitional housing and a multitude of resources to women.

Since our initial sessions last year in the fall of 2016, we've worked with watercolours, acrylics, yarn, stitching, screen printing, weaving (integrating both natural and artificial fibres), two-dimensional wall art, and three-dimensional sculptural art.

Ideas of belonging, community, self-reflection and perspective are gently woven into the work that we create. Under Our Skin has become a touchstone for participants and teachers alike: a welcoming, engaging social space where we can share a coffee or tea and the camaraderie inherent in shared artistic work.

Classes are free-of-charge for participants from the United House community, and the House contributes rides and childcare if needed, making this class as barrier-free to attend as possible. 

The class is also open to women in the greater local community through application and a nominal course fee. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking to raise $2000 to go towards our gallery show expenses -- in which we're sharing all the work we did over the last year in a public show -- and to cover the costs of classes in the fall and early winter of 2017/18.
  • What are the perks for donating? Besides a lovely warm feeling of benevolence, you'll see you can choose from an original lino print by Susan and Mar; a set of postcards featuring some stellar student artwork; artist prints of a recent piece of Mar's; original embroidered paper art by Susan; and a mystery art mailing where you get three *surprise* pieces by Susan and Mar, mailed separately and randomly over six months -- how do you even choose?! 
  • But! If you prefer not to have a perk (which is fine!), you can simply choose the "Back It" button at the top right of this page, then you can choose your own amount. And we won't send you anything, but we WILL send you huge vibes of love and thanks! 
  • The funds raised go to teacher-fees, materials costs, rental of our studio space, food and coffee (an integral part of our program is the social aspect, spending our first 45 minutes visiting and coffee-ing), and the costs of our current 2016/17 gallery show (things like wall prep, hanging materials, printing and staffing). 

The Impact

  • We hope to offer more classes this fall. These classes are important to the students who already enjoy coming, and we'd love to welcome new women also.
  • We'd like to carry some continuity after establishing a weekly schedule of classes from January to June (with funding from the Ontario Arts Council), and to keep our connections fresh with one another. 
  • It's a powerful thing to be able to offer this work cost-free to students who don't necessarily have the financial means. 
  • ​We know from participant feedback and United House staff feedback that this program is having a profound impact on many lives, and your support will help this work continue.

Practicality

Regardless of this campaign, we will be offering two or three fall and winter classes to our current students to make sure we stay connected and have a chance to be creative together at least a little bit. We are deeply committed to this work, while also working to manage our voluntary commitments.  

If we achieve our fundraising goal of $2000, we'll be able to offer two classes per month from October through January. This is our hope for the success of this campaign!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you're not in a position to support financially that's is absolutely fine! But you can still help us out! Share word of this project and this fundraiser on social media and with anyone you think might be interested. Including a little text about why you think this project is interesting and deserving helps to personalize the share for your followers.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools, it's so easy! They're up at the top of the page, pick your favourite social media platform and share away. 
  • If you know anyone who might be interested in joining these classes, point them to our website, underourskinsite.wordpress.com, we're always happy to welcome new women to this class.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about Under Our Skin and consider supporting this work, we truly appreciate it.

***

About the educators:

Marlisha (Mar) Lewis is a Barrie-based artist with a passion for collecting, photographing, and screen printing. She has spent time studying as a printmaker, implementing thesis work that explored art expression for Alzheimer’s, and teaching overseas. Her interest in memory, past-story, details in nature, light, and focus are some of the inspirational themes that reappear throughout her creative process. Recently Mar followed a dream to open a community art space that was accessible to all and began developing Art in House, which opened in 2014. Art in House is a gallery and studio in the heart of Barrie on Lakeshore Mews. Mar teaches classes for children and adults, the inexperienced and the experienced, and to people of mixed abilities. To find Mar, visit Art in House: artinhouse.org.

 

Susan Kendal is a textile artist and choreographer based in Simcoe County, Ontario. She spent 15 years as a contemporary dance professional in Toronto working as a choreographer, dancer, teacher, and costume designer. Slowly but surely her love of stitching and crafting crept to the forefront and Susan now works most often as a textile artist, making soft sculpture pieces in felt and embroidery. In 2015 she co-founded Spool Lounge, a sewing studio and shop in downtown Barrie. Her textile artwork is featured in the book Strange Material: Storytelling Through Textiles. Susan is a seasoned arts administrator and editor having worked at The Dance Current magazine as managing editor, writer and circulation manager for 10 years. Last year she choreographed and costumed a full-length dance work for Simcoe Contemporary Dancers. You can learn more about Susan and her work here: pocketalchemy.ca.
