story:
HELLO!

My name is Mia Hawk. I am a painter and artist. 

I love painting. Paintings expressing the rawness of a moment.

Moments filled with life defining choices, rare intimacy and dynamic emotion. 

Paintings that move and engage people. 

I want to create a series of 5-8 paintings over two months that explore the theme of Transformation and Transcendence through a female inspired perspective and the female form. 

 

HOW THE PROJECT WILL WORK

 

The inspiration for the paintings will come from the theme of Extraordinary Women: Transformation and Transcendence. 

Inspiration will come from several sources, personal experience and narratives of others: I will be reaching out the the general public and people that inspire me to tell me their stories. 

I will work with actors/models/dancers to create reference images for the paintings, and to explore the material. 

My model(s) and I will choose from these narratives, selecting the material we find most exciting to work with. The images will be created through exploration of poses, movement, lighting and clothing. 

The reference photos will then reworked and reinterpreted into creating a stylised image, this will involve the addition of symbolic elements helping to tell the story and underscore the emotion.

Each painting will take from 1-3 weeks to complete. The end result will be an exhibition at Kings Cross Canopy market first weekend of September. 

You'll be able to follow much of the progress through my social media channels. 

 

Extraordinary Women: Transformation and Transcendence

 

I love women and I love painting them. I love the softness and the strength in femininity. I love all the different expressions of what it is to be female.

I love hearing peoples stories, stories that are central in a persons life and that also inspires other people. 

The idea of transformation has long fascinated me. I want to explore what it means in the context of internal transformation, focusing it around women’s stories. 

Transcendence for me is taking transformation one step further. The definition of Transcendent is "extending or lying beyond the limits of ordinary experience”.
I’d like to find stories of women who has perhaps experienced raising to extraordinary circumstances, or having experiences of going beyond who they thought they where.

 

ABOUT THE PAINTINGS & INSPIRATION

 

(Metamorphosis into an Unknown Being, oil on canvas 2019)

I often describe my paintings as inspired by fairy tales and mythology, I aim to take the composition out of the 'realistic world' into a more surreal and dream like  space, to explore heightened emotions and themes.

("The Hunt" oil on canvas 90 x 70 cm) 

The language of fairy tales and mythology is often symbolic, and speaks in metaphors and archetypes. I like to think as a type of dream language.  It converts an individual experience into something universal, to focus on commonalities between humans.

My aim is to create a body of work that embodies the essence of the theme (Extraordinary Women: Transformation and Transcendence), centring around the defining characteristic or essence of each individual story. 

The expression in the paintings will be influenced by movement, musicality and emotion, and will be also be reflective of each narrative.

The style of the painting will contain a juxtaposition of figurative and abstract elements. (Like the image underneath, "Wanting to fly", oil on board). 

The aim of this way of working is to create dynamic imagery generate emotional responses as well as being open to interpretation and personal narrative; to provoke questions rather than providing answers. Creating intriguing imagery for contemplation. 

 

WHY THIS PROJECT NOW

 

Across January and February 2019 I set myself a goal to paint 4 new paintings in 6 weeks (two of which you can watch a time lapse of!) that held the artistic integrity of previous work, but a freer and more expressive style. The result of the new work was immensely positive, both in terms of my own experience making it and the amazing feedback and emotional response the work got from viewers. 

I found it profoundly moving to see and hear how people connected with the images. I now want to expand upon this, and create a series. I have dreamed about creating a series of painting for years! I have now perfected my working process, have a wealth of material, and just need the basic means to make it happen. 

The main reason for wanting to do this is that is just fills me with fire. The painting process for me is nothing short of an incredible, humbling, inspiring and magical journey. Watching how people react and connect to the paintings is an incredibly moving experience. 

It is my hope to create paintings that capture peoples imaginations, that engage people in conversation surrounding the theme of transformation. 

This is 100% what I want my artistry to be about; to create stunning images that buts a little fire in peoples bellies. 

 

WHAT THE MONEY WILL BE SPENT ON

 

£3500 will be spent on materials, prints, and is the minimum amount that I need to buy myself enough time to spend the greater part of two months to focus on working the material and  creating the paintings. What ever money is left over will be put towards art fair fees or more stock for the art business.

 

HOW CAN I HELP? 

Even £3 is helping! If for what ever reasons you can't back it financially, please help me spread the word! Share on your social media, tweet, insta or facebook it. There will be lots of updates, pictures and videos of the paintings and the process.

I am also still looking for stories from women about inner transformation! READ MORE HERE

​As they say in Norway many small streams makes a big river! 

 

CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS

 

Some paintings will be produced, regardless of the outcome of the funding.
If, per-say, 50% of the goal is met, I will produce as much as I can during the time that buys me (i.e. half the time).
The goal will still be to show some original work in the first week of September in Kings Cross Canopy Market. 
If the project meets more than it's goal, it buys me more time to produce more work, extra funding also goes straight back into the business, and allows me to create more opportunities to show work (i.e. apply for and pay for more art fairs and exhibitions). 

All rewards purchased will still be fulfilled, regardless. 

 

PERKS

 

I have designed a t-shirt especially inspired by the themes of the series! 

 

Inspired by the idea of being devoted to your own path, and returning to that which comes natural to you (Wild Women; returning to the wild, where things grow naturally). (The Kanji signs says Warrior Women). 

 

 

Available either as a unisex t shirt with front and back print, or a unisex vest in slate grey. (Please note the images are mock ups only, to give an idea of how the t shirt will look! The actual t shirt may look a little different). I may be able to accommodate different colours, but please send me a message before you buy. 

ART & PRINTS

You can also grab a print and/or art bargain, as I have been digging out some originals and prints I have been saving for a special occasion!
You can also pre order prints of the artwork to be created at a discounted rate!
Please message me if you have questions regarding the items and/or shipping etc. 

STUDIO VISIT

You are invited to come and spend an afternoon in my studio and have a look at the work in progress, have a van tour of my self-converted camper van and have a coffee with me in my local hidden gem of a coffee shop with me!  

VIDEO-DIARY

Get exclusive insight into the progress of the paintings and my thoughts around the process! 
I will create a 5-15 minute video - diary type update at the end of every week during the two month project.  Only the people who purchase this perk will have access to the videos during this time! (They may be used for promotional purposes once the project is over). 

If you have any other questions regarding the perks, please don't hesitate to contact me! 

PLEASE KEEP CHECKING BACK! I will be adding more perks as the campaign evolves! 

 

...... and lastly

 

THANK YOU.

Thank you for taking the time to check out my project.

I love the softness and the strength in femininity. I love all the different expressions of what it is to be female.I love hearing peoples stories, stories that are central in a persons life and that also inspires other people. The idea of transformation has long fascinated me. I want to explore what it means in the context of internal transformation, focusing it around women’s stories. Transcendence for me is taking transformation one step further. The definition of Transcendent is "extending or lying beyond the limits of ordinary experience”.I’d like to find stories of women who has perhaps experienced raising to extraordinary circumstances, or having experiences of going beyond who they thought they where. ABOUT THE PAINTINGS & INSPIRATION (Metamorphosis into an Unknown Being, oil on canvas 2019)I often describe my paintings as inspired by fairy tales and mythology, I aim to take the composition out of the 'realistic world' into a more surreal and dream like  space, to explore heightened emotions and themes.("The Hunt" oil on canvas 90 x 70 cm) The language of fairy tales and mythology is often symbolic, and speaks in metaphors and archetypes. I like to think as a type of dream language.  It converts an individual experience into something universal, to focus on commonalities between humans.My aim is to create a body of work that embodies the essence of the theme (Extraordinary Women: Transformation and Transcendence), centring around the defining characteristic or essence of each individual story. The expression in the paintings will be influenced by movement, musicality and emotion, and will be also be reflective of each narrative.The style of the painting will contain a juxtaposition of figurative and abstract elements. (Like the image underneath, "Wanting to fly", oil on board). The aim of this way of working is to create dynamic imagery generate emotional responses as well as being open to interpretation and personal narrative; to provoke questions rather than providing answers. Creating intriguing imagery for contemplation.  WHY THIS PROJECT NOW Across January and February 2019 I set myself a goal to paint 4 new paintings in 6 weeks (two of which you can watch a time lapse of!) that held the artistic integrity of previous work, but a freer and more expressive style. The result of the new work was immensely positive, both in terms of my own experience making it and the amazing feedback and emotional response the work got from viewers. I found it profoundly moving to see and hear how people connected with the images. I now want to expand upon this, and create a series. I have dreamed about creating a series of painting for years! I have now perfected my working process, have a wealth of material, and just need the basic means to make it happen. The main reason for wanting to do this is that is just fills me with fire. The painting process for me is nothing short of an incredible, humbling, inspiring and magical journey. Watching how people react and connect to the paintings is an incredibly moving experience. It is my hope to create paintings that capture peoples imaginations, that engage people in conversation surrounding the theme of transformation. This is 100% what I want my artistry to be about; to create stunning images that buts a little fire in peoples bellies.  WHAT THE MONEY WILL BE SPENT ON £3500 will be spent on materials, prints, and is the minimum amount that I need to buy myself enough time to spend the greater part of two months to focus on working the material and  creating the paintings. What ever money is left over will be put towards art fair fees or more stock for the art business. HOW CAN I HELP? Even £3 is helping! If for what ever reasons you can't back it financially, please help me spread the word! Share on your social media, tweet, insta or facebook it. There will be lots of updates, pictures and videos of the paintings and the process.I am also still looking for stories from women about inner transformation! READ MORE HERE​As they say in Norway many small streams makes a big river!  CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS Some paintings will be produced, regardless of the outcome of the funding.If, per-say, 50% of the goal is met, I will produce as much as I can during the time that buys me (i.e. half the time).The goal will still be to show some original work in the first week of September in Kings Cross Canopy Market. If the project meets more than it's goal, it buys me more time to produce more work, extra funding also goes straight back into the business, and allows me to create more opportunities to show work (i.e. apply for and pay for more art fairs and exhibitions). All rewards purchased will still be fulfilled, regardless.  PERKS I have designed a t-shirt especially inspired by the themes of the series!  Inspired by the idea of being devoted to your own path, and returning to that which comes natural to you (Wild Women; returning to the wild, where things grow naturally). (The Kanji signs says Warrior Women).   Available either as a unisex t shirt with front and back print, or a unisex vest in slate grey. (Please note the images are mock ups only, to give an idea of how the t shirt will look! The actual t shirt may look a little different). I may be able to accommodate different colours, but please send me a message before you buy. ART & PRINTSYou can also grab a print and/or art bargain, as I have been digging out some originals and prints I have been saving for a special occasion!You can also pre order prints of the artwork to be created at a discounted rate!Please message me if you have questions regarding the items and/or shipping etc. STUDIO VISITYou are invited to come and spend an afternoon in my studio and have a look at the work in progress, have a van tour of my self-converted camper van and have a coffee with me in my local hidden gem of a coffee shop with me!  VIDEO-DIARYGet exclusive insight into the progress of the paintings and my thoughts around the process! I will create a 5-15 minute video - diary type update at the end of every week during the two month project.  Only the people who purchase this perk will have access to the videos during this time! (They may be used for promotional purposes once the project is over). If you have any other questions regarding the perks, please don't hesitate to contact me! PLEASE KEEP CHECKING BACK! I will be adding more perks as the campaign evolves!  ...... and lastly THANK YOU.Thank you for taking the time to check out my project.

story:
Since the overview covers my summary I will use this section to tell you more about me and what I am getting out of this experience.

A little about me:

I am a third year Metals Major at the Memphis College of Art. My concentration is in blacksmithing, and it has lately been in damascus steel and other advanced forms of blacksmithing like creating my own tools. I am of Hawaiian, Japanese, decent and have always loved art and anything where I get to create while expressing myself.

 What I hope to gain:

This is a once in a life time experience and I hope to soak up all the knowledge I can from learning with a master swordsmith. I will be producing Japanese chef knives using traditional Japanese bladesmithing. So already with each class there are tangible results. By getting to take more than one class I will learn the process more as well as develop a stronger bond with Fusataro san. This is especially important if there is a chance of me possibly becoming an apprentice of his in the future.

What sponsors get: 

I will sell one or two of the knives that I craft during my time there and sponsors will get a 10% discount as well as a small gift made from me if you donate over $100. At $50 I will design an enameled key chain or necklace with your input. $20 and you will get a randomly seleceted enameled key chain, and $10 will earn you a sticker of my logo. I will also consistently update my social media so you can follow me on my journey in Hashima, Gifu Japan. 

Instagram: @aaronkianapunako_boyd   

website: kiaboyd.com 

email: aaron.boyd@mca.edu

story:
Support us to make this unique project possible: (Choose a perk)

10$ - Postcard

20$ - A1 Exhibition Poster

50$ - Scientific Book

*more information at the bottom of the text

________________________________________


 

THE COLORS OF ANCIENT EGYPT
 


The Grand Egyptian Museum, Cairo-Tahrir is letting some of its most unique pieces come alive. This multimedia exhibition is the first of its kind in the museum’s history. With the image-mapping technique, the oldest masterpieces of art are colored through light and brought back to life. As a co-funder. You can take part of this historic event.

This Project is supported by the Ministry of Antiquities and The German Embassy Egypt
 

 

PREPERATION

While doing this procedure we work hand in hand with archeologists and conservators in the museum to ensure a color accuracy with accordance to originality. This requires us to inspire local archaeologists to scientifically research each chosen object in order to find out what the true colors were. This will generate historical scholarship of each relevant time period and motivate the academic practice of young archaeologists. Moreover, projected light is no different than other visible light therefore will create no damage to the objects.

 

Pilot Project #1 in the Egyptian Museum Cairo

 

SUPPORT

The project is supported by the Ministry of Antiquities Egypt and the Cultural Attaché of the German Embassy. A room in the museum already has been made available for this projects purpose in the month of November.

 

CROWDFUNDING

For the realization of this project we need 9 projectors and technical equipment such as computers and special graphic cards.

 

Pilot Project #2 in the Egyptian Museum Cairo

 

IMPACT

This unique event has the power to enhance curiosity among visitors in the museum and attract new ones as it will pull them back emotionally into the time of ancient Egypt with all of its glory. Already during our pilot-project masses of people gathered around the test objects with great interest, from Egyptian to foreigners and from young to old spectators. The Museum welcomes millions of guests each year due to it containing the largest collection of ancient Egyptian antiquities in the world.

 

Perks at Indigogo

10$ - Postcard

Get a Limited Postcard of the exhibition

Contains:

  • Limited Postcard

 

20$ A1 Poster + Extras

Get a Limited Poster (A1) containing all colored pieces of the exhibition + You will be mentioned on our website as a supporter

Contains:

  • Limited A1 Poster
  • Your name on our website (optional)

 

50$ - Book + Colors BOX

LIMITED BOOK - EDITION OF 350: The book "The Colors of Ancient Egypt" contains 50 pages about the ancient reliefs that we exhibit. Including History & Meaning of the objects, scientific procedures with the archeologists and full frame photos. Furthermore we present all information about the image mapping technique and cover the exhibition.

Contains:

  • BOOK: COLORS OF ANCIENT EGYPT
  • Limited A1 Poster
  • Limited Postcard
  • Your name on our website (optional)
  • Your name at the museum (optional)
  • Mention in the book (optional)

 

www.ancientcolors.com

mail@ancientcolors.com

story:
Peace, 


The All H.A.M. No Pineapples Tour needs your support! The term "starvin artist" has never rang truer.  We want to tour from the Midwest to the East Coast.  Cities include Chicago, Columbus, Cincinnati, New York, Philidelphia, Washington D.C. and more.  But we all the way in Indiana....So if you are a true supporter of Tony Styxx, Rehema McNeil, and/or TOO BLACK then this is your chance let it be known.  


We need to raise $2000 by the end of the June.  Your well appreciated donations will cover traveling expenses such as transportation, food, a place to stay.  Updates will be sent via email to disclose where the finances are being used.  In exchange for your donation you can receive a can receive a free download of Tony Styxx or Rehema's album.  If you donate a little more you can receive a free video download of an entire TOO BLACK show.  We look forward to receiving your support.   


The All H.A.M. No Pineapples is comprised of the most diverse and dynamic elements of poetry. Tony Styxx keen insight combined with TOO BLACKâ€™s hard hitting realism spiced with Rehemaâ€™s youthful zeal is bound to mesmerize college campuses across the nation.


The title All H.A.M. No Pineapples is dedicated to one giving their 100% all at anything and everything they do in life. The All H.A.M. No Pineapples tour is built to entertain, inspire, but most importantly educate. One will be hard pressed to leave a show without feeling moved.

story:
BlagOPet Unlock-O-Tron:



Do you guys remember Geocities?

Back in the Olden Dayes of Yon Internette, before there was Webkinz, NeoPets, or DeviantART, artists traded adoptable pets between their free homepages. Some of these virtual adoption centers were surely scams, but others were just set up by artists who wanted to share their work.  It was an interesting social scene in the days before the web was social.


Some of these could get pretty complex with their projects- creating virtual pet kennels where every single "adopted" pet had a breeding history and a pedigree.  Most of this stuff was done in analog, without a backend of any kind.


Bringing the Analog Virtual Pet Back

So in homage to those early days of online interaction, I'm offering BlagOPets for adoption.  Each one is completely unique and hand-drawn by me.  Here's an example:




When you adopt you will get a graphic like this one in your email, to share on your blog or just to enjoy.  But that won't be all!  Your BlagOPet will also have adventures like this one:




At least two things will happen to your BlagOPet.  I'll be sending you each one about a week apart - so if you adopt now, you'll have two weeks of genuine virtual pet ownership ahead of you, with all the joys it brings.




WARNING: Your children may not get some BlagOPet jokes.  Please don't explain them.


If you contribute a tad more, I'll also send you the original art, and sign it with a <3.




What can I do with my BlagOPet?

It's YOUR virtual pet - so give it a home!  Display it proudly on your blog, blag, blickr, Flickr, Facebook, Myspace, Newgrounds, Geocities, etc.


Alternately, you can just look at it and giggle.  This is a weekly micro-comic drawn just for you.


Why is this on IndieGoGo?  I don't even

You will get your first BlagOPet email as soon as I can draw it - I'm not waiting around to see if we hit the target, but there is something I need.


I've been doing a lot of projects from my first generation Acer netbook.  It's been a pretty decent little laptop, but when I was in San Francisco for StoryWorld this year, I discovered that its wireless card has gone flaky - almost causing me to have to abandon a project.  I want to replace it with something new.  Not necessarily something flashy, just something that works reliably.


I don't really expect this project to pay for a new lappy, but $500 is a nice amount to throw up there and see if we can hit it.

story:
Our Story

WHO: Green Provocateur is an urban art and language intervention appearing around the world as an invitation to people, buildings and green worlds to converse, create and explore new interspecies relationships. 

 

At the heart of Green Provocateur are two artists with a passion for public art experience and experiments who invite YOU to join them!

 

Specifically, we are: Paul Clemence, sprung from the heat of Brazil, a passionate artist and architecture-lover and Jade Dressler, a well-caffeinated NYC publicist and art curator who, beneath her big hats and stilettos, has a heart that beats to a bikini loincloth ecstasy anywhere in Nature. Our travels together in Italy and 6-months of emails from Europe to New York birthed the seeds of Green Provocateur. One year after our first conversations, we are thrilled to be launching a Green Provocateur project in Milan during Salone, the international design fair!

 

We imagine, that all over the world’s greatest cities, Green Provocateur will appear suddenly, like wild and teasing seeds, surprising and seductive landings of green life sown within a city’s architecture.

 

WHAT: Green Provocateur will make its debut in Milan as a large scale outdoor photo installation ( approximately 15 x 50 feeet) printed on eco-friendly paper and planted upon the walls of Via Pepe, bordering Milan’s Garibaldi station. A formally drab and uninspired staircase to the train platform will feature images by photographer Paul Clemence, taken around the globe of the unlikely cross-pollinating intersections of green and architecture. 


WHEN: April 12-17. Green Provocateur appears at the invitation of the cultural organization, AMAZElab, who for 8 years has produced the Green Island satellite Green Design Salone during Salone Internazionale del Mobile, the famed international design fair where over 300,000 people, including 5000 journalists flock to Milan. The Green Island fair has seeded the idea of green into the urban fabric around the avant-garde and transitional neighborhood of Isola.

 

HOW + WHY: Green Provocateur believes in bringing art outside of traditional spaces as a participatory art experience. We invite the public to share in the dialogue and experience both on-site in the urban environment and in the conversations online.  Green Provocateur is a project of the creative agency PLANT., seeding conceptual experiences for artists and the public.

 

THE IMPACT: We hope Green Provocateur will encourage people to slow down, taking time to notice or think about alternative realities of the other species we share the planet with. Our goal is a perception shift, for us all to step beyond adopting eco-friendly habits and emotionally connect with the physical presence of green in connection to where we are as individuals and as an imaginative species.

 

WHAT IF?  Even if our campaign does not reaches its funding goal, the project will be realized. But if the project cannot be funded to the fullest extent that Green Provocateur envisions, the project may have to reduce its final scale and that will make us sad. We stay happy as friends join in and support the project around the world!

 

CAN YOU SEE IT TOO? Green Provocateur has set its sights on cities around the world and we envision Green Provocateur as an adventure with many people joining in.

 

DO YOU ACCEPT THE MISSION?

What You Can Do: Funds raised will go to development, materials and installation costs.

 

What You Get: All contributor's names will be listed on the site in Milan and on the Green Provocateur blog for the world to see.


You Get Perks too! Green Provocateur prints and New York City tours of public art.


Other Ways You Can Be A Green Provocateur

Green Provocateur welcomes partners to realize these dialogues and welcomes funding from other like-minded, passionate Green Provocateurs. Funders to the Green Provocateur: Milan can participate in the launch knowing they are helping to fund the project’s realization and to contribute to the ongoing and active dialogue in Milan and other key cities where Green Provocateur may appear.

 

On behalf of everyone involved in the project, thank you so much for your generous contribution.  Thank you for spreading the word to your friends, networking, using the share tools of indiegogo.com and bringing ideas to the Green Provocateur concept!

story:
Summary

The San Juan Ridge Tapestry Project is a series of embroidered tapestries intended to express the history, culture and landscapes—as well as our hopes for the future—of the San Juan Ridge community, near Nevada City, California. When complete, the thirteen tapestries will hang during special events in the North Columbia Schoolhouse Cultural Center.

This project is modeled after an illustrious medieval work of art—The Bayeux Tapestry—which depicts the history of the invasion of England by the Normans in 1066. This tapestry has survived for a thousand years. Originally rolled up like a scroll and only displayed on special occasions in the Bayeux Cathedral, it is now displayed in a temperature controlled museum of its own. We expect the Ridge Tapestry Project tapestries to be preserved for just as long.

Over one hundred community volunteers have embroidered for more than 4680 hours on the first five tapestries using wool yarns on linen fabric to portray animals, plants, celebrations, performances and events.

Your contribution will help fund the next two tapestries: The Yuba River and The Blue Cradle.
Originally the San Juan Ridge was the territory of the Nisenan Maidu tribe in the heart of the Yuba River watershed. During the 1850s, western settlers moved in to mine for gold. Ranching and logging also were primary industries. During the 1970s, a new wave of "back-to-the-landers" migrated to the San Juan Ridge intent on living closer to nature and off the grid. Writers and poets, such as Gary Snyder and Steve Sanfield, helped to inspire a renewed cultural heritage out of which the North Columbia Schoolhouse Cultural Center emerged. The San Juan Ridge Tapestry Project documents this recent history.

What We Need & What You Get

With the experience so far of five completed tapestries, we know that each tapestry costs about $1800 from conception to completion:

  • Your contribution will help us to pay for the drawings, the linen fabric, the wool yarn and other materials required to create each tapestry, and finally the conservator grade materials needed to ensure proper storage of the tapestries when not displayed.
  • Everyone who funds the San Juan Ridge Tapestry Project will have his or her name included on a donor list that will be sewn into the back of a tapestry. In addition to this honor, donors at the $20 level and up are eligible to receive many special perks featuring images of the tapestries: greeting cards, jigsaw puzzles, and high-quality printed posters. At the $1000 level, you and 10 friends will receive a special "behind the scenes" private viewing with a reception hosted by the San Juan Ridge Tapestry Project team. 
  • We have successfully funded the five completed tapestries from independent donations from our generous community. If we do not meet the goal of this campaign, we have total confidence that we will still be able to complete the funding needed to complete the next two tapestries. UPDATE: We have successfully reached our goal and then some! Your contribution will help us to fund future tapestries after completing the next two. We are at the half-way point of the project and can still use funds!

The Impact

The Ridge Tapestry Project fulfills the North Columbia Schoolhouse’s goal of enhancing rural community life. A diverse group of adults and children share in the creativity of stitching a scene of community life, a scene that showcases community traditions of cooperation, generosity, stewardship of the environment, ceremony and playfulness.

In addition to making a beautiful and valuable object for the community, the stitchers experience the comradeship of working together over a long period of time, exploring stories and people’s lives.  The final product—a series of 13 tapestries—will eventually become a source of income for the Cultural Center through exhibitions and special events. As mentioned, five tapestries have been completed. With your funding, we will be able to pass the half-way mark of this project!

    Risks & Challenges

    During the last seven years, some of our stitchers and donors have died. All the stitchers are committed to finishing the project. Even at the current rate of one tapestry per year, completion may not happen before the year 2021.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We have had a number of requests from other communities about how to start a tapestry project. Please share our project with your friends and other people you know who are interested in textiles and community building.
story_txt:
Summary

The San Juan Ridge Tapestry Project is a series of embroidered tapestries intended to express the history, culture and landscapes—as well as our hopes for the future—of the San Juan Ridge community, near Nevada City, California. When complete, the thirteen tapestries will hang during special events in the North Columbia Schoolhouse Cultural Center.


This project is modeled after an illustrious medieval work of art—The Bayeux Tapestry—which depicts the history of the invasion of England by the Normans in 1066. This tapestry has survived for a thousand years. Originally rolled up like a scroll and only displayed on special occasions in the Bayeux Cathedral, it is now displayed in a temperature controlled museum of its own. We expect the Ridge Tapestry Project tapestries to be preserved for just as long.



Over one hundred community volunteers have embroidered for more than 4680 hours on the first five tapestries using wool yarns on linen fabric to portray animals, plants, celebrations, performances and events.


Your contribution will help fund the next two tapestries: The Yuba River and The Blue Cradle.

story:
Part social experiment, part networking facilitator, and above all diverse and cutting edge on-line magazine, POVNYC.com will profile and promote the projects of emerging and evolving artists and entrepreneurs citywide as well as innovative not-for-profit organizations. Akin to the concept of shopping local POVNYC.com’s primary goal is supporting local talent and fostering the careers of people who think outside the box and .orgs contributing to the vitality of NYC.

Indigogo Campaign funds will be used for exclusively for POVNYC.com Start-up costs including website development, design, launch and maintenance, marketing fees and Creative Director and Intern stipends. 

POVNYC.com will launch on Friday January 9, 2015.

Todd W. Fliedner, POVNYC.com Founder and Creative Director has over 20 Years’ proven experience in the NYC non-profit fundraising, marketing and development sector including tenures at Roundabout Theatre Company, The Pearl Theatre, Primary Stages, The Photography Institute at Columbia University, Brooklyn Community Pride Center and Tribeca Performing Arts Center. Notable entrepreneurial achievements include:

  • Creator, manufacturer and marketer of the NYC Grunge Sponge (1993)

  • Founder and sole proprietor of NYC Navigatours; personalized NYC tour provider (1999-2002)

  • Founder and developer of OUTboundNY.com; gay specific tourism website (2000-2002)

  • Creator and designer of POVNYC Tree (2014)

story:
My name is Josiah Ham (AKA) ZERO. I am an artist based in the SF Bay Area. I am the author of EVGIEP (Every Video Game I've Ever Played), ACZ (Art Collection Zero), and Cross My Heart Hope To Die, my debut novel. I am also the sketcher / curator of Portraits Int'l. I have been a stay @ home father for five years. I would like to sell art and use the money to start an organice farm / educational center here in Kenwood California, my hometown (see pic above). THANK YOU FOR LOOKING! IT MEANS SO MUCH!!!!

 

VIEW THE eBOOK OF Art Collection ZERO here:

http://www.scribd.com/doc/99849926/Art-Collection-ZERO-vol-I

 EVGIEP HERE:

http://evgiep.blogspot.com/

AND PORTRAITS INT'L HERE:

http://zeropower.tumblr.com/

 

I'm asking for $10,000. I need to buy a nice printer / scanner / copier, a new  computer, etc, I would like to be able to get ACZ an ISBN #, purchase Adobe Cs6, paper, ink, etc. I'm going to need to pay for shipping. I am going to get my pieces printed on canvas, and rent a space by my house for an art show / installation, buying and printing stickers, etc.  the rest will go to support my wife and children, Farm start up, so either way you are giving to a noble / worthy cause.

I feel horrible asking for a handout. If I had access to credit cards, or other forms of loans / credit I would totally finance myself, regretably I am not in that position. So any help is greatly appreciated!

 

 

My perks are very special, unique, and rare. My artistic integrity is high, so unfortunately I cannot sell first edition copies cheap. I mean seriously my life is very important / special. I am a very controversial artist on the rise. Each book will will printed on the finest paper, and hand bound by me personally!

If you purchase a first edition copy of my book ACZ I will refund your money in 10 years, provided I can afford it without going broke. I will put this in wiriting and include with every first edition copy. The only condition is being you keep the book the whole time, and are able to present it prior to refund.

 

My book Art Collection Zero is a groundbreaking work. Very unique. Part trolling, part genius, the author really goes in and bears all for the world to see. It is historical, and the books is a contribution to the movement for a better tomorrow. It is the expression of a soul. It is your chance to be a part of that, to OWN a part of that, to essentially own a PART OF ME. 

All contributions I get will go toward printing my work, and finishing my novel and EVGIEP, etc. Ultimately I sell my art to start my farm. The farm will include Greenhouses, Chickens, Bees, fish farm, etc. But I need money for the land / start up / overhead. Basically what I make goes back. I want to give back, I want to help. 

Thank You everybody who contributes!!! Thank you for showing support!!!!!

story:
Since 2004

Rock Paper Scissors Collective has forged a way in community-based arts, craft, and performance in a massive effort to support those who may not otherwise have an opportunity to show their work and participate in the creative community. As a consensus based (all must agree) non-profit organization, we find it essential to the Oakland community that there are free fun cultural festivities for everyone to participate, and Street Scare is a perfect example of projects our volunteers are very passionate about!

rock paper scissors collective is a volunteer-run organization that fosters creativity and collaboration in order to strengthen local communities and encourage sustainable practices and alternative models. We promote the sharing of ideas, skills, and resources through the celebration of art, craft, education, and performance.

Each contribution made to Street Scare will go directly to this project and provide community with the ability to participate in our community pumpkin carving event FREE OF CHARGE! In a community with such a vast economic ability, it is so important that we all come together to make sure every family has access to fun times!

What We Need & What You Get:

  • We need just a little to make some big things conspire:
  •  Pumpkins, pumpkins pumpkins, and carving tools for the community carving event on October 30th
  •  Face paint for the Celebration on December 1st
  • Prize money (mad scrilla for those with talent but little cash-o-la) for the amazing talents submitted from the community 
  • In return, you get epic handmade gifts! Definitely made in Oakland, with love, from Rock Paper Scissors Collective. Aaaannnnnnddddd eternal love and endless high fives!

 

The Impact

Oakland is in the midst of a revival of enormous proportions. This being said, it has become increasingly difficult to find free events for ALL community regardless of income. Rock Paper Scissors Collective is dedicated to providing an essential brick and mortar space for everyone to build and feed off creative energy! It is so important for us to keep our community spirit going incorporate everyone into activities. We hope you can help be part of the Oakland, and Arts community and donate to this event.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Financial contribution aren’t everything (although we do need them), we understand that for sure. Please volunteer with our event!

A few ways you can do this:

  • • Come by the spot and pick up flyers to hang up in places you frequent. We're located at 2278 Telegraph Ave (one of the birthplaces of Oakland's First Friday). While you're there sign up for our email list to find out about awesome things happening.
  • • Direct folks to contribute through social media (via twitter, instagram, facebook, etc) or promote the event via email by linking to our website http://rpscollective.org/street-scare-2013/ or forward on our indiegogo to your email list
  • • Invite folks to attend our event on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/events/221629268006202/
  • • Volunteer with us at the community carving session or the First Friday display. Just come in and say you want to help!

 

The competition will be judged on an anonymous entry basis from our super volunteer judges:

 

·      Muralist extraordinaire (RPSC board member) Dan Fontes

·      Arts Professional (Pro-Arts and RPSC board member) Katherine Canton-Titus

·      Non-Profit Arts Administrator (Redux Arts Residency, Saint Vincent de Paul) Chris Rummell

story:
Help the Communication Design students exhibit in London!

We are "New Blood"!

We are a group of students who study at Gray's School of Art in Aberdeen. We've spent the last 4 years working towards an honours degree, and in July we will be graduating and entering the working world. One of the best ways to advertise ourselves and get our name out there is to exhibit at the "New Blood" talent show organised by D&AD in London.

We need to raise money to cover the pricetag for exhibiting so we're eternally grateful for any donations you make to help us cover the cost of displaying and getting there! This exhibit could make our careers and help us get on the right track and get a foot in the door of "the real world".

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise £3000 to go towards the cost of exhibiting and showing our work at "New Blood". Any donations above this target will go towards funding the travel and transportation of work the length of the country!

Whether you donate £5 or £500 your donation will mean the world to us! We want to make donating worth your while, so we're offering a range of "perks" for people who donate, and you never know, if one of us becomes famous you could sell it for millions!

We are offering perks in the following formats...

1. A sound for a pound (personalised sound recording for your listening pleasure)
2. A jive for five [pounds] (personalised .GIF moving image file, for your viewing pleasure)
3. A zine for fifteen [pounds] (small magazine featuring our designs and illustrations made lovingly by us, which is obviously going to be a pleasure to have) 
4. or if you want to go wild you can collect all three and donate three times!

To see and hear the mp3s and gifs we've already made go here
www.thankyougifs.tumblr.com

The Com Des Massif

These are the lovely students you will be helping...

  • Alex Love
  • Anastasija Soldatenko
  • Anna Vahromejeva
  • Danielle Howe
  • Danielle McCann
  • Grant Anderson
  • Grant Sinclair
  • Jennifer Smith
  • Jessika Shaw
  • Kurt MacDonald
  • Laura Phimister
  • Lorna McCaffery
  • Marco Bevilacqua
  • Megan Wood
  • Michael Ridley
  • Rachel Dixon
  • Rachel Furness
  • Robyn Hasler
  • Stacey Geddes
  • Steven Bremner
  • Susannah Leake
  • Zee Allison
  • Zoe Statham

You can also find us on twitter @Grayscomdes

(Please note, when donating, funds are sent through paypal to Susannah Leake on behalf of the group)

story:
Alien Nation Carving New Pathways, New Futures:

Reality is not entirely what we are made to believe it is:  We can be the carvers of our own path, our own truth, our own vision.
You are a Genius: Our current society functions on the demeaning and devaluing of ourselves, each other and our environment. The truth is, we are all geniuses in our own right. We are all powerful beyond measure. 
Our Alienation is a Sign of our Collective Potential: The separation from our inner truths, the separation from our neighbours, our children, from our Earth have led us to operate from fear and tension. When we can pierce through such false illusions of division, we can make powerful micro- and macro-changes.
We Belong to the Earth and Cosmos: We are aliens who live on Earth, which is connected to the Cosmos. We are all interconnected.
Through the use of video, media and workshop facilitation, Alien Nation is a project  committed to the creation and sharing of new stories powered by science-fiction storytelling, to carve pathways to new futures for ourselves and generations to come.

In Love and Light:

My name is Sharrae Lyon and I'm the Creative Director. I am an afrofuturist, time-traveler, dream catcher, creator, lover. I am a spirit living a human existence. I am in flaw and in perfection. I believe in the powerful capacity of individual liberation not as an idea, but as an active force of resistance that can contribute to community change.  The elevation of one, must contribute to and inspire the elevation of all. Thus, I desire to follow the steps of my ancestors and predecessors of creating a future that breaks out of the confines of imposed existence.

I believe we are mirrors of each other.

I believe we are the shapers of our existence.

I believe we can change and alter the course of history and of the future.

I believe we are much more powerful than what they let us on to believe.

I believe in music and dance as an avenue of healing the spirit.

I believe in you and in us, as a community.

___

Creative and Professional Development:

I believe in the importance of creating content that inspires the light in others. I have been honoured and privileged to meet amazing people who have inspired me; artists, teachers, friends, family. With that being said, to create art that incorporates spirituality, critical political grounding that is infused with love, I decided to take Alien Nation into an artist-in-residency program with d'bi.young anitafrika at the Watah School through the inaugural Transdisciplinary Artist Program (TAP) in Toronto.  "TAP is geared towards artists who create cross-genre works of art or art that defy traditional categorization."

In the past year, Alien Nation has delivered workshops in Canada and the United States including Detroit's Allied Media Conference that utilized the concepts of alien-identity to search for answers of our personal potential. I desire to see Alien Nation mature into a creative vision that can continue to incorporate ancient and modern knowledges to facilitate healing of ourselves and of our ancestors through effective facilitation and creative content birthed with integrity and intention.

I feel so honoured and inspired by those I have met along the way in Alien Nation's journey. Below is a testimonial of one of my participants who shared how her participation in a workshop affected her:

"A true soul sister, a fellow believer in higher power, a mystic being rocking this human life on earth with beautiful intention. The work she does is unlike any. They energy she creates, emits and evokes is medicine from the depths of the universe. She is an alien empress spreading love, wisdom and magic, connecting ancient history to the present and the future and reminding us of our capacities as beings on this planet. Big big love and deep respect."

- Testimonial from Adabu (Participant in "(Re)Claiming our Alien/Nation Workshop", Detroit June 2014, Allied Media Conference)

GAIA

 "Gaia's Awakening" is the first instalment of a 10-part series entitled "GAIA," which will be the body of work that will be produced over the course of the next 8 months  at TAP.

I

Support by Giving Seed to Growth:

I am seeking to raise $3500 by November 1st to assist in covering tuition costs for the residency program at the Watah school. 

By donating you will be contributing to first stages of the gradual expansion to  produce GAIA, while assisting Alien Nation to solidify facilitation and community practice. 
GAIA will be showcased at the following festivals in Toronto:
Mikey Smith Raw Works Festival | December 16-20, 2014
Audre Lorde Works In Progress Festival | March 10-14, 2014
Word! Sound! Powah! International Black Arts Festival | June 22-28
Tax Receipts are Available: email donations@watah.org and let them know you donated to this campaign!

Below is a list of what will happen during the residency:  

  • Exclusive Year-Long Mentorship in the Sorplui Methodology (a methodology created and grounded in eight guiding principles: Self-knowledge, Orality, Rhythm, Political Content and Context, Language, Urgency, Sacredness and Integrity through the balancing of the practitioner's five bodies: the physical, emotional, mental, creative and spiritual. 
  • Weekly Collective Study sessions 8 hours in length facilitated by d'bi.young anitafrika
  • Opportunity to Study and Incorporate into artistic practice, mind-body healing modalities such as yoga and qi gong.
  • Development and Production towards 3 public workshops of performance works.
  • Professional Apprenticeship opportunities in community spaces
  • Grant-Writing Mentorship
  • Artist Package, Press kit and Website Development
  • Opportunity to Learn Production Management through mutually building production for all artists-in-residence
  • Tuition Free Access to all Watah School Workshops

What is the Watah School?


    Want to Support In Other Ways?

    Unable to contribute financially, but want to see Alien Nation come into fruition? 

    Emailing your networks and sharing on social media is a great way to support.  Share with your networks and tell others why you would support Alien Nation. 

    Work for an organization or group? 

    You can book a workshop that uses science fiction exploration to talk about race, identity and sexuality! Check the perks for more details!  Be free to email me at projectaliennation@gmail.com 

    Want to Find out More About Alien Nation?

    Check Alien Nation on Twitter, Facebook and Tumblr!

    Twitter: @Alien_Nation_

    Facebook: Alien Nation

    Tumblr: www.projectaliennation.tumblr.com
story_txt:
Alien Nation Carving New Pathways, New Futures:

Reality is not entirely what we are made to believe it is:  We can be the carvers of our own path, our own truth, our own vision.

You are a Genius: Our current society functions on the demeaning and devaluing of ourselves, each other and our environment. The truth is, we are all geniuses in our own right. We are all powerful beyond measure. 

Our Alienation is a Sign of our Collective Potential: The separation from our inner truths, the separation from our neighbours, our children, from our Earth have led us to operate from fear and tension. When we can pierce through such false illusions of division, we can make powerful micro- and macro-changes.

We Belong to the Earth and Cosmos: We are aliens who live on Earth, which is connected to the Cosmos. We are all interconnected.
Through the use of video, media and workshop facilitation, Alien Nation is a project  committed to the creation and sharing of new stories powered by science-fiction storytelling, to carve pathways to new futures for ourselves and generations to come.
In Love and Light:

My name is Sharrae Lyon and I'm the Creative Director. I am an afrofuturist, time-traveler, dream catcher, creator, lover. I am a spirit living a human existence. I am in flaw and in perfection. I believe in the powerful capacity of individual liberation not as an idea, but as an active force of resistance that can contribute to community change.  The elevation of one, must contribute to and inspire the elevation of all. Thus, I desire to follow the steps of my ancestors and predecessors of creating a future that breaks out of the confines of imposed existence.
I believe we are mirrors of each other.
I believe we are the shapers of our existence.
I believe we can change and alter the course of history and of the future.
I believe we are much more powerful than what they let us on to believe.
I believe in music and dance as an avenue of healing the spirit.
I believe in you and in us, as a community.

___
Creative and Professional Development:
I believe in the importance of creating content that inspires the light in others. I have been honoured and privileged to meet amazing people who have inspired me; artists, teachers, friends, family. With that being said, to create art that incorporates spirituality, critical political grounding that is infused with love, I decided to take Alien Nation into an artist-in-residency program with d'bi.young anitafrika at the Watah School through the inaugural Transdisciplinary Artist Program (TAP) in Toronto.  "TAP is geared towards artists who create cross-genre works of art or art that defy traditional categorization."

"A true soul sister, a fellow believer in higher power, a mystic being rocking this human life on earth with beautiful intention. The work she does is unlike any. They energy she creates, emits and evokes is medicine from the depths of the universe. Big big love and deep respect."

story:
Our Story

Corte Moronati Artist-inResidence program will allow artists to take time off from their daily routines and concentrate exclusively on making their art. The residency offers both a two week and a month long free live/work space for visual artists, writers, composers, and other creatives.

The money raised with this campaign will be used solely for launching the residency, making it FREE for artists to come!

Buying CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS for the renovation of the artist's working space in the attic of the residency's building.
Covering the first three months of the residency's lease and bills.

No individual compensation for labor is being paid through this project.


About me and my dream: Share this excitement with me and the upcoming resident artists!

My name is Giada Crispiels and I am an artist who for the last two years has been traveling in the US participating in a series of residency programs.
Through my personal experience I found that this special opportunity (being part of a residency program) gives artists the chance to see their work change and offers new perspectives on their art.
This the reason why I am thrilled to now to have the chance to offer other artists the same opportunity I have been given in recent years.

I invite you to be a part of this exciting project with me and the upcoming resident artists!

(View of the residency building of the residency and the B&B Le Castellane)

More about the location

The site of the residency will be in the 14th century, three story building that houses the B&B Le Castellane in Sirmione, Italy.

The first floor is part of the "Le Castellane" B&B complex and the second floor will host the residents. The attic floor will be a shared studio space, open 24/7 to the residents.

Sirmione is a comune in the province of Brescia, in Lombardy (Northern Italy). It is bounded by the comunes of Desenzano del Garda (Lombardy) and Peschiera del Garda in the province of Verona and the region of Veneto. It is a historical center located on the Sirmio peninsula that divides the lower part of Lake Garda.

The residency is situated in the scenic vineyards of this small town, a tourist destination known for its hot springs and beautiful landscape. The famous white wine Lugana is produced in the vineyards surrounding the residency. Garda Lake is where the delicious extra virgin olive oil is produced which is evidenced by the abundance of olive trees one encounters when exploring the surroundings.


Why your help is IMPORTANT:

I have the building! I have the contacts! Here's what I need to do now:

  • I need to raise $3000 for the RENOVATION of the STUDIO-WORK SPACE, which is situated in the attic of the residency building.
    (I need to install a new floor, update electrical wiring, and paint the studio)

  • I need help to make this opportunity FREE for the Artists. I truly believe that a residency program should be free, but the costs of managing such a program are unavoidably high. An artist each month will cost at least Euro 1000 (about $1300).
    I am hoping to raise $2800 to partially cover this costs. (the rest will be privately funded).

  • With an additional $300 I will have the chance to buy two basic bicycles to allow the residents the chance to take rides exploring the vineyards surrounding the residency and Lake Garda (which is just 5 minutes distance from the house by bike).

  • With the final $400 I will pay the internet bills for the first three months of the residency and cover the cost of a cell phone with a local SIM CARD for the residents.

PLEASE NOTE:

Even if I don’t reach the entire goal, the residency will still get any funding that has been pledged. However, this is a modest goal that I have set. Any and all additional funding will go directly into making the residency better equipped and more cost effective for future residents.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in my project but you can't contribute there are other ways you can help.

Help me by getting the word out and make some noise about this campaign!

Use the Indiegogo share tools to let your friends and family know about this exciting and very worthwhile project!

story:
La Pocha Nostra (LPN) invites donations from our international community of supporters to make our Fall Touring Season possible. Your generous support would do the following: 

Bring our radical pedagogy and our newest performance, Corpo Insurrecto to:

*The Queer Zagreb Festival, Croatia. September 30-October 5
*The City of Women Festival, Slovenia. October 6-10
and culminating in a multi-venue mega event in Mexico City. October 13-24


LPN endeavors to work with artists and various communities across the world through our specialized pedagogy, community building workshop environment, and radical performances.  Congruent with our political praxis, we will incorporate local artists in our performances furthering dialogue and fostering connections amongst different nationalities, gender persuasions, artistic mediums, and generations.  

Pocha Nostra members involved in this particular project are: Gómez-Peña, Sifuentes, Erica Mott, Saul Garcia-Lopez, Michele Ceballos, Dani Demilia, Emma Tramposch & Nayla Altamirano.



During these very difficult economic times, in which funding sources are growing less available and increasingly conservative, LPN needs your help to jumpstart our upcoming touring season.
 

With your help we will we be able to complete our rehearsal process and supplement the production budgets required to take our performance and workshops to three very exciting locations: Queer Zagreb (Croatia), the City of Women (Slovenia) and a Mexico City multi-venue mega-event.

We are passionate about returning to these Eastern European festivals because of their bold, radical and unapologetic feminist and queer curatorial stance.  We also are committed to returning to Mexico to continue to develop our relationships with three generations of Pocha Alumni. Building a consistent relationship with these locations can only fuel both our practice and the international dialogue that is badly needed during times of artistic and economic isolation.
 


Our new performance, Corpo Insurecto 3.0: the Robo Proletariat is a piece dealing with the pervasive cultural violence afflicting our communities. Both Mexico and Eastern Europe are charged locations regarding this very subject matter and therefore important stakeholders in this transnational conversation.


Your donation of whatever size, links you to an entire network of artists, theorists, activists and creative minded individuals across the world. Beyond investing in a one-off performance and/or workshop, Pocha’s pedagogical and performance practice provide a foundation for creation and support between artists and thinkers that continues to develop well after LPN’s departure.

 

Funds to work in transnational collaborations seem to be the hardest hit by recent funding cuts and this is truly at the heart of our work. This is why we are looking to our international cyber-community, those of you who we know and those who we hope to know, to invest in the work of La Pocha Nostra.


Thank you very much for considering our petition.

story:
Who Are We?

Whiskey G1ass Studios is a fresh innovative design and production company specializing in film/video/TV production, photography and multimedia design. We strive to push the boundaries in which media is utilized as an art form.


Whiskey G1ass Studios was founded by Antoine Young and Jaclyn Amor, two artists of different backgrounds with the same vision of using mainstream media disciplines to showcase their creativity.

Antoine Young is a multimedia digital artist specializing in graphic design, digital illustration and fine art photography. Antoine graduated at Parsons, the New School for design in New York City, with a degree in multimedia and graphic design. With his vast background in design engineering, audio production, acting and visual arts, Antoine has successfully applied his unique skill set to found the up and coming, innovative production and design company, Whiskey G1ass Studios.

Once an avid performer, Jaclyn Amor now spends her time on the other side of the curtain as a filmmaker, director and photographer with an eclectic background in all things visual and performing arts. After two-years at the New York Film Academy, Jaclyn finished her degree in cinema and media studies at the New School. Her work has been aired on national television in the U.S., Australia and the Philippines and most recently she directed the 33rd Asian American Intl. Film Festival (AAIFF) in NYC.


Interested?

We see ourselves as more than just your typical production company. We pride ourselves in being artists first, utilizing our knowledge of mainstream media in order to truly express our creativity. 


We feel that our work should be seen by more than just our facebook friends, youtube subscribers, tumblr followers and sporadic views from family and friends via pixelated images on the internet. We'd love nothing more than to approach a wider fine art and commercial audience by having our work blown up, printed and mounted, hanging on the walls of a fine establishment such as that of a gallery here in NYC. We feel that it would not only draw a new audience, it would make for an amazing and fun networking event for people in the art, media and entertainment industries or anyone looking to open up their network and socialize. We invite people of all backgrounds to come view our work, mingle, have a drink, who knows what could happen?

And if anything tickles your fancy, our artwork will be for sale.


And Here's the Pitch!

Whiskey G1ass Studios officially launches in March and what better way to make an entrance than holding the ultimate multimedia gallery exhibition event? This isn't your run of the mill museum visit. We're doing this through the Whiskey G1ass! We're looking at professional prints of different sizes of our best photography, illustration and design work, a projection of our films/videos, some light catering for you to munch on, beverages (alcoholic of course!) and live entertainment to keep the party going.

Clearly, this can't be done for nothing and that's where you come in. Our target budget is set for $7,000 USD, which may sound like a lot but it's really not. Here's a breakdown on where these dollars are going:

Prints: Printing costs are at an all time high, we need to consider paper type/weight, size and mounting or framing options for each print.

Space: We're lucky to have a few connections and contacts to reach out to but it's never guaranteed to get a space for little to no cost, especially in Manhattan. We are needing a gallery, exhibition or loft space to hold this event preferably in a known art district such as SoHo, Chelsea or Bowery/LES so we are prepared for there to be some kind of rental fee.

Catering: Again, we want to make a lasting impression and the best way to please people is with free food and drinks. To truly fill this event, catering is a must and will definitely keep our audience around to socialize.

Stuff: By stuff we mean other equipment or items we will have to rent for the exhibit. For example, we want to project video on the walls, so we need to hire a projector. We're going to have some live entertainment so any audio equipment needed for their set up plus chairs and tables for your comfort.

Art: We want our work to be seen so what better way than to sell it? Each print will be for sale and we will have some posters, t-shirts and postcards available, and if we have enough to do it, we would like to produce the first WGS book, filled with our best and favorite pieces. Perhaps there's a spot for it waiting on your coffee table?

We want to make you part of our journey as artists and media professionals. We need your support in order to make this happen and we're very serious in saying that every dollar makes a difference! If our entire goal is not met, we will still make moves to put on this event, though we may have to scrap a few things, either way, our team doesn't quit, we will make it happen regardless.

Any amount you could possibly throw our way is so greatly appreciated and of course you will receive a thank-you and ticket to our creative concoction.

Please view our perks available for those donating at different monetary levels.


Word of Mouth...

There's no better marketing technique than WOM or 'Word of Mouth' so get yours talking! There's no excuse not to spread the word with all those intrusive social networking sites. You can share our campaign on facebook, twitter, tumblr, blogs, email, linkd in, SMS, MMS, IM, youtube...tell your friends. Your friends of friends. Strangers on the street, your nosy neighbors, that guy at the bus stop on the corner, your long lost aunt Tina, family's good, basically, spread it like a virus! Sorry, we mean, virally!

Phone calls and speaking face to face works wonders too.

We are needing a gallery, exhibition or loft space to hold this event preferably in a known art district such as SoHo, Chelsea or Bowery/LES so we are prepared for there to be some kind of rental fee.Catering: Again, we want to make a lasting impression and the best way to please people is with free food and drinks. To truly fill this event, catering is a must and will definitely keep our audience around to socialize.Stuff: By stuff we mean other equipment or items we will have to rent for the exhibit. For example, we want to project video on the walls, so we need to hire a projector. We're going to have some live entertainment so any audio equipment needed for their set up plus chairs and tables for your comfort.Art: We want our work to be seen so what better way than to sell it? Each print will be for sale and we will have some posters, t-shirts and postcards available, and if we have enough to do it, we would like to produce the first WGS book, filled with our best and favorite pieces. Perhaps there's a spot for it waiting on your coffee table?We want to make you part of our journey as artists and media professionals. We need your support in order to make this happen and we're very serious in saying that every dollar makes a difference! If our entire goal is not met, we will still make moves to put on this event, though we may have to scrap a few things, either way, our team doesn't quit, we will make it happen regardless.Any amount you could possibly throw our way is so greatly appreciated and of course you will receive a thank-you and ticket to our creative concoction. Please view our perks available for those donating at different monetary levels.

Word of Mouth...

There's no better marketing technique than WOM or 'Word of Mouth' so get yours talking! There's no excuse not to spread the word with all those intrusive social networking sites. You can share our campaign on facebook, twitter, tumblr, blogs, email, linkd in, SMS, MMS, IM, youtube...tell your friends. Your friends of friends. Strangers on the street, your nosy neighbors, that guy at the bus stop on the corner, your long lost aunt Tina, family's good, basically, spread it like a virus! Sorry, we mean, virally! 
Phone calls and speaking face to face works wonders too.

story:
Hey!

My name is Britt and I am an artist living in Canberra, Australia.

I absolutely love making black and white mandalas and creations, equipped with just a compass and a handful of Sharpies. Taking influence from tattoo culture, Indian henna and a love of geometrical symmetry my pieces are designed to catch your eye.

My goal is to raise enough money so that I can do a tattoo course to learn the proper technique and safety requirements to start my own tattoo experiments.

Tattoos are one of my biggest obsessions and I gain so much influence from them that I really want to get involved and follow a dream.

 

The course I want to do goes through designs, stencils, equipment, safety, first aid, techniques, shading, portraiture - pretty much everything you can imagine and is $800.

Along with that I will need all the equipment and materials to practice which I've budgeted at $200.

Anything you can contribute is amazing and gets me just that little bit closer to exploring something that I've always had a insatiable passion for.

 

 

 "To sum up the work of BRT in words is nearly impossible. Fusing geometric patterns with ancient symbolism and pop culture, her work is utterly unique and revolutionary. Like all the great artists, each piece of work is something of a layered experience, the face, the structure and the feeling it gives. Henry David Thoreau once said “It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.” This has never been more evident than in these hypnotic designs

The detail and time BRT puts into her art (and all aspects of life) has seen her unique brand of art develop into something of a true visionary. Be it music, jewellery, fashion or multimedia, BRT is ever changing but always adaptive. Always pushing herself that one step further where the only downtime is incubation for another amazing piece just waiting to be set free.

I’ll be donating to this project because BRT is a true creative and that means that I’ll be funding not only a project but an exciting future. I’m excited to see more from BRT the tattoo artist and one day hope to be in a chair knowing my skin is in safe hands.
Keep on the lookout because she is destined to become the next big thing!"
Liam (the happy owner of a BRT original.) – Melbourne VIC
