story:
About the little movie you can watch above:

As part of her studies Social Sculpture, Melody has been creating small acts, together with other students or alone. These are born out of the practices around creative strategies and give the participants an experience. This small movie clip can be seen as a small act in itself, which can give you an experience. I invite you to stand still for a short moment after watching it, to see what is living in you.

The words and short sentences that Melody speaks will shed some light on the questions and themes that are living in her at the moment, as she is working with her studies. Although you will find a connection with what social sculpture is bringing Melody right now, in this moment, this short clip does not provide an explanation about this fundraising campaign. However, you can find all the information you will need to be able to support Melody's campaign in the written text below! I hope you will enjoy this experience!  

Warm wishes and thanks for visiting this page!
Ianthe


Hello! My name is Melody Brink. Thanks for taking an interest in supporting me! Please find more information about why I need your support down below, and have a look at the unique gifts you can get in return! A tip: many of them make great Christmas gifts as well! 

Why I need your support 

In the last years I have been on a journey with the intention to find my role in the world. This journey took me to Ecuador and Vermont, where I did two outdoor semester programs with Kroka Expeditions. Then I studied painting and anthroposophy in NY at Free Columbia. There I was introduced to the idea of human beings being capable of perceiving qualities in the world. I started to wonder about our current societies and how I could contribute bringing about world healing. To find my voice and continue my investigation of the imagination, I studied at the International School of Storytelling in , where I learned about the heart and craft of the storyteller. Since then, I have been telling stories, have been deepening my connection with nature through Geomancy, and have enrolled in a masters program at  to study Social Sculpture.


Social Sculpture is a phrase that was coined by the artist Joseph Beuys in the 1970’s. It is a field of study that works with inner imagination and how this can bring about outer transformation. ‘Social sculpture is concerned with exploring strategies, methods and principles that enable us to see, to understand and to act imaginatively to shape a humane and ecologically viable world. It emphasizes the role of imagination in transformative social process and the centrality of alternative modes of thought.’  I decided to join the masters program because I wanted to deepen all of the questions I already had started to ask, and to start to find creative forms that I could use to bring about world healing. The program started only some weeks ago, so I’m still learning a lot about the field. What I have experienced so far has been many invitations to explore my own inspirations and from there, to work with creative strategies to create ‘small acts’ that offer other people an experience.

                     


What I need & what you'll get

The tuition fee for the Social Sculpture study is £11,800 in total. Of that, I still need to pay £9,000. All of the funds that I raise here will go directly to Oxford Brookes University, to pay for my education. If you can help me cover the costs, I will be so grateful! I am still amazed that such a new and imaginative type of education such as Social Sculpture is able to be in the university system, and I’m very grateful that I will be able to have a masters degree at the end of my studies. I see the degree as a recognizable bridge to bring about world healing into our main stream society. If you feel inspired to read more about the program, follow this link: http://www.social-sculpture.org/category/graduate-study/

I have really enjoyed thinking about which gifts I could offer you in return for your support and I have noticed that this campaign is giving me the opportunity to engage in the work I really love doing in this world. In this sense it is a real blessing for me to be able to offer these gifts to you! 

I love poetry and stories! For your donation of £5 I will send you a collection of my favourite poems, which will hopefully inspire you too! 

Where I go, my journal goes. In it I write my dreams and thoughts, I draw in it, and often a poem gets born in there as well. For a donation of £10 I will make a special drawing and poem especially for you and make it into a postcard. The drawing will be on one side and the poem on the other. In this way I will share with you a small creation, which will bring us closer to each other! 

Although the Social Sculpture course is not a classical art course where we make a bunch of things, I do have access to some really wonderful workshops. One of them is the bookbinding workshop. For a donation of £25 I will make for you a hand made little book, which is perfect to record memories, thoughts or inspired poems! For £100 I will make you a bigger notebook, perfect as a journal, in which I can include some poetry and drawings if you would like that!  

Since a year now I have been inspired by wool, spinning and dyeing, and making beautiful things out of it. I now have two big bags of white and brown wool, that came from two sheep that I personally know. It is 100% organic wool, I have hand washed it with Marseille soap and water and it has dried in the sun. Now it is ready to be spun and made into socks and hats that will keep your feet and heads warm this winter! For £35 I will happily start spinning and knitting! I can even dye a part of it in a beautiful warm yellow color, that comes from onion peels. Let me know which color/colors you prefer! 

                         

Besides those unique pieces of art and craft, I also looked for sponsorship in my direct environment and found the generosity of both my parents, who are offering their skills: macrobiotic cooking and natural medicine. For a donation of £50 you get a cooking DVD and a macrobiotic cooking consultation with Linda and for £200 you will get an initial consultation with Stefan, doctor of Chinese medicine, acupuncturist  and macrobiotic dietary counsellor. Grab your chance! 

Also, one of my favorite poets and friends, Paul Matthews, has a beautiful book called "Sing me the Creation" which you can receive with a donation of £25. It's a book filled with exercises for creative writing and poetry. Definitely one that should be on every shelf! 

Further, I have included my own special gifts, which are connected with the work I am developing in this world. For a donation of £150 I will come with a storyteller friend to tell stories for you and your friends! This could be for adults, for children or for both. For £200 I will cook you a fully organic and seasonal three course meal for four people! For £300 I will host a full day Nature and Imagination session, and take you on a journey through inner and outer landscapes. Also for £400 I will come with a storyteller friend and  host a full day storytelling workshop for up to 12 people! We will explore the craft of storytelling and I will teach you the basic skills so you can spread this ancient art all over your communities! 

Are you feeling the need to go on a holiday? For donations of either £400 or £1000, you'll get to have a magical stay in two very different settings! 

For £400 you and one other person can stay two nights in aanaajaanaa B&B in Gent! Stay in a nineteenth-century house, with cavements of the Middle Ages, recently renovated with respect for existing elements and with natural materials. You will sleep in beds of highest international, ecological standards and you'll enjoy all contemporary comfort and a breakfast with organic and fairtrade ingredients. This B&B is located in the pedestrian-shopping-zone in the historical centre of Gent, Belgium. The street is the oldest street of the city! Although I heard Belgium being referred to as the highway of Europe, I also heard Gent being referred to as the best kept secret of Europe! With lots of heritage (castles, cathedrals, meat houses etc) original markets, many organic cafes, two beautiful rivers, a buzzing culture, cozy restaurants, shopping opportunities and many activities you will experience a delightful stay! We can only offer this stay in March and part of April 2014, during the week.

For £1000 we will give you a full week stay for one to four people in a villa in Nicaragua! Imagine yourself in a villa inside the crater of a volcano, on the edge of a beautiful lake, surrounded by jungle and abundant wildlife! You will find rare butterflies, flora and fauna that are protected by Nicaragua's Department of Natural Resources, and experience a safe, pristine and magical tropical haven! A perfect place to relax, refresh and be rejuvenated! This gift includes the stay in the villa. No travel, food or other costs are included.  


The impact and other ways you can help

Your help will give me the chance to continue and finish this master degree study in Social Sculpture. It will also support the work I love to do in this world and help me develop this further. My intention is to discover and create forms in which I can bring about world healing and social warming. I see this study as an essential part of my further journey in life and will be incredibly grateful if you can be a part of this by giving your support, whether it is in the physical form of money, or by spreading the word about this campaign!


Thank you very much! 

With love, warmth and gratitude,

Melody

story:
*UPDATE 7/28: NEW GOAL $12,000*
We are nearing the end of our campaign, and we're far short of our ambitious goal. The reality of our situation is that if we don't make at least $12,000, we will be in debt. We've cut bells and whistles to get our budget as small as we can for the playa this year, and we'll improve it over the course of the next year.

Can you help us stay out of debt and meet our revised goal by Thursday? 

****************************************************************

THE VULVATRON

The Vulvatron is an interactive, immersive mobile art environment that honors the female form using video projections, responsive LEDs, sound, and scent. Its compelling visual and interactive concepts enable a dynamic exchange of experiences between all participants. The environment responds, embraces, and transforms all who choose to interact.

DESCRIPTION

The Vulvatron consists of 3 main features: The Vulva & Clitoris, The Erogenous Zone, and Mobility.

  1. The Vulva and Clitoris
    The Vulva is two 18’ tall video projection screens made of 4-way stretch fabric. Live video artists will perform projection-mapped video and multi media sets. Participants can play with a Kinect motion and proximity sensor to affect the projections. The Vulva lips are lined with RGB addressable LED strips that process the live video. The Clitoris is a 36” diameter acrylic dome lined with super-bright LED lights, hanging at the peak of the Vulva screens. When participants touch pressure sensors located inside the Erogenous Zone, both the Clitoris and the Vulva light up in programmed responsive animations.


  2. The Erogenous Zone
    Get cozy in the EZ! This community connection space is an immersive, total sensory environment. Noises of natures hum and vibrate while soft female voices coo and murmur in the background. Gentle scents waft by from our custom-crafted aromatherapy essences. Settle into the velvety cushions and open your heart and mind to the present moment.

  3. The Mobility
    The Vulva & the Erogenous Zones are mounted on a 16’ trailer, which is towed by a costumed vehicle. This maximizes the Vulvatron’s ability to be experienced at a variety of events, either as a stationary installation or a wandering installation.

BUDGET

The Vulvatron is operating on a $30,800 budget total. 

  1. Materials: $8800 (includes metal, lumber, hardware, fabric, consumables)
  2. Interactive Media: $9000 (includes 2 projectors and protective sculptural casings, LEDs, sensors, generators, electrical components)
  3. Mobility: $8000 (includes trailer, tow vehicle & costume, insurance, fuel, and fees)
  4. Administrative: $5000 (includes rent for wood and metal shops, fiscal sponsor fees, event tickets, and crew care)

We have some startup capital from fundraisering events which has allowed us to buy the trailer, a portion of the metal and lumber, and the projectors. We still have close to $20,000 in anticipated expenses remaining.  

We hope to earn enough through contributed income that our project can pay to store the Vulvatron for a year, and offer compensation to the lead artists who have been donating their time. This last piece is a very important and dear one to our hearts as so many people give us months of their time entirely for free, an enormous sacrifice. 


PURPOSE

We aim to educate children, men, and women about women’s initiatives, the female anatomy, sexual and reproductive health, and inclusivity. We believe with education comes respect, which reduces violence and promotes healthy relationships.

In the same way a womb expands to shelter and protect developing offspring, the Vulvatron is radically inclusive of all gendered identities, making a welcoming refuge for traditional and non-traditional individuals of all shapes and sizes.

The Vulvatron is more than simply an artwork; it is a community of centered individuals who are exploring the personal and collective transformation that emerges while creating together. Equally a movement and a sculpture, the Vulvatron seeks to reach to not only Burning Man and festivals, but also high schools, health clinics, and political platforms.

We hope that the words, ideas, and experiences that pass in her presence will inspire participants to embody inclusion and respect within their social fabrics.

EVENTS AND APPEARANCES

The Vulvatron will make her maiden voyage at Burning Man 2014. Afterwards, we will seek opportunities to appear at women’s rallies, youth sexual education workshops, and other festivals.


THE ARTISTS: THE CLITTERATI

We are a group of women and men who have come together through large-scale community art projects in the Bay Area. The Clitterati has enlarged as we meet people who are passionate about helping other people make big impact through big art. Our values include collaboration, abundance, appreciation, and dialogue.

Our backgrounds run the gamut from engineers to fine artists to educators to wise and foolish students to fabricators and much more. These diverse backgrounds bring diverse experiences, ideas, and ways of thinking to the table. We have pooled our strengths to create something we believe all humans can relate to and appreciate. This is our first collaboration, though our individual team members have built numerous large scale community-based art installations for the public and other festivals. Read the team bios here!

Clockwise from Left: Meggie Pina, Rebecca Frisch, Geraldine Le Roux Matthews, Shing Kong, Kelly Toole, Tovah King, Lizzy Lynch, Becky Neil. Not Pictured: Jen Cohen, Julia Irwin, Courtney King, Emily Ward, Briana Schweizer, Margey Decuir, Marissa Comstock.   

We are so honored to have a strong community of men and women behind us who support an art installation that can facilitate dialogue. The Vulvatron was originally conceived by a group of women, and our contributors include men who are valued as friends, collaborators and supportive community members. Our male team members are Brandon Ancier, Eamon Armstrong, Azael Ferrer Gordo, Clifford Florio, Graham McLeod, Simon Petruc, Andrew Sano, Matt Stone and John Sunderberg.


HOW WILL YOUR CONTRIBUTION HELP?

Your contribution will directly enable us to put fire to metal, fabric to seats, code to technology, video projections to screen. We need to purchase the materials (technology is expensive!), pay rent on shop space, and fill up the gas tank with the fuel to get us to your events. We need this funding to get us the final leg of the way to the desert this year!


SUPPORT US...SUPPORT EVOLVER

10% of the funds raised through this campaign will go to support the The Evolver Network who fosters collaboration and brings awareness to people and projects working to restore our planet. 60 local chapters called Evolver Spores inspire activism and raise awareness around today’s most pressing issues such as permaculture, meditation, gift economies, nutrition, and visionary art. The Vulvatron is proud to support their efforts.


THANK YOU!

The Vulva and ClitorisThe Vulva is two 18’ tall video projection screens made of 4-way stretch fabric. Live video artists will perform projection-mapped video and multi media sets. Participants can play with a Kinect motion and proximity sensor to affect the projections. The Vulva lips are lined with RGB addressable LED strips that process the live video. The Clitoris is a 36” diameter acrylic dome lined with super-bright LED lights, hanging at the peak of the Vulva screens. When participants touch pressure sensors located inside the Erogenous Zone, both the Clitoris and the Vulva light up in programmed responsive animations.




The Erogenous ZoneGet cozy in the EZ! This community connection space is an immersive, total sensory environment. Noises of natures hum and vibrate while soft female voices coo and murmur in the background. Gentle scents waft by from our custom-crafted aromatherapy essences. Settle into the velvety cushions and open your heart and mind to the present moment.


The MobilityThe Vulva & the Erogenous Zones are mounted on a 16’ trailer, which is towed by a costumed vehicle. This maximizes the Vulvatron’s ability to be experienced at a variety of events, either as a stationary installation or a wandering installation.

BUDGETThe Vulvatron is operating on a $30,800 budget total. 
Materials: $8800 (includes metal, lumber, hardware, fabric, consumables)
Interactive Media: $9000 (includes 2 projectors and protective sculptural casings, LEDs, sensors, generators, electrical components)
Mobility: $8000 (includes trailer, tow vehicle & costume, insurance, fuel, and fees)
Administrative: $5000 (includes rent for wood and metal shops, fiscal sponsor fees, event tickets, and crew care)
We have some startup capital from fundraisering events which has allowed us to buy the trailer, a portion of the metal and lumber, and the projectors. We still have close to $20,000 in anticipated expenses remaining.  We hope to earn enough through contributed income that our project can pay to store the Vulvatron for a year, and offer compensation to the lead artists who have been donating their time. This last piece is a very important and dear one to our hearts as so many people give us months of their time entirely for free, an enormous sacrifice. PURPOSEWe aim to educate children, men, and women about women’s initiatives, the female anatomy, sexual and reproductive health, and inclusivity. We believe with education comes respect, which reduces violence and promotes healthy relationships.In the same way a womb expands to shelter and protect developing offspring, the Vulvatron is radically inclusive of all gendered identities, making a welcoming refuge for traditional and non-traditional individuals of all shapes and sizes.The Vulvatron is more than simply an artwork; it is a community of centered individuals who are exploring the personal and collective transformation that emerges while creating together. Equally a movement and a sculpture, the Vulvatron seeks to reach to not only Burning Man and festivals, but also high schools, health clinics, and political platforms.We hope that the words, ideas, and experiences that pass in her presence will inspire participants to embody inclusion and respect within their social fabrics.EVENTS AND APPEARANCESThe Vulvatron will make her maiden voyage at Burning Man 2014. Afterwards, we will seek opportunities to appear at women’s rallies, youth sexual education workshops, and other festivals.THE ARTISTS: THE CLITTERATIWe are a group of women and men who have come together through large-scale community art projects in the Bay Area. The Clitterati has enlarged as we meet people who are passionate about helping other people make big impact through big art. Our values include collaboration, abundance, appreciation, and dialogue.Our backgrounds run the gamut from engineers to fine artists to educators to wise and foolish students to fabricators and much more. These diverse backgrounds bring diverse experiences, ideas, and ways of thinking to the table. We have pooled our strengths to create something we believe all humans can relate to and appreciate. This is our first collaboration, though our individual team members have built numerous large scale community-based art installations for the public and other festivals. Read the team bios here!Clockwise from Left: Meggie Pina, Rebecca Frisch, Geraldine Le Roux Matthews, Shing Kong, Kelly Toole, Tovah King, Lizzy Lynch, Becky Neil. Not Pictured: Jen Cohen, Julia Irwin, Courtney King, Emily Ward, Briana Schweizer, Margey Decuir, Marissa Comstock.   We are so honored to have a strong community of men and women behind us who support an art installation that can facilitate dialogue. The Vulvatron was originally conceived by a group of women, and our contributors include men who are valued as friends, collaborators and supportive community members. Our male team members are Brandon Ancier, Eamon Armstrong, Azael Ferrer Gordo, Clifford Florio, Graham McLeod, Simon Petruc, Andrew Sano, Matt Stone and John Sunderberg.HOW WILL YOUR CONTRIBUTION HELP?Your contribution will directly enable us to put fire to metal, fabric to seats, code to technology, video projections to screen. We need to purchase the materials (technology is expensive!), pay rent on shop space, and fill up the gas tank with the fuel to get us to your events. We need this funding to get us the final leg of the way to the desert this year!SUPPORT US...SUPPORT EVOLVER10% of the funds raised through this campaign will go to support the The Evolver Network who fosters collaboration and brings awareness to people and projects working to restore our planet. 60 local chapters called Evolver Spores inspire activism and raise awareness around today’s most pressing issues such as permaculture, meditation, gift economies, nutrition, and visionary art. The Vulvatron is proud to support their efforts.THANK YOU!

story:
PITCHTREE, PEACHTREE, NICKEL BOTTOM, TOO

Peachtree Creek has been a major element of Atlanta's natural, social, cultural, and political histories and development. The exhibition - Pitchtree, Peachtree, Nickel Bottom, too - explores Peachtree Creek and its surroundings. As a site-specific project, Pitchtree, Peachtree, Nickel Bottom, too digs into (at times quite literally) the layers that make up the Creek, specifically the Zonolite District where {Poem 88}, the hosting gallery, is located. The Muscogee lived along Peachtree Creek, and Standing Peachtree was a hub village just up the creek from where Zonolite district is now. The name of the community garden at Zonolite Park is named Nickel Bottom, rumored to have been named by a community of freed men and women. Not to mention the pivotal Battle of Peachtree Creek. Later, the district was turned into an industrial complex that produced asbestos. Now, the community is working to clean up the environmental damage and produce a new community. 

The plan is to use {Poem 88} as a studio for research and production, gallery, and event space, so throughout the month there will be public programming including presentations, performances, and workshops to engage the community in the work and the landscape. And, since I'll be using the gallery as a studio, I'll be producing a lot of the work in house! FUN! I'm inviting the community to participate in this process-based research project alongside me! Since Pitchtree, Peachtree, Nickel Bottom, too is interested in illuminating the various communities and infrastructures that have inhabited the area through time, it is only right to invite those that are there now to join me! You can participate in so many ways! (BE SURE TO CHECK OUT THE PERKS FOR SOME SPECIFICS OF THAT!)

The exhibition will constantly transform throughout the month. I will be gathering and collecting samples, data, archival materials, photographs, video, and audio recordings, and display or present them in some way in the gallery. Culminating projects will be a cassette tape & zine/book. The tape will feature field recordings, live sessions, and compositions made during the course of the exhibition. The zine/book will feature writings, images, and archival information produced and gathered during the exhibition. The aim of the tape & zine/book is for the project to live another life beyond the weeks it lived within the gallery walls. 

Now, a bit about me: I'm Meredith Kooi - a visual and performance artist, curator, critic, educator, and major supporter of the Atlanta arts community. Even though I've been a practicing artist for almost a decade, and have supported many artists in ATL & beyond, it's been hard securing the resources needed to produce my OWN work. BUT, I'm finally going to be having my first solo exhibition THIS SUMMER at {Poem 88}! (July 9 - August 6)

Most of my recent projects have been site-responsive installations and performances that use radio broadcast as a way to explore the particular place. These projects include (RIP) Van Winkle on Air, which was installed at The Goat Farm Arts Center and tettix chorus for the unmarked at Historic Oakland Cemetery, among others. Other performance and visual work has been presented throughout Atlanta at venues such as Kibbee Gallery, Chastain Arts Center, MINT Gallery, Mammal Gallery, Eyedrum, and a performance at the High for a College Night. The group shows that I've curated as ALTERED MEANS have been presented at Mammal Gallery and Murmur, and included public programming and publications.

I am currently an artist-in-residence with The Creatives Project, have a forthcoming residency at Wave Farm (Acra, NY), and have completed residencies at Hambidge Center (Rabun Gap, GA), Elsewhere (Greensboro, NC), and betterArts (Redwood, NY). 


TESTIMONIALS & PREVIOUS WORKS

"Every one of Meredith Kooi's performances, art installations, or curatorial projects I've ever been to has been thoughtful, well-developed, and engaging. She explores challenging and complex ideas and then makes them seem intuitive. " ~ Chelsea Dunn, Director of Ladyfest ATL, member of experimental band Dux

"Kooi thrives in communicating her ideas and concepts. She's an excellent conversationalist and psychic medium. Her artistic integrity stems from a deep understanding of human kind and its relation to outerspace, unicorns, and spirits. She hears and sees things you don't. Watch out for this one! ~ Alice Kim, musician

“Meredith is like a reptile. She remains positioned for a period of time without reveal. When she acts there is an immediacy. I found this especially ingnited through the flood of laughter in her. She is at that moment your childhood friend. Kooi is part scientist, part kanoodler. She dissects rhythms in order to offer you another glimpse at reason. The methods are just as much for her process as those around her.” ~ Kirstin Mitchell (sometimes aka Kiki Blood), performance artist

“Meredith Kooi is the (former) owner of 85% of Atlanta's stolen radios. She really needs your cash for new ones.” ~ Robby Kee, Eyedrum music & sound curator, experimental musician

tettix chorus for the unmarked (2015), radio-based installation installed for The Cryptophonic Tour at Historic Oakland Cemetery. The work responded to the site of Potters' Field in the cemetery, which hold 7500 unmarked graves.

radio books (2014), radio-based installation, map, and zine presented by Eyedrum and installed for art|DBF. 

untitled (khora study #1) (2014), performance, video, and radio-based installation made while in residence at Hambidge Center. 

Installation shot of i don't mean rhinestones (khora study #4) (2015) produced and installed for Sur(real)scapes, group exhibition for Emerging Artist Award recipients.

Text installed in i don't mean rhinestones (khora study #4) (2015)

What I Need & WHAT YOU GET

The funding goes right into the production and presentation of the work. This will include:

PUBLIC PROGRAMMING

  • Honoraria for guest artists & speakers
  • Equipment rentals - for example, PA system
  • PR: postcards, posters, ads

MATERIALS & PRODUCTION

  • Photography printing
  • Zine / Book printing & assembly
  • Cassette Tape recording & printing
  • Materials for drawings
  • Materials for sculptural projects
  • Equipment / tech 


THE PERKS

THE PERKS ARE TOTALLY TUBULAR.
As a THANK YOU for supporting me and my work, I will send you some of it!

  • PEACHTREE HEADWATERS: For $25, you'll get a limited edition cassette tape, digital download, and listed as a sponsor. 
  • OLD DECATUR WATERWORKS: For $50, you’ll get a limited edition cassette tape, digital download, zine/book, and listed as a sponsor.
  • STANDING PITCHTREE VILLAGE: For $75, you’ll get both the cassette and the zine/book, digital download, listed as a sponsor, and I invite you into the gallery-studio for a live recording session! 
  • LULLWATER PARK: For $150, you’ll receive the cassette and zine/book, digital download, AND an editioned print! You'll also be listed as a sponsor and invited to a special preview party...
  • BATTLE OF PEACHTREE CREEK: For $250, you'll get what $150 gets + the AFTER PARTY!
  • ZONOLITE COMPLETE: For $500, you'll enjoy all of the $250 level's perks + studio session + editioned print!

THE IMPACT

I believe this project is important in, at least, a few ways:

  • HISTORICALLY: ATL has a complex history that is worth exploring and bringing to a larger national and international audience. My hope is that the exhibition starts something that can continue into the future in multiple forms. The tape & digital download can be listened to by others. The zine can be picked up, handled, and read at a future date. A web archive provides easy access for those far away.
  • ART HISTORICALLY: Art of the American Southeast has been marked by conversations of regionalism and place - I aim to bring these ideologies into play and question the relationships we create between the landscape, people, animals, plants, aesthetic choices, and audience. I think that continuing to develop site-specific installation and performance projects in ATL pushes and transgresses disciplinary boundaries -- important challenges. 
  • CULTURALLY: One of the main goals of the project is to bring to light the various communities that have inhabited the area and keep them in mind in the many important conversations the city is having about present and future development. With ATL's burgeoning development, projects like this can help cultivate responsibility & accountability to place.
  • YOU!: For a while now I've been supporting other artists' work, so if you support me, you'll be me to me! 

PREVIOUS SUCCESSES, or, why you should trust me...

As a curator and organizer for ALTERED MEANS and Radius, I have successfully attained funding for projects. As ALTERED MEANS, I raised money for the exhibition I curated EXTREME WEATHER that was at Murmur in December 2015 – this led to a successful exhibition that was positively reviewed, multiple public programs, and the completion of the print publication. With Radius, I helped us obtain a Propeller Fund grant, a re-granting agency of the Andy Warhol Foundation, in order to commission artists to produce work for our series GRIDS and also publish a booklet documenting the year-long series.

IF YA CAN'T FORK IT OVER, HERE ARE THE OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

If donating isn't possible, reach out to someone that might be able to! Come to the performances! Buy a tape or zine when they're completed and in the gallery! Share this with your people!

story:
LAMusArt Young Professionals Advisory Board Fundraising Page

Young professionals striving together to make a difference in the lives of under served youth in East Los Angeles through music and art. 

What is LAMusArt?

Los Angeles Music and Art School (LAMusArt) was founded in 1945 to offer after-school arts programs to the underserved youth of East LA.  It will continue to be a haven of arts education for East Los Angeles and the surrounding community. We recently celebrated 70 years and look forward to many more years of service with the generous donations from the community.

Who are we? Young Professional Advisory Board

We are a team of young professionals who have set out on a mission to raise funds and awareness for LAMusArt through our young adult network. We are all passionate about the music and arts whether it means our hobby is singing in the shower or spending our weekends practicing Beethoven. 

The Impact

100% of the donations we receive will help play a vital role in the courses offered at LAMusArt such as visual arts, music, drama, dance, audio recording, and most recently the return of the choir program. The LAMusArt choir was recently reinstated this past September after being dissolved in prior years due to a lack of funding. The choir is a unique asset to the organization as it serves to showcase the great work being done by LAMusArt – check out this awesome recording made by former members of the choir: LAMusArt Students Perform "Brave".

70 Years
Since 1945, over 100,000 students have experienced our after-school arts programs.  This fiscal year, over 600 unduplicated students benefitted from our sequential programs.

4 Arts Disciplines
LAMusArt offers sequential weekly private music lessons and small group lessons in visual arts, dance and drama.

4 Tuition-Free Programs
AMusArt is proud to provide additional music instruction to student members of the LAMusArt Choir, Youth and Junior Orchestras and the String Outreach Partnership Program with KIPP-LA Raices.

Teaching Artists
Our students’ lessons are led by a team of dedicated teaching artists who are current practicing and/or experienced artists in their respective disciplines.

48% Subsidized Enrollment Rate
Every student participant receives a 48% subsidized tuition rate upon enrollment. This equates to an average annual savings of $518 per student and an average lesson fee, for tuition-based programs, of $18.

421 Student Scholarship Recipients
A grand total of $13,372 was awarded in student scholarships this year, in addition to our subsidized and tuition-free arts programs.

24,198 Arts Lessons Provided
during our 2014 -2015 fiscal year across all our programs.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate, there are other ways you can support us!

  • Ask your friends and family to donate even if it's just $5 every little bit counts
  • Share this Indiegogo on your social media via Facebook, Instragram & Twitter
  • Retweet us! Insta us! Like us on Facebook! #LAMusArt
  • Please, keep in mind this is an excellent tax write-off when reaching out to your social network.




    FACEBOOK LINK: https://www.facebook.com/LAMusArt

story:
In a 50-minute Contemporary Dance Installation I will develop through movement and the use of sculpture 7 different people’s personal interpretations of the transience of modern life and the dichotomy between the whole being and the extracted being. 

I am a contemporary dance based artist living in Reggio Emilia Italy originally from New York. I work as a Teacher and Artist in English and Italian.  I have been creating artwork for several years making installation, film, and choreography for the stage in Chile, Italy, Montreal, Austria, and  New York. It is of great pleasure to me to present this new work in the Widow Jane Mine in Rosendale, where I grew up going to see performances and Poets read as a child. 

Historically the Mine was where people extracted materials in order to build something new, taking from nature to build a man made structure such as the Brooklyn Bridge. People also undergo similar extracting and rebuilding inside their bodies and minds, known as our vessel or container for which we carry our life experiences. As people evolve, continuing to extract and rebuild thoughts and physical appearances, they accept the changes in their habits and routine.  This transience that coincides with adaptation, implement our conversations, thoughts, interactions and quality of movements.


What we need...

This campaign is to help raise 2500$ which will provide funding for...

*20 hours rental of rehearsal space to build the improvisation tasks being used in the performance both in NYC and in Rosendale.

*84 rolls of Gesso Gauze (12 per body) to build the seven casted bodies that will be used in the performance.

*4 square meters of wire fencing for the structure inside the fully casted gesso bodies.

*LED battery operated lights to light inside each section of the cave, enough lighting to cover 600 square meters with minimal light.

*Cost of Live Musicians.

*Stipend for the dancers, writer, and production manager.

What you will receive...

We are offering various gifts as a thanks for your particular contributions ranging from small handmade thank you cards, with a photo or drawing from the creation process, to a piece of the artwork used in the performance or a printed photograph 8x10 taken during the process.  

Other Ways you can help...

* Pass this along to a friend or a family member that would be interested in supporting  this event, or who live in the area and would like to see the performance. 


"I hope that Yolanda DID will stimulate people to engage inside the space of the mine and the human body itself with curiosity. "
story_txt:
In a 50-minute Contemporary Dance Installation I will develop through movement and the use of sculpture 7 different people’s personal interpretations of the transience of modern life and the dichotomy between the whole being and the extracted being. 
I am a contemporary dance based artist living in Reggio Emilia Italy originally from New York. I work as a Teacher and Artist in English and Italian.  I have been creating artwork for several years making installation, film, and choreography for the stage in Chile, Italy, Montreal, Austria, and  New York. It is of great pleasure to me to present this new work in the Widow Jane Mine in Rosendale, where I grew up going to see performances and Poets read as a child. 
Historically the Mine was where people extracted materials in order to build something new, taking from nature to build a man made structure such as the Brooklyn Bridge. People also undergo similar extracting and rebuilding inside their bodies and minds, known as our vessel or container for which we carry our life experiences. As people evolve, continuing to extract and rebuild thoughts and physical appearances, they accept the changes in their habits and routine.  This transience that coincides with adaptation, implement our conversations, thoughts, interactions and quality of movements.

What we need...


This campaign is to help raise 2500$ which will provide funding for...
*20 hours rental of rehearsal space to build the improvisation tasks being used in the performance both in NYC and in Rosendale.
*84 rolls of Gesso Gauze (12 per body) to build the seven casted bodies that will be used in the performance.
*4 square meters of wire fencing for the structure inside the fully casted gesso bodies.
*LED battery operated lights to light inside each section of the cave, enough lighting to cover 600 square meters with minimal light.
*Cost of Live Musicians.
*Stipend for the dancers, writer, and production manager.
What you will receive...We are offering various gifts as a thanks for your particular contributions ranging from small handmade thank you cards, with a photo or drawing from the creation process, to a piece of the artwork used in the performance or a printed photograph 8x10 taken during the process.  Other Ways you can help...* Pass this along to a friend or a family member that would be interested in supporting  this event, or who live in the area and would like to see the performance. "I hope that Yolanda DID will stimulate people to engage inside the space of the mine and the human body itself with curiosity. "

story:
Corey Taylor, a Virginia resident, husband, father, and a 22-year Air Force veteran, is a self-published comic book author and artist. He is currently working on the third issue of his own comic book series titled “Kopy Kat and the Bomb Squad”.  As a result of his nation’s current state of racial divide and social injustice, Corey felt the need to put his personal projects on hold, and use his artistic platform to be a catalyst for change and unity. He has spearheaded the “Artists Unite” project in hopes of doing just that. The anthology features artwork and poetry inspired by the need for change, desire for unity, and the Black Lives Matter Movement, with contributors from around the globe. All proceeds from this project will be donated to charities supporting the Black  Lives Matter movement.  

70+ Artists and Poets from around the globe have contributed to this amazing project!

All proceeds from the sale of this book are going to be donated to the Black Lives Matter charity/organization.  

 

The Journey to complete this project

Working on this project has been an amazing experience! I am so proud of the art community on Instagram and Facebook! I have met so many amazing artists and writers, and have truly been blessed by this experience. I have received nothing but love and support from so many wonderful people from around the world.  All I had to do is ask, and they stepped up to the plate and made this project happen. I am so proud of all of the people that supported and inspired me to make the "Artists Unite Project" a success. 
 

Artists Unite Book

This 60-page "full color" art-book has already been completed and sent to production on 08 July 2020. The initial "proof" copies have been received on 17 July 2020. After the 30 day crowdfunding campaign is complete, a thank you page will be added to the book, and all orders will be mailed out mid-August 2020. No later than 01 September 2020.  

The Perks!

  1.  $3  DONATION:   $3 will be donated to the Black Lives Matter organization, and your name will be added to the "Thank you page" in the printed art book.
     
  2. $10 DIGITAL DOWNLOAD OF THE BOOK:  You will receive a "digital download" copy of the book. Available as soon as the campaign ends. Your name added to the "Thank you page" in the book. $10 will be donated to the BLM charity/organization. 
     
  3. $15 SOFTCOVER COPY OF THE BOOK:  You will receive the 60-page Softcover book mailed to you in a rigid photo mailer envelope. Your name added to the "Thank you page" in the book. $10 will be donated to the BLM charity/organization. 
     
  4. $25 HARDCOVER COPY OF THE BOOK: You will receive the 60-page hardcover edition of the book mailed to you in a  rigid photo mailer envelope. Your name added to the "Thank you page" in the book. $10 will be donated to the BLM charity/organization. 
     
  5. $40 EVERYTHING: You will receive all of the perks! You will receive the digital download of the book, the softcover copy of the book, and the hardcover edition.  Your name added to the "thank you page" in the book. $20 will be donated to the BLM charity/organization.

Risks & Challenges

There is a very low risk involved in this project. I have already received the artwork and poetry from the artists involved in this project. The design of the book has already been completed. The initial "proof" copies have already been received from the printer. The book will be printed and mailed out within two weeks of the end of the campaign. The donation to Black Lives matter will be made after all books are printed and mailed out to the supporters.

 

Thank you to all of the Artists and Writers who contributed to this project!

story:
So, who the heck am I?

  My name is Karl and I'm a tech. enthusiast and wannabe social entrepreneur! 

I thought I'd reached a point in my life where everything was sorted.  I had a good job that I loved, which paid well AND came with a charming three bed cottage, I had a happy wife and two lovely children.  And then I broke my foot and it was goodbye job AND house and it was hello unemployment, temporary housing, relationship problems and upset kids!  

So why should you care?

Well it's at the start of my time out of work that I had an idea!! A vision of a makerspace/hackspace and micro start-up spaces for other businesses, a well-equipped social workshop where anyone can come along and use the equipment and space as well as be sociable if they want.
It is something I have dreamed of for a long time, I've always worked in a technical background, always in 'hands-on' roles centred around engineering and I've always been a maker, hacker and technology enthusiast and I just love to share knowledge and ideas!
 I'm one of the founding members of this incarnation of the Norwich Hackspace community, the reawakened interest in starting the Norwich hackspace movement is almost a direct result of my desire to start the makerspace!

What's the big fuss about laser cutting and 3d printing?

I'll let these videos do the explaining!
http://youtu.be/9qF8dHQPy6o Laser cutting.
http://youtu.be/ddtJVww8Zvw 3D Printing.
  Pretty awesome huh?

What would we like from you?

Money!  Old tech! New tech! Tools! Did I mention money?  What do we need money for?  Well, I'm starting this project with baby steps and what I wish to raise is £5000.  This breaks down into: £ 1,180.56 for the deposit on a Trotec speedy 300 100 watt laser cutter, £1000-£1500 on one or possibly two 3d printers (as these are changing all the time if haven't made a firm decision of which one yet) and the rest for a deposit and advance rental on a suitable business premises in Norwich city as well as sundry costs for stuff like stationery and advertising.  
Hang on, what about that other stuff I mentioned?  Well, anything else that gets donated will be passed on to the Norwich hackspace OR kept until the makerspace is ready to make use of it, so long as we have space to store it.

What's in it for you?

In a nut shell, affordable access to 3D printing and laser cutting!  Our perks will be centred around using our services in 3D printing and laser cutting for a certain length of time, whether visiting in person or having your projects sent to you by post.  If this isn't required or isn't suitable for you then I will be sorting out key rings and tee shirts AND everybody who contributes will be mentioned in a role of honour (unless they wish to remain anonymous)!  If the campaign is unsuccessful any funds raised will be passed on to the Norwich hackspace group, to purchase stuff to enable them to hold workshops etc.  If successful, it will get at least one more person off benefits and back contributing to the economy!

The Impact!

http://www.popsci.com/article/diy/how-one-man-h...
Ok, my position is nowhere near as desperate as the gentleman's in the video but starting this movement will help to return some control of my life to me, help to reduce the worry of being dismissed  or made redundant, give me pride in the fact that I've taken action to start to sort out my own life and also give me the chance to do something for other people!  It will provide access to technology in Norwich and area that is currently non-existent but has great potential once it is available to the wider public. It will work like a printing bureau where people can bring their projects. The intention is, once the business is up and running and bringing in revenue, to acquire further tools and machinery for people to come along and use, tools such as C.N.C. lathes, mills and routers.  In addition to this I would like to begin to provide low cost workshop space for small businesses for whom spaces such as artists studios or office spaces are just not suitable.

How can it possibly fail? Right? Right?

Well, if people like NASA and Phones 4U can get it wrong then pretty much anyone can!  That being said I will be taking every precaution to ensure the success of the business. I have already completed a 'get started in business' course that teaches about business types, how to measure cash flow and do book keeping etc.  which I think every new business starter should do!  The overheads of the business should be manageable so probably the greatest challenge to the business will be attracting customers!  To help to overcome this challenge I have been forging links with Norwich's tech community, both through the hackerspace movement and through the Hot Source and Sync Norwich's Meetup groups.  Incidentally, if you are interested in Norwich Hackspace the best way of getting in touch is via the Norwich Hackspace Meetup group!

And if I can't/don't want to give any money but still want to help?

 Easy Peasy!  Just share the heck out of this campaign!  The more people that see it, the more people who could possibly contribute!  So share this everywhere you possibly can, online, offline, tell everyone who'll listen!

I have already completed a 'get started in business' course that teaches about business types, how to measure cash flow and do book keeping etc.  which I think every new business starter should do!  The overheads of the business should be manageable so probably the greatest challenge to the business will be attracting customers!  To help to overcome this challenge I have been forging links with Norwich's tech community, both through the hackerspace movement and through the Hot Source and Sync Norwich's Meetup groups.  Incidentally, if you are interested in Norwich Hackspace the best way of getting in touch is via the Norwich Hackspace Meetup group! And if I can't/don't want to give any money but still want to help?
 Easy Peasy!  Just share the heck out of this campaign!  The more people that see it, the more people who could possibly contribute!  So share this everywhere you possibly can, online, offline, tell everyone who'll listen!

story:
Short Summary

The Pink Ninja Wheels were the first official Art Car of Bedouin Tech Festival. It was also the first car to arrive at this years event and the last one to leave. It was build up with nearly 5.000 LED lights, a spinning disco ball, laser lights on the roof, spot lights and The Pink Ninja Wheels flag. It brought light, smiles and happiness to people at Bedouin Tech 2015, especially when we were struck with power issues from the camp. The Ninja Wheels kept showing us light in the darkness of the Dubai Desert. We are planning to create a miniature version of this art piece, a radio controlled 1/10 size of the car and bring it to Burning Man 2015, to tell and share the story of our beautiful Bedouin Tech event. Also, we are planning to mount both speakers and a camera in the car to share our tunes and document its adventures on The Playa :) :) :)

What We Need & What You Get

  • This minor project wont cost a lot, but to break it up then the RC car alone is 400USD + expenses for lights and electronics and not least transportation to Nevada desert from Dubai.
  • We promise that if we hit the numbers, the mini discoball we will put in the RC Pink Ninja Wheels will be spinning !!!!! 
  • If we don't hit numbers, this project will still survive, since I will have to pay full amount my self :)

The Impact

  • Bedouin Tech lives because of creativity, participation and love. But also, Bedouin Tech lives because of a behind the scenes, hardcore marketing strategy to find the right people that would contribute to the project.
  • This project would represent our Middle East based community among 80.000 Thousand beautiful people 10.000 miles away. And represent and tell stories of our adventures. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you rather than donating money wanna contribute by helping building this Mini Art Car, then your more than welcome to contact me directly. All help would be highly appriciated :)

story:
Hello friend and welcome to my latest art project.
Things are a little strange here on Planet 9 and if you haven't visited here before you might be a little wary but fear not, the creatures here are quite harmless.
So what's the deal? I have been busy sketching my latest creations inside a note pad and with help from you I can turn these drawings in to a half presentable 10x17cm art book which people will be able to enjoy, physically hold and keep forever. (All following images are included in the book and should give you some idea of what you can expect)

All my drawings start the old fashioned way with me sketching them by pencil before I go over them in pen and then transfer them to the computer (21st century hello!) where I make them look somewhat presentable. 
My style of art is very inspired by dark comedy and strange creations. Yes, I am a big fan of Tim Burtons art and that sort of stuff is right up my street.

I work a regular job just like most other people but these creations are where my real passions lay. It's very difficult to get your art recognised when the market is so overcrowded (its not hard to pick up a pen) and although I do it out of love, without an audience to enjoy them they don't really mean as much. I do appreciate each backer very much as they take me one step closer to being able to keep on doing what I love and hopefully they'll love what I create in return.
All the funds I raise go towards printing and distribution costs and I've tried to keep costs as low as I can. 

Backers who decide to fund the project can either chose between a virtual or physical copy of the book along with some other perks such as handwritten letters and illustrations. 

And after all who wouldn't love getting a Little Book of Horrors in the post?

story:
Welcome to the Adventure!

I am Coral Mallow, Artist, Educator, Collaborator, and Storyteller. I am currently an MFA candidate in the Art, Space, and Nature program at the University of Edinburgh. I need your help this summer to take advantage of research opportunities, artistic collaborations, and work my very first Artist Residency!


This summer I have been privileged to be the recipient of many opportunities to forward my career as a working artist as well as bolster my portfolio of works. The funds raised will allow me to purchase necessary art supplies, equipment, and cover some of the basics (train fare, bus fare, hostel stays) and perhaps a few luxuries of travel. You want me to have cheese and chocolate. It is known that these things fuel good art.

By the end of the summer I will achieved the following:

  • Research into a variety of approaches on how to build and focus my work for my Thesis show! This is a huge undertaking that will shape my academics for the next year culminating in my final degree show in May 2016. This is exciting, yet incredibly nerve wracking.
  • The culmination of three years collaboration with 4Elements Theatre with a full month artist residency during this August in Dublin, Ireland! This is my first official artist residency and therefor is extremely important! The work being produced here will focus on the institutionalization of the Irish maternity experience.
  • The tangible non residency artworks will include a body of ropework photo imagery, several 2D works, three PDF Books, and two completed art books.  
  • The intangible will include vocal recordings, and Kink and GLBTQIA oral history recordings. A selection of these last will be being presented at the Scottish Oral History Conference in November. It is an incredibly important step for me as a person and a Storyteller as I present some of the pieces of American, Irish, and Scottish Kink cultures for an academic vanilla audience. I am so deeply moved and honored to have been invited to share these stories as a history worth preserving.

All of this will be happening as I simultaneously continue to build my website, social media network, and eventually create a podcast.

It is the very definition of a working holiday and I am going to work it like mad!

 My Needs, and Your Incentives!

What do I need to make a success of this endeavor?

WISHLIST 

  • A camera and a travel tripod. I am looking into Sony, Panasonic, and Canon. For the quality I need this will run me about $400.00
  • A USB condenser microphone, headphones and pop filter. I am currently looking at the Blue Yeti line. These three pieces of equipment cost around $175.00 
  • The rest of the $1425.00 is not as easily broken down. I need help with travel expenses such as flights (around $250.00 with baggage charges), bus fare, food, hostel stays, art supplies as needed, and unexpected opportunities!

[The funds raised will be used in that order, camera, microphone, expenses, and if all of that is covered, then I will use the money to pay some digital professionals to help make everything that next step of excellent and after that save the rest towards creating new work. This is the plan even if the entire amount is not achieved. The funds raised also help me cover the cost of creating and shipping these fabulous perks! What perks? I'm glad you asked! ]

Every person who contributes $5.00 or more:

will receive a weekly email newsletter with exclusive pictures and story content not shared on either my blog or social media sites (until January next year, see perk description). 

An invitation to a special Facebook group made up solely of supporters of this endeavor.People on this group can discuss the newsletter content and occasionally I will ask for help in decision making. It is a way to help continue to be a part of and shape this journey I am on thanks to your support.

Fun mail for a $20.00 donation! Two options!

A funky Scottish Art Zine! or

Two Artist Trading Cards handmade of course by yours truly.

 For a $25.00 donation you have three options! 

Your choice of one of the following.

The Tension Project, a PDF Book (June delivery)

Rope Along the Road, a PDF Book (December delivery)

An amazing postcard collection! (As I go from country to country!)

$50.00 to Sponsor art for the 6X6 Project!

One of the next projects I will be working on for the 2016/2017 year will be called the 6 X 6 Project. At it's completion it will feature 36 sponsored works of art in the dimensions of 6 inches by 6 inches. 

Each Patron will receive the original piece that they inspire and a copy of the completed PDF book upon completion of the project. 

(November for piece and December for book delivery)

$100.00 for One Hour of Storytime!

One hour worth of stories on a subject matter of your choice told to you via a podcast!

$250.00 The Rope Wound Along The Road Art Book

An Artist Portfolio Book in a limited edition of twenty five. 

This portfolio book is comprised of ten individual erotic images of bodies and the rope that adorns them. Every book will be created by hand bound by me. 

The pictures will feature a variety of bodies and ethnicities bound in both urban and wild environments. These will be gathered throughout my travels in different countries. Each image will have a poem or text that comes directly from that specific individual's rope experience. 

$500.00 Custom Tattoo Design!

One piece of design work created just for you. Includes the original art and a high quality scan.

$1000.00 Living Vicariously!

Live vicariously through me! I will fly to the European city of your choice and devote four days to seeing, experiencing, photographing, writing, and sharing everything about it with you via my Blog and other social media!

I have no idea who might sponsor this. 

Maybe you are a curious patron who wants to see what I do with a city you have been to before. Or maybe you are using me as a scout! Showing you the beautiful and the not so beautiful as I weave you a different narrative of it than you would get from a tourist show or guide. Or perhaps you believe that by having me explore this one place that you will be able to change my life perspectives in a way that will forever change how I create, and so a gift to you is also a powerful patron gift to me.

You might be a person who will never get to see Europe. This could be for many reasons from fear of flying to physical or emotional limitations. You might be a person who wants to see their home again, but can't make the trip. 

Either way I would be honored to be the guide to your dreams.


Stretch Goals!

$2000.00 - WE MADE IT!!!!!!!!! YEAH!!!!!!! This means free things!

I will make the Medical Waste Conversation sticker sheets available for free download on my website, as well as two coloring page designs inspired by the Daughters of the Revolution Project! This way everyone who has helped by either spreading the word or contributing can celebrate the success of the campaign.


$2500.00 - Everyone who has contributed will receive the PDF book and audio file for the Forest Fates Collaboration!


$3000.00 - I will create and have available on my website for download a printable tiny cookbook with recipes from my travels and assembly instructions. Casa De Mallow on the road! Mmm...delicious!

$4000.00 - I will have two special downloadable posters made of me as the model, one safe for work, and one not so safe.

$5000.00 - ...I just explode. Like Grr. 

I will think of something, I promise.


The Impact

The ability to be able to research, work, construct, and gather for an entire summer is immeasurable in its importance at this place in my career. I have spent the last five years honing, learning, and gathering techniques and knowledge to be able to fulfill this goal.

The end result is that me, a high school drop out, will be graduating with a Master of Fine Arts from the University of Edinburgh, one of the most respected universities in the world. That I can be as out about being bisexual, kinky, polyamourous, as I am about being a spiritual healer, sex educator, and activist. That I will be able to be a self employed craftsman, creator, and storyteller. That I will be able to utilize and celebrate the diversity of skills and life experiences I have worked hard to acquire. 

The end result is that I will be in an exponentially better place to continue to do what I have always done: change the world, a little bit at a time. Sometimes it's one person, sometimes its a whole group. With the foundations being built right now I hope to bring my brand of inclusive experience and community based art practice to a world stage.

By giving me this very precious opportunity, you are helping to make that happen.

Thank you, from my soul and heart to yours.

Risks & Challenges

Risks are fairly minimal, but I am a person who wanders at night, talks to strangers, and is easily seduced into unfamiliar bookstores. This is part of how I meet the people and have the experiences that help shape my travels and work. It is how I collect intimate moments and real stories to share. It is a risky way to live and for me it is simply how I do life.

That being said, I have offset this with the safety nets of staying with people I know when I can, making local contacts who speak the languages of the places I'm visiting, and staying in places recommended by women and GLBT communities when I can't.

The unforeseeable things that may happen: transportation strikes, political rallies or riots, hikes in postage, abduction by aliens, or I may fall into a fairy revel. Most of this will probably not occur where I am traveling to. Probably. (Ireland...I'm watching you...). 

The only one that I can directly do anything about is say you will not be charged more due to postage increases or miscalculations on my part. If delays in production occur you will be immediately contacted and will get your perk as soon as I can provide it.


Other Ways You Can Help

We live in challenging times right now, both financially and circumstance wise. Sometimes the choice of putting food on our tables, or helping a friend in dire circumstance beats out helping a friend with their beginning art endeavors. I completely understand, truly, I do.

If, however, you find yourself wanting to support me and cannot financially help, please share my campaign! Tell people why it would be amazing to help me out!

Then, please continue to read my blog and watch my social media. Join in the conversations and be a part of the experience. That also contributes and helps by sharing my adventures with me.

Thank you again, and again, and again!

Coral Mallow 

www.coralmallow.com

story:
NO-FI BAND

Los Angeles acid-punk band seeking to fund recording and release of debut LP.

What We Need

No-Fi needs your help! We are about half way done with recording our debut LP but due to some unfortunate circumstances we have lost the ability to record at the studio where the first half of the album was tracked and need your help to finish the job!
story_txt: NO-FI BAND Los Angeles acid-punk band seeking to fund recording and release of debut LP.   What We Need No-Fi needs your help! We are about half way done with recording our debut LP but due to some unfortunate circumstances we have lost the ability to record at the studio where the first half of the album was tracked and need your help to finish the job!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone! 

The name is Giovanni Cardenas, I was born and raised in Long Beach, California & I am preparing to graduate from Pratt Institute in NYC. 

Growing up in Long Beach instilled an interest in engaging and observing active lifestyles. I have a passion for sports + outdoor activities, and am dedicated to documenting its progression. I have an extensive background in traditional photographic techniques, and hope to bring this knowledge to my professional practice. I recently switched from the Photography program to the Arts + Design Education program to help others further their interests.  I have sacrificed my opportunity to have a Senior thesis show with Pratt's photo department, but would still like to showcase my years of undergraduate work.  As a graduating senior in my last semester, I would say that the education I received has prepared me to establish myself as a photographer and educator. I fortunately was able to acquire a space to showcase some of my recent work + a collection I completed in 2013. The location is close in proximity to Pratt, a great local bar, and one of my personal favorites. The Emerson in Clinton Hill has graciously offered their wonderful space for my own graduation solo exhibition! (This show will be the first two weeks of may and my last send off to my graduation May 16th!)  

Hola a todos !
El nombre es Giovanni Cárdenas, yo nací y crecí en Long Beach , California y me estoy preparando para graduarse de Pratt Institute en Nueva York.
Creció en Long Beach inculcó el interés por participar y observar los estilos de vida activos. Tengo una pasión por los deportes + actividades al aire libre , y estoy dedicado a documentar su progresión. Tengo una amplia experiencia en las técnicas fotográficas tradicionales , y espero poder llevar este conocimiento a mi práctica profesional. Recientemente he pasado por el programa de Fotografía con el programa de Arte + Diseño Educación para ayudar a otros avanzar en sus intereses . He sacrificado mi oportunidad de tener un espectáculo de Tesis mayor con el departamento de fotografía de Pratt , pero aún así desea mostrar mis años de estudios universitarios . Como mayor de graduación en mi último semestre, yo diría que la educación que recibí me ha preparado para establecerme como un fotógrafo y educador. Yo , afortunadamente, pude adquirir un espacio para mostrar un poco de mi trabajo reciente + una colección que terminé en 2013 . El espacio está cerca en la proximidad de Pratt, un gran bar local, y uno de mis favoritos personales. El Emerson en Clinton Hill ha ofrecido amablemente su espacio maravilloso para mi propia graduación exposición individual ! ( Este espectáculo será las primeras dos semanas de mayo i  mi última enviarme a mi graduación 16 de mayo !)
                                   But to make it happen I'll need your help!


What We Need & What You Get

What it takes to curate a show and what your wonderful donations will go towards:

  • Printing- Thats done by me, free of charge!
  • Paper - The shows require two different paper types. One for the exhibition and paper for your 5x7's $200
  • Framing & Matting - (My largest expense...) $350
  • Show advertising & Take away promotional materials-$160 
  • Transportation of prints $50
  • Shipping Costs $100
  • Check out the Perks! They are well worth it! I promise! 

****this is a flexible raising plan so I will be able to use whatever I raise so every donation matter and will be reflected in the presentation and a list of contributors will be placed in the Exhibition

The Impact

What your contributions are also going towards!

  • Well first and foremost, this will have the greatest impact on me, not only will this be my first solo show, this will help validate all the work I have put in over the years at Pratt, it will be a show in where I am able to display some of the work that drives me to keep taking photographs everyday. It's public and in a high traffic area! (Who doesn't love coming to a bar and seeing some great photographs? and Sports photos at that?!)
  • It will make a huge difference in my final presentation, I'm graduating college, and I truly wish to represent myself as a professional.  
  • And lastly your contribution will impact the local NYC Art scene by providing a unique perspective + a collection of photographs to share with everyone!


Other Ways You Can Help
Feel free to send this link to fellow sport aficionados, people interested in Photography, or anyone you think might be interested! Any donation or support is really appreciated. Thanks for taking the time to read! Have a good day.

Best,

-Giovanni Cardenas
story_txt:
Short SummaryHello everyone! The name is Giovanni Cardenas, I was born and raised in Long Beach, California & I am preparing to graduate from Pratt Institute in NYC. Growing up in Long Beach instilled an interest in engaging and observing active lifestyles. I have a passion for sports + outdoor activities, and am dedicated to documenting its progression. I have an extensive background in traditional photographic techniques, and hope to bring this knowledge to my professional practice. I recently switched from the Photography program to the Arts + Design Education program to help others further their interests.  I have sacrificed my opportunity to have a Senior thesis show with Pratt's photo department, but would still like to showcase my years of undergraduate work.  As a graduating senior in my last semester, I would say that the education I received has prepared me to establish myself as a photographer and educator. I fortunately was able to acquire a space to showcase some of my recent work + a collection I completed in 2013. The location is close in proximity to Pratt, a great local bar, and one of my personal favorites. The Emerson in Clinton Hill has graciously offered their wonderful space for my own graduation solo exhibition! (This show will be the first two weeks of may and my last send off to my graduation May 16th!)  Hola a todos !El nombre es Giovanni Cárdenas, yo nací y crecí en Long Beach , California y me estoy preparando para graduarse de Pratt Institute en Nueva York.Creció en Long Beach inculcó el interés por participar y observar los estilos de vida activos. Tengo una pasión por los deportes + actividades al aire libre , y estoy dedicado a documentar su progresión. Tengo una amplia experiencia en las técnicas fotográficas tradicionales , y espero poder llevar este conocimiento a mi práctica profesional. Recientemente he pasado por el programa de Fotografía con el programa de Arte + Diseño Educación para ayudar a otros avanzar en sus intereses . He sacrificado mi oportunidad de tener un espectáculo de Tesis mayor con el departamento de fotografía de Pratt , pero aún así desea mostrar mis años de estudios universitarios . Como mayor de graduación en mi último semestre, yo diría que la educación que recibí me ha preparado para establecerme como un fotógrafo y educador. Yo , afortunadamente, pude adquirir un espacio para mostrar un poco de mi trabajo reciente + una colección que terminé en 2013 . El espacio está cerca en la proximidad de Pratt, un gran bar local, y uno de mis favoritos personales. El Emerson en Clinton Hill ha ofrecido amablemente su espacio maravilloso para mi propia graduación exposición individual ! ( Este espectáculo será las primeras dos semanas de mayo i  mi última enviarme a mi graduación 16 de mayo !)                                   But to make it happen I'll need your help!
What We Need & What You GetWhat it takes to curate a show and what your wonderful donations will go towards:
Printing- Thats done by me, free of charge!
Paper - The shows require two different paper types. One for the exhibition and paper for your 5x7's $200

Framing & Matting - (My largest expense...) $350

Show advertising & Take away promotional materials-$160 
Transportation of prints $50

Shipping Costs $100

Check out the Perks! They are well worth it! I promise! 

****this is a flexible raising plan so I will be able to use whatever I raise so every donation matter and will be reflected in the presentation and a list of contributors will be placed in the ExhibitionThe ImpactWhat your contributions are also going towards!
Well first and foremost, this will have the greatest impact on me, not only will this be my first solo show, this will help validate all the work I have put in over the years at Pratt, it will be a show in where I am able to display some of the work that drives me to keep taking photographs everyday. It's public and in a high traffic area! (Who doesn't love coming to a bar and seeing some great photographs? and Sports photos at that?!)
It will make a huge difference in my final presentation, I'm graduating college, and I truly wish to represent myself as a professional.  
And lastly your contribution will impact the local NYC Art scene by providing a unique perspective + a collection of photographs to share with everyone!

Other Ways You Can Help
Feel free to send this link to fellow sport aficionados, people interested in Photography, or anyone you think might be interested! Any donation or support is really appreciated. Thanks for taking the time to read! Have a good day.
Best,-Giovanni Cardenas
